div0.head: *r
div0.entryFree: *r r, r(w=, to/, indecl., twentieth (later seventeenth) letter of the Gr. alphabet: as numeral r/ = 100, but r' = 100,000: reckoned as a semivowel by Arist.Po.1456b28: the name r(w= occurs in Ar.Th. 781, Callias ap.Ath.10.453d, Pl.Cra.426c, BCH29.483 (Delos), etc.

r(a/ [a^], enclit. Particle, Ep. for a)/ra (q.v.), freq. in Hom.and Pi.; less freq. in Trag. (lyr.), h)= r(a A.Pers.633, S.Aj.172; h)/ r(a ib.177, B. 18.33.—This and ka are the only monosyll. Particles not ending in e which allow elision.

r(a=, Adv.
easily, Alcm.42, S.Fr.1086, Ion Trag.66. [Codd. vary between r(a= and r(a/|; only r(a/| （r(a/i) seems to be admitted by A.D.Adv. 156.8, Eust.163.20, but r(a= is prob. correct Attic and Dor. for *r(a_a^ whence Ep. *r(h=a (written r(ei=a in Hom. but r(h/a in Alc.Supp.12.7), later Ion. r(e/a (q.v.); cf. Aeol. bra=|.]

r(a=, to/,
rhubarb, Rheum officinale, Dsc.3.2; growing near the river Rha (mod. Volga), whence its name acc. to Amm.Marc.22.8.28; cf. r(h=on.
r(a/as: r(eu/mata, Hsch.

r(a^ba/ssw, Att. pw/t-ttw,= r(a/ssw, a)ra/ssw,
make a noise, esp.
by dancing or
beating time with the feet, Hsch., Phot.; cf. a)rraba/ssw.

r(abbi/,
O my Master, Hebr. word in Ev.Matt.23.7, al.; also r(abboni/ or r(abbouni/, Ev.Marc.10.51, Ev.Jo.20.16.

r(abdeu/omai,
angle as with a rod, v. r(abdi/on 1.2.
r(abdhfo/ros, on, poet. for r(abdofo/ros,= qursofo/ros, Lyc.1140.
r(a/bdida: ta\ didaskalei=a, Hsch.

r(abd-i/zw,
beat with a rod or
stick, cudgel, Ar.Lys.587, Pherecr.50, 2 Ep.Cor.11.25 (Pass.); r(. de/ndra
thresh trees, to bring down the fruit, Thphr.CP1.19.4 (Pass.), cf. PRyl.148.20 (i A.D.); e)la/as Thphr.CP 5.4.2; r(. [kriqa/s]
thresh out barley, LXX Ru.2.17; si=ton ib.Jd.6.11.

r(abd-i/on, to/, Dim. of r(a/bdos,
little rod or
shoot, Thphr.HP3.17.6, Dsc.1.14;
the wand of Hermes, Babr.117.9, Arr.Epict.3.20.12; a)po\ r(abdi/ou oi)aki/zesqai, of horses, Str.17.3.7.
divining-rod, LXX Ez.21.21 (26)(cod. A).
barbel or
filament appended to the lips of certain fishes, which are said r(abdeu/esqai toi=s e)n tw=| sto/mati, a(\ kalou=sin oi( a(liei=s r(abdi/a Arist.HA620b32.
iron stile, used in encaustic painting, Plu.2.568a, Ath.15.687b. r(abdi/a a)konti/wn perh. javelin
shafts, BCH35.16 (Delian inventory). teacher's
pointer (or = r(a/bdos 1.7), Eudem. ap. Simp.in Ph.732.32. = a(/limon, Ps.-Dsc.1.91.

r(abd-ismo/s, o(,
winnowing, threshing, PTeb.119.46 (ii B.C.).

r(abd-isth/s, ou=, o(,
thresher, BGU115i15 (ii A.D.), Sammelb. 5124.103 (ii A.D.), al.

r(abdo-di/aitos [i^], on,
living by the painter's stile (r(abdi/on 1.3), epith. of Parrhasius, a parody on a(brodi/aitos, Ath.12.543d, 15.687c.

r(abdo-eidh/s, e/s,
striped, po/a Dsc.3.97; a)/nqos Gp.12.37; go/mfoi v.l. for labd- in Hippiatr.96.

r(abdo-mantei/a, h(,
divination by a wand, Gloss.

r(abdo-ma^xi/a, h(,
fighting with a staff or
foil, Plu.Alex.4.

r(abdo-nome/w,
to be r(abdono/mos,
sit as umpire, S.Tr.516 (lyr.).

r(abdo-no/mos, on, (ne/mw)
wielding a rod or
wand: hence of the Roman
lictors, Plu.Aem.32;
umpire, Hsch.

r(abdo/-omai, Pass.,
to be striped (cf. r(a/bdos 111), Lyd. Mag.1.7.

r(a/bdos, h(,
rod, wand, Hom. (v. infr.), etc.; lighter than the bakthri/a or walking-stick, X.Eq.11.4 (but = bakthri/a, Ev.Matt.10.10, al.). —Special uses:
magic wand, as that of Circe, Od.10.238, 319, etc.; that with which Athena touched Odysseus, to restore his youthful appearance, xrusei/h| r(a/bdw| e)pema/ssato 16.172; that with which Hermes overpowers the senses of man, Il.24.343; that with which Hades rules the ghosts, Pi.O.9.33;
divining-rod, Hdt.4.67.
fishing-rod, Od.12.251.
limed twig, for catching small birds, Ar.Av.527.
shaft of a hunting-spear, X.Cyn.10.3,16.
staff of office, like the earlier skh=ptron, Pl.Ax.367a, LXX Ps.44(45).7, 109(110).2; carried by a brabeuth/s, Phld.Vit.p.25J.:— dub. in A.Supp.248 for r(abdou=xos.
wand borne by the r(ayw|do/s, to\n e)pi\ r(a/bdw| mu=qon u(faino/menon Call.Fr.138 ( = Fr.3.10P.), cf. Paus. 9.30.3: hence kata\ r(a/bdon e)pe/wn according to the
measure of his (Homer's) verses, Pi.I.4(3).38(56).
rod for chastisement, r(. kosmou=sa Pl.Lg.700c; ma/stic h)\ r(.
riding-switch, X.Eq.8.4; r(. bohla/tis ox-
goad, APl.4.200 (Mosch.); cai/nesqai r(a/bdois Plu.Alex.51, cf. AP 11.153 (Lucill.): of the
fasces of the Roman lictors, Plb.11.29.6, D.H.4.11, Str.5.2.2, Plu.Publ.10, Luc.36; pro\s pe/nte r(a/bdous, = Lat.
at (i.e.
ad) quinque fasces (CIL8.7044 (Numidia)), OGI543.18 (Ancyra, ii A.D.), IGRom.3.175 (ibid., ii A.D.); cf. r(abdono/mos, r(abdou=xos.
shepherd's staff or
crook, LXXPs.22(23).4, Mi.7.14. r(. klhronomi/as
measuring-rod, ib.Ps.73(74).2.
stitch, e)/ntosqen de\ boei/as r(a/ye qameia\s xrusei/h|s r(a/bdoisi dihneke/sin peri\ ku/klon Il.12.297 (unless it means
rivets, studs).
young shoot of some trees, Ion Trag.40, Thphr.HP2.1.2.
streak or
stripe on the skin of animals, diapoi/kila r(a/bdois Arist.HA525a12; of fish, Clearch. 73; of clothes, Poll.7.53;
fluting of a column, Supp.Epigr.4.448.7 (Didyma, ii B.C., pl.); of minerals,
vein, Thphr.CP4.12.6, D.S.5.37;
streak or
shaft of light, Arist.Mete.377a30, Mu.395a31, Thphr.Sign.11. in Gramm.,
line, verse, Sch.Pi.I.4.63.
a critical mark, like o)belo/s, Hsch.
stroke forming a letter, Theodect.6.6.

r(abdoux-e/w,
to be a r(abdou=xos,
carry a rod or
wand, esp. as a badge
of office, Hippias Erythr. ap. Ath.6.259d; of the Roman lictors,
bear the fasces, D.C.48.43:—Pass.,
have the fasces borne before one, Plu. Num.10.

r(abdoux-i/a, h(,
office or
duties of a r(abdou=xos, BGU244.14 (iii A.D.), POxy.1626.21 (iv A.D.): at Rome,
the insignia of the lictor, fasces, Plu.Fab.4, Cic.16.

r(a/bdoux-os (properisp.), o(,
one who carries a rod or
staff of office:
judge, umpire at a contest, Pl.Prt.338a.
magistrate's attendant, staff-bearer, beadle, Ar.Pax734, UPZ3.6 (ii B.C., prob.), IG9(2).735 (Larissa, iii B.C.), 1109.24 (Coropa, ii B.C.), Act.Ap.16.35; so, prob., in Th.5.50: esp. at Rome, of the
lictors who carried the fasces, Plb.5.26.10, etc.: also r(abdou=xoi, ai(,
female attendants on Oenanthe, mother of Agathocles, Id.15.29.13.

r(abdofor-e/w,
carry a wand or
stick, Str.16.4.25.

r(abdofor-i/a, h(,
office of r(abdofo/ros, IG22.1368.131 (ii A.D.).

r(abdofor-ixo/n, to/, a tax in Egypt, prob.
police-tax, Ostr.Bodl.1.14,17 (iii B.C.).

r(abdo/for-os (parox.), on,
carrying a rod or
staff: = r(abdou=xos 2, at Athens, a sort of
beadle or
constable, Sch.Ar.Pax733 (pl.); in Egypt, PSI4.332.11 (iii B.C.), PPetr.3p.340 (iii B.C.), PCair.Zen.753.73 (pl., iii B.C.); of officials at games, IG7.3078 (Lebad., i B.C.); in the mysteries, ib.5(1).1390.41 (Andania, i B.C.); at Rome,
lictor, Plb.10.32.2. Astrol., of
the planets (h(/lios being the basileu/s), Sch.A.R.4.262, cf. S.E.M. 5.31.
r(abd-w|di/a, r(abd-w|do/s, v. r(ayw|do/s.

r(a/bd-wma, atos, to/,
rod or
bundle of rods, Hsch. s.v. skuta/lia.

r(a/bd-wsis, ews, h(,
fluting of columns, etc., IG12.374.194, al., Arist.EN1174a24 (misunderstood by Mich. in EN 552.3), Rev.Phil.50.67 (Didyma, ii B.C.), Aristeas 64,74, J.AJ12.2.9. =
virgultum, dub. in Gloss.

r(abd-wto/s, h/, o/n, (as if from r(abdo/w, cf. r(a/bdos)
made or
plaited with rods, r(. qu/rai
wicker hurdles, D.S.3.22. (r(a/bdos 111)
striped, i(ma/tia X.Cyr.8.3.16; of shells,
ribbed, fluted, keeled, Arist.HA528a25, Fr.304; so of a cup,
ribbed, IG11(2).162 B26 (Delos, iii B.C.), Polem.Hist.60.
r(a/ga: a)kmh/, bi/a, o(rmh/, Hsch.; but r(agh/ is similarly glossed in Erot.Fr.31.
r(a^ga/dion, to/, Dim. of r(aga/s, Cels.6.18.7.
r(a/ganon: r(a/|dion, *qou/rioi, Hsch.

r(agd-ai=os, a, on, (r(a/gdhn)
furious, violent, of rain-storms, Arist. Mete.349a6, Aud.803a5, Plu.Tim.28, Luc.Tim.3; of lightning, Philostr.Im.1.14. Adv. -ai/ws Aristid.Quint.2.11. of persons,
raging, furious, Telecl.30, Ar.Fr.243, Antiph.7; w(s r(. e)celh/luqen Diph.67; r(. e)n toi=s a)gw=si Plu.Pel.1: to\ r(.
violence, Id.2.447a, 456c. Adv. -ai/ws
violently, a)naxei=n Dsc.2.74; u(/ein, metaph. of a talkative woman, Lib.Decl.26.22.

r(agd-aio/ths, htos, h(,
violence, fury, Poll.4.22.

r(a/gd-hn, Adv., (r(a/ssw)
in torrents, Plu.2.418e codd. (dra/gdhn Wyttenbach).
r(a^gh/, h(,= r(aga/s, r(h=gma, Hp.Nat.Puer.12, al.; cf. r(a/ga.

r(a_g-i/zw, (r(a/c)
gather grapes, Theoc.5.113.

r(a_g-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of berries or
grapes, Thphr.HP3.18.12.

r(a_g-i/on, to/, Dim. of r(a/c, EM 705.52 (Gaisf. r(agi/). a poisonous
spider, Philum.Ven.15.1, Aët.13.20; cf. r(w/c.

r(a_goeidh/s, e/s,
like berries or
grapes: r(. xitw/n in the eye,
the choroid membrane, but including the iris, Herophil. ap. [Ruf.]Anat.13, Ruf. Onom.153, Gal.UP10.4, Poll.2.70.

r(a^go/eis, essa, en, (r(agh/)
torn, rent, burst, de/ros Nic.Th.821.

r(a_golog-i/a, h(,
gathering of berries or
grapes, Suid. s.v. e)pifulli/da.

r(a_go/log-os (parox.), on,
gathering berries or
grapes, e)xi=nos AP 6.45.

r(a^go/pous, podos, o(, h(,
with chapped feet, EM810.28.
r(a/gos, to/,= r(a/kos, PStrassb.21.24, al. (ii A.D.).
r(a^go/w, only in EM703.3, and Suid., r(agw=sai: temei=n, prob. f.l. for r(akw=sai.
r(a_gw/dhs, es,= r(agoeidh/s, Thphr.HP6.2.9, 7.15.4.

r(a^gw/dhs, es,
rimosus, Gloss.

r(a^da^lo/s, h/, o/n, v. r(odano/s. r(adamei=: blasta/nei, Hsch. r(a/damnos, v. o)ro/damnos. r(a^damnw/dhs, es,
like a young shoot, Sch.Nic. Th.543. r(adana=tai: plana=tai, Hsch. r(ada/nh: kro/kh, o(moi/ws r(oda/nh, Id. r(a^da^ni/zw, v. r(oda/nh. r(a^da^no/s, v. r(odano/s. r(adanw=roi: oi( tw=n laxa/nwn khpouroi/, *taranti=noi, Id. r(ade/s: to\ a)mfote/rws e)gkeklime/non, Id.

r(a/|dia, ta/, a kind of
easy shoes, Pherecr.227, Pl.Com.251.

r(adina/kh, h(, Persian name for
a black strong-smelling petroleum, found at Ardericca near Susa, Hdt.6.119.

r(a^di^no/s, h/, o/n, Aeol. bra/di^nos [a^], a, on, poet. Adj.
slender, taper, i(ma/sqlh Il.23.583; a)/kontes Stesich.53; ki/ones Ibyc.58; of plants, o)/rpac Sapph.104; foi=nic Thgn.6; kupa/rissoi Theoc.11.45, 27.46. of the limbs or body,
taper, slim, slender, po/des h.Cer.183, Hes.Th.195; xei=res Thgn.1002, cf. Ath.Mitt.17.272 (Athens, ii A.D.); mhroi/ Anacr. 66; pw=loi Id.165 (unless in signf. 3); bradi/nan *)afrodi/tan Sapph.90; pai=s Theoc.10.24; sw/mata X.Lac.2.5; r(. tw=| mh/kei tou= sw/matos Plu.2.723d; of the neck, Aret.SD1.8; tra/xhlos AP5.131 (Phld.); pte/ruges (of a cicada) ib.7.200 (Nic.). generally,
soft, tender, r(adinh=| th=| ko/mh|, of ivy, Ach.Tat.1.15; de/rma proba/tou w(s o(/ti r(adinw/taton Id.3.21: metaph.,
tender or
mobile, o)/sse A.Pr.401 (lyr.); and the Gramm. (Sch.A. l.c.) give eu)ki/nhtos among other interpretations.

r(a/dic [a_], i_kos, o(,
branch, Nic.Th.378,533, Al.57,331; of the palm,
frond, D.S.2.53. (Cf. Lat.
radix.）

r(a/|dios (r(aid- correctly in early texts, PCair.Zen.367.20 (iii B.C.), etc., later r(ad-, Diog.Oen.10, etc.), a, on: Ep. and Ion. r(hi/+dios [i^d], h, on, as always in Hom.; r(h/|dios, h, on, Thgn.574,577 (v. infr. B):—Degrees of Comparison: r(a|diw/teros is cited from Hyp. by Poll.5.107, perhaps by error for r(a|die/steros, which occurs in Hyp. Fr.86, Arist.Pr.870b37 (as Adv.), Plb.11.1.1, 16.20.4. Adv. -e/stata Ph.Bel.96.33:—but the form r(a/|wn, r(a=|on is more common, Th.5.36, etc.; Ion. r(hi/+wn, r(h/i+on, (v. infr. B); Ep. r(hi/+teros Il.18.258, 24.243, etc.; contr. r(h/|teros Thgn.1370; Dor. r(a/|teros Pi.O.8.60 (r(ai/+teron codd.); a form r(a/|sswn in EM158.15: r(a|o/teron, gloss on eu)pete/steron, Erot.p.35 N.: Sup., Att. r(a=|stos, h, on; Dor. r(a/i+stos Theoc.11.7 (Adv.); Ion. and Ep. r(h/i+stos Od.4.565; contr. r(h=|stos Timo 67.2 (Adv.); Ep. r(hi/+tatos, v. infr. B. 111 fin.: (v. r(a=, r(e/a, r(ei=a):—
easy, ready, and so
easy to make or
do, opp. xalepo/s (Arist.Rh.1363a23); r(hi/+dio/n ti e)/pos a word
easy to understand and follow, Od.11.146, cf. h.Ap.534; oi)=mos r(hi+di/h an
easy road, Hes.Op.292; taxu\s ga\r *(/aidhs r(a=|stos a)ndri\ dustuxei=, i. e. least painful, E.Hipp.1047: c. inf., ta/fros perh=sai r(hi+di/h
easy to pass over, Il.12.54; r(hi/+teroi polemi/zein h)=san *)axaioi/
easier to fight with, 18.258; r(hi/+teroi . . *)axaioi=sin e)naire/men
easier for them to slay, 24.243; ou) r(hi/+di' e)sti\ qew=n e)rikude/a dw=ra a)ndra/si ge qnhtoi=si damh/menai 20.265; r(a/|oni a)\n e)xrw/meqa tw=| *fili/ppw| we should have found P.
easier to resist, D.1.9. r(a/|dio/n e)sti it is
easy, c. inf., r(a/|dion po/lin sei=sai kai\ a)faurote/rois Pi.P.4.272; toi=s ga\r dikai/ois a)nte/xein ou) r(a/|dion S.Fr.78, cf. Ph.1395, Ar.Th.68, Th. 6.21, etc.: c. acc. et inf., tu/rannon eu)sebei=n ou) r(a/|dion S.Aj.1350, cf. X.HG6.2.10; xalepo\n to\ poiei=n, to\ de\ keleu=sai r(. Philem.27; to\ e)pitima=n r(. kai\ panto\s ei)=nai D.1.16; r(a=|on parainei=n h)\ paqo/nta karterei=n Men.Mon.471, etc.: r(a=|stoi/ ei)sin a)mu/nesqai,= r(a/|dio/n e)stin au)tou\s a)mu/nesqai, Th.4.10; r(a=|stai e)s to\ bla/ptesqai (sc. ai( nh=es) Id.7.67. also r(a/|dio/n e)sti it is
a light matter, you think little of doing, par' u(mi=n r(. cenoktonei=n E.Hec.1247. Adv. phrase, e)k r(a|di/as
easily, Plot. 4.8.1.
easy-going, adaptable, r(. h)/qea E.Hipp.1116 (lyr.); in bad sense,
reckless, unscrupulous, r(. to\n tro/pon Luc.Merc.Cond.40, cf. Alex.4; r(. tw\ o)fqalmw/
having a roving eye, Alciphr.1.6; cf. B. 1.2, r(a|diourgo/s. r(a/|wn gene/sqai to be
easier, get
better, of a sick person, Hp.Loc.Hom.34; w(sperei\ r(. e)/somai shall feel
easier, better, D.45.57; tau=t' h)\n poih=|s, r(. e)/sei Theopomp.Com.62; *eu)ripi/dou mnh/sqhti, kai\ r(. e)/sei Philippid.18. Adv. r(a|di/ws, Aeol. brai+di/ws Theoc.30.27; Ep. and Ion. r(hi+di/ws, as always in Hom.; r(hdi/ws Herod.7.69:—
easily, readily, Il.4.390, al., Hes.Op.43, Hdt.9.2, etc.; in Trag. and Att. freq. r(a|di/ws fe/rein bear
lightly or
with equanimity, make
light of a thing, E.Andr.744, etc.; r(. prosi/statai ib.232; r(. a)polei/pein to leave
not unwillingly, Th. 1.2; r(a|di/ws a)palla/ttointo au)tw=n Pl.Phd.63a. in bad sense,
lightly, recklessly, r(. peri\ mega/lwn bouleu/esqai Th.1.73, cf. Pl.Lg.917b; r(a|di/ws ou(/tws
in this
easy, thoughtless way, Id.R.377b, 378a; r(. tolmw=si le/gein Lys.19.49. of things, tala/ntou r(a|di/ws a)/cios
easily, fully worth a talent, Is.8.35; ou) r(.
hardly, scarcely, Plu.Lyc.31, cf. 2.39b. Comp., r(a=|on fe/rein Th.8.89; r(. o)mnu/nai ka)piorkei=n h)\ o(tiou=n nothing so
easy, D.54.39; Ion. r(h/i+on Hp.Int.12; also r(hi+te/rws, Id.Mul.1.1,26. Sup. r(a=|sta, esp. in phrases, r(a=|sta fe/rein S.OT983; w(s r(a=|sta fe/rein A.Pr.104, E.Hel.254, cf. Supp.954, etc.; r(. te kai\ h(/dista bioteu/ein X.Mem.2.1.9; later, e)k tou= r(a/|stou D.H. Comp.25, Plu.Fab.11: Ep. r(hi/+tata Od.19.577.

r(a|diourg-e/w,
do things with ease or
offhand, oi(=a polla\ h( qeo\s (sc. *eu)xh/） r(. Luc.Herm.71.
act thoughtlessly or
recklessly, do wrong, play the rogue, kle/ptei, telwnei=, r(a|diourgei= Apollod.Com.13.13, cf. Plu.2.602a; r(. e)n tai=s e)fhmeri/si
make fraudulent entries, ib.829d; of writers on Alexander the Great, Str.11.6.4: c. acc., e)pistola/s J. Vit.65:—Pass., PTeb.42.16 (ii B.C.), diaqh/kh e)radiourghme/nh PVat. 11r.7.41 (ii A.D.).
live a lazy life, take things easily, opp. pronoei=n, filoponei=n, X.Cyr.1.6.8, 2.1.25, 8.4.5, Oec.20.17, Hier.8.9, etc.:—Pass., gnou\s plei=sta (v.l. plei/stous） r(a|diourgei=sqai Id.Lac.5.2. c. acc.,
treat slightingly, neglect, th\n a)lh/qeian Philostr. Im.1.12.

r(a|diou/rg-hma, atos, to/,
misdeed, villany. D.H.1.77, Act.Ap.18.14, Plu.Pyrrh.6.

r(a|diourg-i/a, h(,
self-indulgence, X.Cyr.1.6.34 (prob. the interpr. eu)koli/a in Phot., Suid., etc., refers to this passage).
laziness, sloth, ib.7.5.74, Mem.2.1.20.
knavery, PEnteux.30.11 (iii B.C.), Plb.12.9.5, 13.4.4; do/los kai\ r(. Act.Ap.13.10, etc.; of historians, Plb.12.25E.2;
fraud, Plu.Cat.Mi.16.

r(a|diourg-o/s, o/n, prop.
doing things easily, only in bad sense,
unscrupulous, reckless, r(. ei)=nai e)n toi=s lo/gois kai\ e)n toi=s e)/rgois Arist.VV1251a20: as Subst.,
knave, rogue, Plb.4.29.4, Supp.Epigr.2.292.9 (Delph., i B.C.), Plu.2.602a, Arr.Epict.3.22.93; esp. for plastogra/fos,
forger, Hsch., Phot., Suid. of things, opp. a(gno/s,
impure, qusi/ai -o/terai X.Smp. 8.9: Adv. Comp. -o/teron in this sense, Arr.An.2.5.4.

r(a/dis, o(, (Lat.
radius) spoke of a wheel, r(. toroneuto/s Edict.Diocl. 15.5.

r(a/zw,= r(u/zw (q.v.),
snarl, as a dog, metaph. of men, Cratin. 25.

r(a^qa^g-e/w,
make a noise, Hsch. s.v. e)rraqa/gei.
r(a^/qa^g-os, o(,= r(o/qos, Sch.Nic.Th.194, Hsch.
r(a^qai/nw,= r(ai/nw, Hsch. (Pass.); but in Phot.,= spei/rw, as Hsch. expl. r(ana/w (v. r(ana=tai). r(aqa/mh: r(astw/nh, r(a|qumi/a, Hsch.

r(a^qa/migc [qa^], iggos, h(,
drop, Il.11.536, Hes.Th.183, Pi.Pae.7.9, Zos.Alch.p.175 B. of solids,
grain, bit, koni/hs r(aqa/migges Il.23.502.
spot, speckle, Opp.C.2.559,3.299.
r(a^qa^mi/zw,= r(ai/nw, Opp.H.5.657 (Pass.), Nonn.D.6.256.
r(a^qa/ssw, = r(ai/nw, in Pass., Hsch., Phot. = plh/ssw, Hsch. (Pass.). r(aqmi/zesqai: r(ai/nesqai, Id.

r(a_qu_m-e/w,
leave off work, take holiday, Plb.10.20.2, Plu.Sull.26. mostly in bad sense,
to be remiss, be idle, X.An.2.6.6, Isoc.1.9, Phib. 1.46.12 (iii B.C.), etc.; r(. e)pi/ tini D.19.270; peri/ tinos Plb.2.49.9; ta\ peri\ ta\s fulaka/s D.S.2.18; peri\ th\n fulakh/n Id.14.88. trans.,
neglect, a)mpexo/nh ou)k e)rraqumhme/nh Lib.Or.11.154, cf. 60.5, Descr.29.4. [Freq. written r(a|q- in codd., but r(aq- correctly in PCair.Zen.57.6 (iii B.C.), PHib. l.c., Phld.Lib.p.24 O.; katar（r）aq- PCair.Zen. 408.11 (iii B.C.), PHib.1.44.4 (iii B.C.).]

r(a_qu_m-hte/on, verb. Adj.
one must be careless, Lib.Decl.47.38.

r(a_qu_m-i/a, h(,
easiness of temper, taking things easily, Th.2.39.
recreation, relaxation, amusement, E. Cyc.203, Ael.VH9.9: in pl., ai( r(. kai\ ai( a)poni/ai kai\ ai( a)me/leiai Arist. Rh.1370a14, cf. Isoc.9.42, 45, Plb.10.19.5. mostly in bad sense,
indifference, sluggishness, laziness, Lys.10.11, X.Mem.3.5.5, al., cf. D.9.5; e)kth/santo r(. get
a name for laziness, E.Med.218.
heedlessness, rashness, tou= lo/gou Pl.Phd.99b. [Written r(aq- correctly in Phld.Rh.2.31 S., Ir.p.60 W., Hom.p.28 O., IG5(1).1208.33 (Gythium, i A.D.); Ion. r(a|qumi/h is dub. in Hp.Acut.47 (cf. i p. lxxviii K.); this group of words is not found in Hdt. or other Ionic texts.]

r(a_/qu_m-os, on, (r(a=, qumo/s)
light-hearted, easy-tempered, frivolous, careless, w)= -o/tate Pl.Tht.166a. mostly in bad sense,
taking things easy, indifferent, S.El.958, Isoc.9.35; ou)dei\s ga\r w)\n r(. eu)kleh\s a)nh/r E.Fr.237.
slipshod, of literary style, Cic.QF2.15(16).5 (Comp.). of things,
care-free, easy, bi/os Isoc.4.108; -ota/th katafugh/ Id.11.45; ta\ -o/tata ai(rei=sqai Pl.Cri.45d, cf. Arist.Rh.1368b18. Adv. -mws
carelessly, Pl.Lg.659b, etc. much like r(a|di/ws,
lightly, with equanimity, r(. fe/rein And.4.23, Pl.R.549d; u(pofe/rein Id.Lg. 879c; r(. e)/xein Isoc.12.17; peri/ ti Plb.4.7.6: Comp. -o/teron Isoc. 6.56, 7.10; -ote/rws dia/gein Arist.Pol.1335b17; diakei/menoi Aen.Tact. 26.2. [r(aqumo/teros correctly in PSI5.522.4 (iii B.C.), but r(aiqumo/tate wrongly in cod. B of Pl.Tht. l.c. (fol. 93v).]
r(aqw/dhma: yeu=sma, Hsch. r(ai/an: u(gei/an, Id.; v. r(ai/+zw.

r(aibhdo/n, Adv., (r(aibo/s)
as if crooked, Euph.20.
r(aibi/as: a)zh/mios dh=mos, Hsch. (cf. r(amba/s).

r(aibo-eidh/s, e/s,
crooked-looking, Hp.Art.45, Mochl.1 (Sup.); cf. r(oikoeidh/s.

r(aibo/-kra_nos, on,
with crooked head, koru/na AP6.35 (Leon.).

r(aib-o/s, h/, o/n,
crooked, bent, esp. of
bandy legs (cf. sq.), to\ r(aibo/n Arist.SE182a2; cf. blaiso/s, r(oiko/s; also r(. gui=a Nic.Th.799; pa/gouroi ib.788; nhri=tai, dra/kwn, Lyc.238,917; mhro/s Gal.UP3.9.

r(aib-oskelh/s, e/s, (ske/los)
bandy-legged, pa/gouros AP6.196 (Stat. Flacc.).

r(aib-o/ths, htos, h(,
crookedness, Eust.914.47.

r(aib-o/w,
make crooked, bend, Lyc.563, prob. in 262:—Pass., Gal.UP3.9.

r(ai=d-a, h(,= Lat.
rhaeda, Edict.Diocl.15.33: gen. pl. written r(edw=n (v.l. r(aidw=n) in Apoc.18.13.
r(ai/d-ion, to/, Dim. of foreg., Gloss.; written r(e/dion in Hsch.

r(a_i/+zw, Ion. r(hi/+zw, (r(a=, r(a/|wn)
grow easier, more endurable, of ailments, Hp.Epid.2.3.18, 4.56, etc. of persons,
find relief from pain, recover from illness, Id.Fract.5,19, Pl.R.462d, D.1.13;
take one's rest, X.Cyr.7.5.68 (as v.l.): sts. c. gen., r(. po/nwn
rest from toil, Memn.4; r(. e)k no/sou Ach.Tat.4.16; cf. r(a/|dios 11.2. trans.,
make easier, alleviate an illness, Hp.Aph.5.25. [r(ai/+sai trisulla/bws *)attikoi\ to\ e)k no/sou a)nalabei=n, Hsch.; 3sg. aor. subj. r(aei/shi (sic) PCair.Zen.263.3 (iii B.C.), r(ai/+shi PHamb.27.8 (iii B.C.).]
r(aikakerei=s: strebloke/ratoi, Hsch. r(ai/keros: xalepo/s, Id.

r(ai/nw, Pi.I.8(7).50, Xenarch.7.7: fut. r(a^nw= Antiph.217.12, Lyc. 1104, but Att. also r(a_nw= (like fa_nw=) acc. to A.D.Adv.187.27: aor. e)/rra_na Arched.2.5, E.Rh.73, Cyc.402 (e)c-), Trag.Adesp.90; Ion. e)/rrhna Hp. (v. infr.); e)/rhna Opp.H.2.100: pf. e)/rragka （di-) LXX Pr.7.17:— Med., aor. e)rra_na/mhn （peri-) Aristobul.6 J., Plu.Arist.20, Longus 3.28:—Pass., aor. e)rra/nqhn Pi.P.5.100, Arist.Pr.938a35: pf. e)/rrammai Persae. ap. Ath.4.140f; later e)/rrasmai Sch.D Il.12.431.—Ep. aor. imper. r(a/ssate Od.20.150, 3pl. pf. Pass. e)rra/datai ib.354, plpf. e)rra/dato Il.12.431 [a^] are formed as if from pres. r(a/zw, cf. perirrai/nw 1.
sprinkle, besprinkle, with acc. of the object besprinkled, prop. with liquids, r(a/ssate (sc. dw=ma u(/dati) Od.20.150; r(a=non do/mous Com.Adesp.1211, cf. Thphr.CP4.3.3; u(/dati tou\s leipoyuxou=ntas Id.Fr.10.6; fo/nw| pedi/on Pi.I. l.c.; e)lai/w| r(h/nas Hp. Fract.21; e)k kalpi/dwn mu/rois r(. Plb.30.25.17:—Pass., pu/rgoi kai\ e)pa/lcies ai(/mati fwtw=n e)rra/dat' Il.12.431; ai(/mati d' e)rra/datai toi=xoi Od.20.354; ai(/mati bwmo\s e)rai/net' E.IA[1589]; ta\ pro/swpa dia\ to\ r(ai/nesqai me/lana gi/netai Arist.HA579a2. also of solids,
bestrew, besprinkle, [i(/ppoi] r(ai/nonto koni/h| Il.11.282; r(. xqo/na karpw=| Nonn.D.2.65. metaph., r(. tina\ u(/mnw|, na=son eu)logi/ais, Pi.P.8.57, I.6(5).21; qew=n . . o(/milon a)mbro/ta| r(ai/nois a moi/sa| IG42(1).130.24.
sprinkle, scatter, with acc. of the thing scattered or sprinkled, r(anw= te pedo/s' e)gke/falon
will scatter it on the ground, E.Fr.384 (dub. l.); r(ai/nein
sprinkle (water) on the fish, Xenarch. l.c.; r(ai/nein o)ci/das e)s ta\ ble/fara
sprinkle vinegar in their eyes, Ar.Ra.1441; r(. purou/s Opp.H.2.100; xoa/s Lyc.1185. abs.,
sprinkle water, Arist. HA620a12; r(ani/si r(.
let water fall in drops, Id.Mete.374b1.
r(ai+ci/a: to/pos i)/dios i)atrou= e)n *taranti/nois, Hsch.
r(a/i+os [a_], a, on, Ion. r(h/i+os, h, on,= r(a/|dios, Opp.C.1.101 (unless r(h/i+on is neut. Comp.).
r(aista/zei: ponei=, w)qei=, Hsch.; cf. r(asta/zei.

r(ais-th/r, h=ros, o( and h(, (r(ai/w)
smasher, i.e.
hammer, Il.18.477 (fem.), A.Pr.56, Call.Dian.59; masc. in AP6.117 (Pancrat.); me xru/seion a)po\ r(aisth=ros sth/shte set up a statue of me in
beaten gold, ib.7.5:—found in late Prose, Iamb.in Nic.p.121 P. (pl.). generally,
destroyer, dalo\s r(. mega/rwn Opp.H.5.120.

r(ais-th/rios, a, on,
smashing, hammering, r(. i(drw/s
the blacksmith's sweat or toil, ib.2.28; a)/kmosi . . r(.
hammered upon the anvil, ib.5.153. generally,
destructive, pernicious, r(. fa/rmaka, opp. e)sqla/, A.R.3.803: c. gen., r(. fa/rmaka qumou= ib.790; nhw=n 4.921.

r(ais-throkopi/a, h(,
working with a hammer, Ph.Byz.Mir.42.
r(a/i+stos, a, on, Dor. for r(h/i+stos; v. r(a/|dios.

r(aisto/tu^pos, on,
struck with the hammer, a)/kmones Man.1.289, 4.124.
r(ai/stwr: kranth/r, Hsch. r(aifa/ssei: a(gneu/ei, Id.

r(ai/w, poet. subj. r(ai/h|si Od.5.221: fut. r(ai/sw （diar-) 2.49; Ep. inf. r(aise/menai (v.l. r(ai/sesqai) 8.569: aor. e)/rraisa, subj. r(ai/sh| 23.235:— Pass., fut. (in med. form) r(ai/somai （diar-) Il.24.355: aor. e)rrai/sqhn 16.339:—
break, shiver, shatter, r(. nh=a
wreck a ship, Od.8.569, 13.151, 23.235; r(. tina/
cause one
to suffer shipwreck, 5.221:—in Pass., r(aio/menos
suffering shipwreck, 6.326; nhu=s r(aisqei=sa A.R.2.1112; also fa/sganon e)rrai/sqh it
was shivered, Il.16.339; tw=| ke/ oi(/ e)gke/falo/s ge dia\ spe/os . . r(ai/oito pro\s ou)/dei+ his brain
would be dashed on the ground throughout the cavern, Od.9.459; so ai)w\n di' o)ste/wn e)rrai/sqh the marrow
spurted through the bones, Pi.Fr.111. generally,
destroy, A.R.1.617:—Pass.,
to be broken down, crushed by suffering, o(/tan . . r(aisqh=| A.Pr.191, AP7.529 (Theodorid.), etc. (anap.), cf. S.Tr.268.
r(aka/, Hebr. word expressive of contempt, Ev.Matt.5.22.
r(a/kana or r(aka/nh, h(, name of a garment, Edict.Diocl.7.60, 22.4.
r(a/kelos (and r(akleo/s),= sklhro/s, Hsch.
r(a^kendu/ths [u^], ou, o(,= r(akodu/ths, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).165.
r(a^ketri/zw, = r(axetri/zw, Pl.Com.252.

r(a/ketron, to/,
butcher's cleaver, Poll.7.25 (v.l. r(a/x-): Hsch. has bra/ketron (Aeol. ?),
pruning-hook.

r(a/k-i^nos [a^], h, on,
ragged, Michel 832.17, al. (Samos, iv B.C.), Schwyzer 462 B37 (Tanagra, iii B.C.). -on, to/, a substance used in alchemy, Zos.Alch.p.185 B. (s. v.l.).

r(a/k-ion, to/, Dim. of r(a/kos, mostly in pl.,
rags, Ar.Ach.412, V.128, al.: in sg., r(a/kio/n ti tou= palaiou= dra/matos Id.Ach.415; of a tattered flag, Them.Or.16.210b. [r(a_k- in BCH51.326 (Athens), pl.]

r(a^kiosurrapta/dhs [a^], ou, o(,
rag-stitcher, of Euripides,
who tricked out his heroes in rags, Ar.Ra.842.
r(aki/s, pl. r(aki=des,= o)ro/damnoi, kla/doi, Hsch. r(a/kis, perh. Ion. for r(a/xis, Herod.3.50.
r(aki/wsis, v. r(a/kwsis. r(akki/zw, v. r(axi/zw. r(akko/dutos, v. r(ako/dutos. r(akleo/s, v. r(a/kelos.

r(a^ko-du/ths [u^], ou, o(,
wearer of rags, e)n i(eroi=s Rhetor. in
Cat.Cod. Astr.8(4).148.

r(a^ko/-du^tos, on,
ragged, stola/ E.Rh.712 (lyr.); written r(akko/- in Hsch. s.v. kakoei/monas.

r(a^ko/eis, essa, en,
ragged, torn, tattered, AP6.21. (r(a/kos 11)
wrinkled, xrw/s ib.11.66 (Antiphil.).

r(a/kos [a^], eos, to/,
ragged, tattered garment, do\s r(. a)mfibale/sqai Od. 6.178, cf. 13.434, 14.342,349 (never in Il.); a)nq' i(mati/ou me\n e)/xein r(. Ar.Pl.540; r(. forei= Antiph.204.6, PPetr.3p.115 (iii B.C.), cf. Philem. 146: freq. in pl. r(a/kea, Att. r(a/kh,
rags, tatters, Od.14.512, 18.67,74, 19.507,al., Hdt.3.129, S.Ph.39,274; e)n r(a/kesi perifqei/resqai Isoc.Ep. 9.10. generally,
strip of cloth, r(a/kea foini/kea Hdt.7.76, cf. Ev.Matt.9.16, Arr.Tact.35.3: even a
strip of flesh, sw/matos r(. A.Pr. 1023. collectively,
rag, lint, Hp.Morb.2.36; r(a/kh lina= Dsc.5.75.15. in pl. also,
rents in the face, wrinkles, Ar.Pl.1065. metaph.,
rag, remnant, ei)ka/sai to\ e)rei/pion r(a/kei oi)ki/as Anon. ap. Arist. Rh.1413a6; of an old seaman, a(li/oio bi/ou r(. AP9.242 (Antiphil.), cf. 7.380 (Crin.), Luc.Tim.32.—The Aeol. form bra/kos (q.v.), used of a garment, lacks the sense 'ragged'.

r(a^ko-fore/w,
wear rags or
tatters, Sch.Ar.Pax739.

r(a^ko/-w, in Pass.,
become ragged or
wrinkled, of skins of dead animals, Plu.2.642e; e)rrakwme/na pro/swpa
wrinkled faces, Dsc.5.87.12. in Pass.,
to be dispersed all about, to\ xolw=des . . r(akou/menon e)n tw=| sw/mati Hp.Morb.4.49.

r(ak-th/rios, a, on, (r(a/ssw)
fit for striking with, ke/ntra S.Fr.802. me/lh bow=n a)/naula kai\ r(.
broken, discordant (yofw/dh kai\ qorubw/dh Hsch.), Id.Fr.699. r(akth/rion: o)/rxhsi/s tis, Hsch. r(akth/ria: tu/mpana, Id.

r(ak-to/s, h/, o/n,
broken, rugged, bou/staqma Lyc. 92. Subst. -to/s, o(,
ravine, Hsch.

r(a/k-tria, h(,
pole for beating fruit-trees, esp.
olives, with, Poll.7.146, 10.130: r(a/ktrion, to/, is dub. in Hsch. and Phot.
r(akxi/zw, v. r(axi/zw.

r(a^k-w/dhs, es,
ragged, xitwni/skos D.C.65.20.
wrinkled, AP5.20 (Rufin.), Sor.1.88; of the
worn and chafed skin of bedridden people, Gal.11.132.
r(a^k-wle/on: r(a/kos, Hsch.

r(a^/k-wma, atos, to/, in pl.,= r(a/kh,
rags, Ar.Ach.432.

r(a^/k-wsis, ews, h(,
a becoming ragged or
wrinkled, of the skin, when the flesh under it is shrunk, Sor.2.40, Zen.6.42 (written r(aki/wsis in Diogenian.8.70).
r(a/mata: botru/dia, stafuli/s (Maced.), Hsch. r(amba/s: o( dh/mios, Id. (cf. r(aibi/as).
r(a/mma (A), atos, to/, f.l. (r(a/ma, r(a=ma codd.) for r(eu=ma in Apollod. Poliorc.183.7.

r(a/mma (B), atos, to/, (r(a/ptw)
anything sewn or
stitched, seam, hem, Pi.Fr.85, Hermipp.48, Pl.Com.36, J.AJ3.7.5.
fastening of a bandage
by sewing (as a(/mma by a knot), Hp. Off.8.
thread, D.S. 1.87, Dsc.Eup.1.200, Gal.UP10.12.
suture of a wound, Hippiatr. 71.

r(amma/t-inos, h, on,
of suture-thread, a)gkth=res Heliod. ap. Orib.44.10.4.

r(ammat-w/dhs, es,
like a thread, Hsch. s.v. krossou/s.

r(a/mnos, h(, name of various
prickly shrubs, Eup.14.5, Theoc.4.57, 21.36, Plb.12.2.2, IG14.352 ii 32 (Halaesa);
Box-thorn, Lycium europaeum, Dsc.1.90, Paus.3.14.7; r(. leukh/ （leukote/ra Dsc. l.c.)
Stone buckthorn, Rhamnus graeca, Thphr.HP3.18.2; r(. me/laina
Black buckthorn, R. oleoides, ibid.

*(ramnou=s, ou=ntos (contr. from r(amno/eis), o(, Rhamnus, a deme in Attica (named from the r(a/mnoi growing in it), h( e)n *(r. qeo/s, i.e. Nemesis, Paus.1.33.2, cf. Str.9.1.17 and 22; *(ramnou=nti, not e)n *(r.,
at Rhamnus, Lys.19.28, etc.—Hence *(ramnou/sios, a, on, Rhamnusian, Aeschin.1.157, etc.; h(
*(ramnousi/a, epith. of Nemesis from her temple at Rhamnus, Hsch., etc.; also *(ramnousi/s, i/dos, h(, Call.Dian. 232; *(ramnousia/s, a/dos, h(, IG14.1389 ii 2.
r(amosai/ths: kata/ratos, Hsch. r(amfade/ktai: to\ pukteu/ein, Id. r(amfa/zh: r(ugxwqh/sh, Id., cf. Phot.

r(amf-h/, h(,
hooked knife, bill, Plb.10.18.6, Hsch. = r(a/mfos, Id.
r(amf-hsth/s, ou=, o(, a fish, prob. = belo/nh, Id.
r(a/mf-ion, to/, Dim. of r(a/mfos, Sch.D.T.p.196 H.
r(a/mf-ios, o(,= pelekano/s, Cyran.96.
r(amf-i/s: new\s ei)=dos, Hsch.

r(a/mf-os, eos, to/,
crooked beak of birds of prey: generally,
beak, bill, Ar.Av.99, Pl.Com.138, Plu.2.980e; cf. r(u/gxos.

r(amf-w/dhs, es,
beak-shaped, Philostr.VS2.6.
r(amyo/s, h/, o/n,= r(aibo/s, Hsch. r(a=na: a)/rna, *(rwmai=oi de\ ba/traxon, Id. (cf. r(h/n, also vra=non [cod. trano/n]: e(camhniai=on pro/baton, Id.). r(ana=tai: plana=tai, spei/retai, Id.
r(a^n-i/zw,= r(ai/nw, Poll.10.30.

r(a^n-i/s, i/dos, h(, (r(ai/nw)
drop, pe/trhn koilai/nei r(. u(/datos e)ndelexei/h| Choeril.10, cf. Acus.4 J.; u(grai\ r(. E.Ion 106 (anap.); dro/sou Id.Andr.227, LXX Wi.11.22; r(. be/blhke/ me a rain-
drop, Ar.Ach.171, cf. Arist.Mete.349b31, 374a9.
semen virile, AP10.45 (Pall.). metaph.,
drop, spot, ta\ pti/la e)/xei r(ani/das Ael.NA17.23, cf. 38; ai( tou= xrusou= r(. Philostr.VA3.48.

r(an-th/r, h=ros, o(, (r(ai/nw)
one who wets, esp. of
the inner corner of the eye, Nic. Th.673, cf. Poll.2.71.
sprinkler, Mon.Ant.23.150 (Adanda).

r(an-th/rios, a, on,
of or
for sprinkling, pe/don r(.
besprinkled, reeking, with blood, A.Ag.1092; Pors. read pe/dou r(anth/rion (as Subst.)
defilement; and, in the same sense, Dobree suggested the compd. pedorranth/rion. r(anth/rion, to/,= perirranth/rion, BCH 35.286 (Delos, ii B.C.), 54.98 (ibid., ii B.C.).

-[ths], ou, o(,
sprinkler, POxy.1050.17 (ii/iii A.D.), dub. in IG5(1).197 (Sparta).

r(an-ti/zw, = r(ai/nw, Ep.Hebr.9.13,19,21:—Pass.,
to be sprinkled, LXX Le.6.27, al., Ath.12.521a, Alex.Trall.Febr.4. of the effect,
purify, LXX Ps.50(51).7; e)rrantisme/noi ta\s kardi/as a)po\ suneidh/sews ponhra=s Ep.Hebr.10.22. r(anti/zei: skw/ptei, Hsch.
r(a/n-tisma, atos, to/, name of a skin affection, peri\ ta\s o)/yeis Vett.Val.110.17.

r(an-tismo/s, o(,
sprinkling, u(/dwr r(antismou= LXX Nu.19.9 sq.; ai(=ma r(antismou= Ep.Hebr.12.24, cf. 1 Ep.Pet.1.2.

r(an-to/s, h/, o/n,
sprinkled: hence,
speckled or
spotted, ma=za Hp.Vict.2.40, 3.82; a)/rtos Supp.Epigr.4.518 (Ephesus, i/ii A.D.); of animals, PSI6.569.10 (iii B.C.), v.l. in LXX Ge.30.32; of
veined marble, skou/tlh r(. Ephes.3 No.65p.148.
r(an-tri/s, i/dos, h(,= perirranth/rion, IG7.3498.18 (Oropus).

r(a/c, r(a_go/s, h(, Ion. and later Gr. r(w/c (v. r(w/c (B)):—
grape, S.Fr. 398; kata\ r(a=ga botru/wn for each
grape in the bunch, Pl.Lg.845a; r(a=ges bo/truos Arist.HA550a28, cf. Pr.925b15; e)n au)tw=| tw=| bo/trui+ r(a=gas Thphr.CP5.5.1, cf. 1.21.1, HP3.17.6; ta\s stafula\s kai\ w(s kata\ mi/an ai( r(a=ges Philostr.Im.1.31. generally,
berry, Dsc.4.51; r(. glukusi/dhs
seed of peony, Id.Eup.2.117;
clove of garlic, Id.2.152.
a venomous kind of spider, malmignatte, so called from its shape, Ael.NA3.36. pl.,
finger-tips, Ruf.Onom.85, Sor.1.3, Poll.2.146. r(a/c = qhlh/, 'in common speech', Eust.1485.59. [In Nic.Al.184, r(a/+gessi should be read for r(a^ge/essi.]
r(a/pa: th\n kala/mhn, kai\ tou\s e)n au)th=| au)lou=ntas r(apau/lous, Hsch. (r(apath\n k. and r(apa/lous cod.).
r(a/palos, o(,= r(a/fanos, PJena 3.12 (v A.D.), cf. sq. v. foreg.
r(apa/nion, = r(af-, UPZ89.15 (ii B.C.).
r(apath/n, v. r(a/pa.

r(apau/lhs, ou, o(,
player on a reed-pipe, Amerias ap.Ath.4.176e (where r(appau/las), Eust.1157.39 (where r(aptau/lhs); cf. r(a/pa.

r(apeu/s, e/ws, o(, =
rupiam (rapium cj. Salmasius), Gloss.

r(a^pidh/i+on, to/, synon. of leontope/talon, Ps.-Dsc.3.96;
rapadion (with vv.ll.), Plin.HN27.96.
r(apidopoio/n: to\n poihth/n, *dwriei=s, h)\ poikilth/n, h)\ ta\s krhpi=das poiou=nta, Hsch.

r(a^pi/zw, (r(api/s)
strike with a stick, cudgel, thrash, tina Xenoph.7.4, Hippon.64 (Pass.), Hdt.7.35,223, D.25.57, LXX Jd.16.25, Plb.8.6.6, Phld.Ir.p.40 W.; tina\ r(a/bdw| Anacreont.29.2:—Pass., r(. e)k tw=n a)gw/nwn
to be flogged off the course, Heraclit.42, cf. Hdt.8.59: Ion. pf. part., r(erapisme/na nw=ta Anacr.166.
slap in the face (later for Att. e)pi\ ko/rrhs pata/cai）, e)pi\ ko/rrhs r(. (metaph.) Plu.2.713c; kata\ ko/rrhs Ach.Tat.2.24; ei)s th\n siago/na Ev.Matt.5.39:—Pass., r(apisqh=nai/ te kai\ plhga\s labei=n a(palai=si xersi/n Timocl.22.5; e)rrapi/sqh th\n gna/qon Hyp.Fr.97, cf. AB300; r(api/zein distd. from kolafi/zein, Ev.Matt.26.67. generally,
strike, beat, [to\n a)e/ra] Arist.de An.419b23:—Pass., Id.Mete.368a16, 370a14, Epicur.Fr.398.

r(a^pi/s, i/dos, h(,
rod, Hsch., Phot.
a kind of shoe,= krhpi/s, Hsch., EM702.33. = gogguli/s, Hsch.; cf. r(a/pus, r(a/fus.

r(a/p-isma [a^], atos, to/,
stroke, a)nqra/kwn r(api/smasi (Abresch r(ip-) Antiph.217.21.
slap on the face, Ev.Marc.14.65, Ev.Jo.18.22; in Lat. form
rhapismata, Cod.Just.8.48.6; r(. lamba/nein Luc.DMeretr. 8.2; r(. a)mfi\ pro/swpa AP5.288 (Agath.).
weal, Arch.Pap.3. 418.30 (vi A.D.).

r(ap-ismo/s, o(,
striking, beating, Corn.ND16, Sor. 2.31,37.

r(ap-iste/on,
one must beat, Aët.9.8.

r(a/p-ths, ou, o(, (r(a/ptw)
one who stitches, clothes-mender, Anub. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).208, PHamb.56 v 7 (vi/vii A.D.), Gloss.

r(ap-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for stitching, Gal.Thras.5, Sch.Philostr.Her.2.19 (p.464 Boissonade).

r(ap-to/s, h/, o/n,
stitched, patched, xitw/n, knhmi=des, Od. 24.228,229; e)n skutari/ois r(. Anaxil.18.6; ploi=a boats
made of hides sewn together, Str.7.4.1. metaph.,
strung together, continuous, r(aptw=n e)pe/wn a)oidoi/ Pi.N.2.2; cf. r(ayw|do/s.
worked with the needle: hence r(apta/, ta/,
embroidered carpets, X.HG4.1.30; r(apth\ sfai=ra a ball
of divers colours, AP12.44 (Glauc.).
r(a/p-tria, h(, fem. of r(a/pths, Eust.1764.60.

r(a/ptw, Od.16.422, etc.: fut. r(a/yw （a)por-) Aeschin.2.21: aor. 1 e)/rraya Hdt.9.17, E.Andr.911; Ep. r(a/ya Il.12.296: aor. 2 e)/rra^fon （sun-) Nonn.D.7.152: plpf. e)rrafh/kei （sun-) X.Eph.1.9:—Med., aor. e)rraya/mhn Ar.Eq.784, etc.:—Pass., fut. r(a^fh/somai （sun-) Androm. ap. Gal.13.685: aor. e)rra/fhn [a^] D.54.41, v. infr.: pf. e)/rrammai Ar.Ec. 24, D.54.35: poet. plpf. e)/rapto （sun-) Q.S.9.359:—
sew together, stitch, boei/as Il.12.296: abs., Ar.Pl.513:—Med., r(aya/menon derma/twn o)xeto/n
having made himself a pipe of leather, Hdt.3.9; r(aya/meno/s soi touti/ (sc. to\ proskefa/laion)
having got it
stitched or
made, Ar.Eq. 784; also,
sew on or
to one, Id.Nu.538:—Pass., e)rra/fqai to\ xei=los
to have one's lip
sewed up, D.54.35, cf. 41; e)/xein pw/gwnas e)rramme/nous to have beards
sewed on, Ar.Ec.24; e)n mhrw=| pot' e)rra/fqai *dio/s
was sewn up in . ., E.Ba.243; e)rramme/na
stitched work, a cushion or
pad, Alex.98.11; xrh\ to\ e)/poxon toiou=ton e)rra/fqai w(s . . X.Eq.12.9. metaph. c. dat.,
devise, contrive, plot, sfin kaka\ r(. Od.3.118, cf. Il. 18.367; fo/non, qa/nato/n te mo/ron te r(., Od.16.379,422; r(a/yai mo/ron soi E.IT681; also e)p' *(/ellhsi fo/non r(. Hdt.9.17; ei)/s tina E.Andr. 911; e)piboula\s r(. tini/, Lat.
suere dolos, Alex.98.2: prov., tou=to to\ u(po/dhma e)/rrayas me\n su/, u(pedh/sato de\ *)aristago/rhs you
sewed the shoe but A. put it on, Hdt.6.1. generally,
string or
link together, unite, a)oidh/n Hes.Fr.265. r(a/yanta dia\ bi/ou toi=s au)tokra/torsi, perh. f.l. in JHS42.168 (iii A.D.). r(a/ptousa, h(, name of a plaster, Cels.5.19.6, 5.26.23.
r(a/pus [a^], h(,= r(a/fus, Glauc. ap. Ath.9.369b, prob. cj. in Gal.6.622.
r)a/rion, to/, Dim. of r)a/ros, Hsch., EM702.37, Suid.
*)ra=ros, o(, Rarus, father of Triptolemus, Paus.1.14.3, Hsch., Suid.; in Phot. *(ra/r:—to\

*)ra/rion pedi/on the field
of Rarus, where tillage was first practised, and which was sacred to Demeter, Paus.1.38.6, St.Byz.; (without pedi/on) *)ra/rion, to/, h.Cer.450; *)rari/a, h( (sc. gh=), Plu.2.144b; whence the goddess was herself called *)raria/s, h(, St.Byz. [a is long, h.Cer. l.c., so that the accent is prob. not *)ra/ros, as in most codd.:—for the smooth breathing, v. Hdn.Gr.2.402, 940.]

r)a/ros, o(, a word found only in Gramm., expid. as = gasthr in EM 702.37, Suid.; as Aeol. for e)/mbruon in Sch.D.T.p.143 H.; as = a)mblwqri/dion bre/fos in Lex. de Spir.p.215 Valck.; as = i)sxuro/s (cf. r(wro/s), Hsch., Phot., Suid. [The breathing is smooth, as in *)ra=ros, Sch.D.T. and Lex. de Spir. ll. cc.]
r(a/sdon, or r(a/p-os, name of an ingredient of nard, Aët.1.130,132.
r(a/ssate, v. r(ai/nw.

r(a/ssw, Att. r(a/p-ttw, (kata-) Plb.10.48.7, (sur-) D.H.8.18: fut. r(a/cw LXX Is.9.11(10), (cur-) Th.8.96: aor. e)/rraca D.54.8, Apollod. Com.22, (sun-) X.HG7.5.16:—Pass., fut. (in med. form) r(a/comai （katar-) Plu.Caes.44: aor. e)rra/xqhn LXX Da.8.10, (e)pi-) D.H.8.18:— like a)ra/ssw,
strike, dash, tina\ ei)s to\n bo/rboron D. l.c.;
overthrow, tinas LXX Is. l.c. in Ion. form r(h/ssw, of dancers,
beat the ground, dance, r(h/ssontes a(marth=| molph=| t' i)ugmw=| te posi\ skai/rontes e(/ponto Il.18.571; oi( de\ r(h/ssontes e(/ponto h.Ap.516; for which A.R. 1.539 has in full, w(/ste . . pe/don r(h/sswsi po/dessi:—so also ai)/rh|sin o(/te r(h/ssoito si/dhros Euph.51.9; r(h/ssein tu/mpana
beat them
violently, AP 7.709 (Alexander). [r(a/ssw （r(a/ttw) prob. has a_ by nature, as shown by Ion. r(h/ssw: cf. a)ra/ssw:—the Ion. form is found also in the koinh/, as LXX Wi.4.19, Ev.Marc.9.18, Ev.Luc.9.42, Arr.Epict.1.20.9.]
r(asta/zei: ponei=, w)qei=, tara/ttetai, Hsch.; cf. r(aista/zei.
r(a=|stos, v. r(a/|dios.
r(a|stw/n-eusis, ews, h(,= r(a|stw/nh, Ael.Fr.110, cf. 321.

r(a|stwn-eu/w,= r(aqume/w,
to be idle, listless, th=| yuxh=| X.Oec.20.18, D.C.38.39:—Med., Zen.1.23, Diogenian.1.21, Hsch., dub. l. in Ael.Fr.281:—pf. Pass. in med. sense, [Aristid.]Or.54p.652Dind., Thom.Mag.p.325 R.

r(a|stwn-e/w,
grow easy, become less painful, Hp.Prorrh.1.52, Gal.9.703.

r(a|stw/n-h, Ion. r(h|stw/nh, h(, (r(a=|stos)
easiness of doing anything, Pl.R.460d, Lg. 684d; opp. xalepo/ths, Id.Criti.107c; r(a|stw/nh| or meta\ r(a|stw/nhs
with ease, easily, lightly, Id.Epin.991c, Lg.625b; r(a|stw/nhn paraskeua/zein tino/s find
an easy way of doing a thing, ib.720c; pollh\ r(. gi/gnetai, c. inf., one has great
ease in doing, Id.Grg.459c; o)/xlw| r(a|stw/nhn fugh=s pare/sxon afforded an
easy opportunity of escape, Plu.Cam.20; pro\s ta\s r(. for the
conveniences of getting food, Arist.Pol.1256a26.
easiness of temper, good nature, mildness, c. gen. objecti, e)k r(h|stw/nhs (dub. l.) th=s *dhmokh/deos from
kindness to Democedes, Hdt.3.136; xa/riti kai\ r(. Plb.38.11.11.
relief from anything unpleasant, mhdemi/an dido/nta r(. [toi=s a)dikou=si] D.24.69, cf. Lys.13.85;
relief from pain, Hp.Epid.3.17.q/; r(. th=s po/sews
recovery from the effects of drinking, Pl.Smp.176b; e)k tw=n po/nwn Id.Lg.779a; a)sfa/leia kai\ r(. tisi\ a)po\ *lakedaimoni/wn Plb.18.14.15. abs.,
rest, leisure, ease,
e)mautw=| r(a|stw/nhn e)chu=ron found
recreation, Lys.24.10, cf. Pl.Plt.310c, etc.; o)li/gois po/nois polla\s r(. ktw/menos Isoc.9.45; e)/xei tina\ r(a|stw/nhn to\ le/gein it brings a certain
relief, D.Ep.3.44; a)napnoh\n kai\ r(. e)n tw=| kau/mati pare/xein Pl.Ti. 70d; dia\ r(a|stw/nhn for the sake of
resting, X. An.5.8.16; pro\s r(. kai\ diagwgh/n Arist.Metaph.982b23.
luxurious ease, indolence, th=s r(. to\ terpno/n Th.1.120; r(. kai\ r(aqumi/a
nonchalance, carelessness, D.10.7, cf. 18.45 (interchanged with r(aqumi/a in Isoc. l.c.).
resting-time, season of calm and tranquillity, e)n a)perista/tois r(. sfa/llesqai Plb.6.44.8. [*(raistw/nh as name of an Athenian trireme, IG22.1608.52; r(aist- also in Phld.D.3.8.]

r(a/stwr: krath/r, Hsch. (cf. r(ai/stwr). r(ata/nan: toru/nhn, Id. (cf. brata/nan, also r(otari/a). r(a/teros, a, on, Dor. Comp. of r(a/|dios (q. v.). r(ati/zei: presbeu/ei, Id. r(atixeu/ein: katara=sqai, Id. vra/tra, Elean for r(h/tra. r(atw=na: r(ekth=ra, sfage/a, Hsch. r(aulo/n: a)/graulon, a)/groikon, Id.

r(a^fa^n-e/laion, to/,
oil of radishes, Dsc.1.37 (as v.l.), in lemmate; written r(efanaie/laion, POxy.155.8 (vi A.D.).
r(a^fa^/n-h, h(,= r(a/fanos, Batr. 53 (as v.l.), Hippiatr.33, Hsch.

r(a^fa^n-hdo/n, Adv.
radish-like, of fractures, Erot. s.v. a)treke/ws, Gal.10.424, Sor.Fract.10; cf. kaulhdo/n.
r(a^fa^n-i/di^on [i_d], to/, Dim. of r(afani/s, Pl.Com. 171.

r(a^fa^n-i_do/w,
thrust a radish up the fundament, a punishment of adulterers in Athens, Ar.Nu.1083, cf. Luc. Peregr.9:—hence a)pora^fa^ni/dwsis, ews, h(, Sch.Ar.Pl.168.

r(a^fa^n-i_dw/dhs, es,
like a radish, Thphr.HP7.6.2.

r(a^fa^/n-i^nos, h, on,
of radish, e)/laion Dsc.1.37, PAmh.2.93.10 (ii A.D.), Gal.11.750: r(afa/ninon alone, PFay.240 (i B.C.).
r(a^fa^/n-ion, to/, Dim. of r(a/fanos 11, PHib.1.34.18 (iii B.C.), UPZ89.4 (ii B.C.); cf. r(apa/nion.

r(a^fa^n-i/s, i=dos, h(,
radish, Raphanus sativus, Ar.Nu.981, Pl.544, Fr.253, Cratin.313, Eup.312, Thphr.HP1.2.7, Dsc.2.112, etc.: later r(efani/s, Philum.Ven.18.4, Gloss.; cf. r(a/fanos. r(. a)gri/a
charlock, Raphanus raphanistrum, Dsc.2.112, Plin.HN19.82. [-i_s, i=dos in all known passages, though Ath.2.56e says that i is common.]
r(a^fa^n-i=tis, idos, h(,= i)=ris *)illurikh/, Plin.HN21.41.

r(a^/fa^n-os, h(, Att. for kra/mbh,
cabbage, Brassica cretica, Ar.Fr.109; oi)=d' o(/ti kalou=men r(a/fanon, u(mei=s d' oi( ce/noi kra/mbhn Apollod. Car.27; th=s r(., h(\n kalou=si/ tines kra/mbhn Arist.HA551a15, cf. Thphr. HP1.6.6, al.; it was boiled for use, Nicoch.15, Alex.286; distd. fr. -i/s by Phryn.11, Hsch. r(. a)gri/a,= kra/mbh a)gri/a, Thphr.HP7.6.2. = r(afani\s a)gri/a, ib.9.15.5.
tuberous spurge, Euphorbia Apios, Dsc.4.175; also r(. o)rei/a, o)reinh/, Thphr.HP9.12.1, Ps.-Dsc.4.175. also,= r(afani/s, Arist.Pr.924a34, PTeb.79.22 (ii B.C.), Poll.1.247. (Ion.(?) and late Gr. r(e/fanos Hp.Mul.2.115, Gloss.: v. r(a/pus.)

r(a^fa^n-ouro/s, o(,
cabbage-watcher, gardener, like khpouro/s, Hsch.
r(afa/ssei: plana=tai, Hsch.

r(a^f-eu/s, e/ws, o(, (r(a/ptw)
stitcher, patcher, cobbler, Poll.7.42. metaph., r(. fo/nou
planner of murder, A.Ag.1604.

r(a^f-h/, h(,
seam, i(ma/ntwn Od.22.186; [xitw=nos] Plu.Cleom.37.
suture of the skull, kefalh\ ou)k e)/xousa r(afh/n Hdt.9.83, cf. Hp.VC1 (pl.), Pl.Ti.76a, Arist.HA491b2, 516a15; also of the heart and other parts, Id.PA 667a7, 677b19; r(afai\ o)ste/wn E.Ph.1159, Supp.503.
stitching, sewing, trh/sei kai\ r(afh=| xrwme/nh su/nqesis Pl.Plt.280c; ai( r(. tou= trau/matos, of a wound
that had been sewn up, D.C.43.11.

r(a/fh [a^], h(, Dor. r(a/fa,
a large kind of radish, Trypho ap.Hsch., dub. in Epich.204.

r(a^fi^d-a=s, a=, o(,
embroiderer, PWürzb.15v (iv A.D.).
r(a^fi^/d-eia, h(, fem. of sq., in Delph. acc. sg. r(afi/dhan, Delph.3(3).26.6 (ii B.C.).
r(a^fi^d-eu/s, e/ws, o(,= r(afeu/s, AP11.288 (Pall.).

r(a^fi^d-euth/s, ou=, o(,
stitcher, embroiderer, LXX Ex.27.16.
r(a^fi^d-euto/s, h/, o/n,= r(apto/s, ib.37.21.

r(a^fi^do-qh/kh, h(,
needle-box, Gloss.

r(a^fi^do-poio/s, o(,
needle-maker, ib.

r(a^fi/s, Dor. r(a^pi/s (Epich.51), i/dos, h(, (r(a/ptw)
needle, Hp.Morb. 2.66 (where Gal.19.134 read r(afi/w|, al. grafi/si), Archipp.38, Ph.Bel. 61.14, Hero Bel.109.1 (r(ani/da codd.), AP11.110 (Nicarch.), Hermes 38.283; dia\ truph/matos (v.l. trh/matos） r(afi/dos dielqei=n (v.l. ei)selqei=n) Ev.Matt.19.24:—in Att. replaced by belo/nh, Phryn.72.
garfish, Belone acus, Epich. l.c., Arist.Fr.294, Opp.H.1.172, C.2.392.
r(a/foi: o)/rneis tine/s, Hsch.
r(a/fus [a^], uos, h(,= bounia/s, Speus. ap. Ath.9.369b; perh. to be read (for r(a/fin) in Numen.(?)ib.371c; cf. r(a/pus.

r(a^xa/dhn: e)pi\ th=s r(a/xews, Hsch. r(a^xa/s, a/dos, h(,
wooded ridge, Id., Phot., but r(a/xas, o(, gen. tou= r(a/xa, IG14.352 ii 25,66 (Halaesa).

r(a^xetr-i/zw, (r(a/xis)
cut through the spine, Poll.2.136; cf. r(aketri/zw.

r(a^/xetr-on, to/,= r(a/xis, Hsch.; acc. to Phot.
the beginning of the spine, acc. to Poll.2.136
the middle; = pleuro/n, Did. ap. Phot.
butcher's knife or
chopper, Poll.7.25; Hsch. cites bra/keton (leg. -tron) = dre/panon.
r(a/xh [a_], h(, v.l. for r(a/xos,= r(axo/s 1.1, Poll.1.225 (r(a/xhn h)\ r(a/xon). r(a/xi: to\ ste/mfulon, Hsch.

r(a_xi/a, Ion. r(hxi/h, h(,
flood-tide, opp. a)/mpwtis, Hdt.2.11, 7.198; joined with plhmuri/s (s. v. l.), Id.8.129, cf. Hp. ap. Gal.19.135.
the roar of the breakers, metaph. of a crowd of people, o)/xlou toiou/tou r(axi/an h)qroisme/nhn Posidipp.27.11; r(. poiei=n e)n dh/mw| Plu.2.789d, cf. 791a: prov., r(axi/as lali/steros Diogenian.7.99.
rocky shore or
beach (pa=s petrw/dhs ai)gialo/s Hsch.), a(li/stonoi r(. A.Pr.713; par' au)th\n th\n r(. Th.4.10, cf. Plb.3.39.4, Str.16.4.23. = r(a/xis 11.1, S.Fr.1088;= r(a/xis 1, Nonn.D.11.182, 39.334 (v. ad fin.). [r(a^- metri gr. only in late Poets, as AP7.393 (Diocl.); in sense 11.2, Nonn. Il.cc.] (Cogn. with r(a_ssw, r(h/ssw, and a)ra/ssw;= to\n to/pon w(=| prosara/ttei to\ ku=ma, Ael.Dion.Fr.427: not cogn. with r(h/gnumi, which has pan-Hellenic h.)

r(a^x-iai=os, a, on, (r(a/xis)
of the spine, mu/es Hp.Aph.7.36, Gal.UP 12.10.

r(a^x-i/zw,
cut through the spine, esp. in sacrifices (Hsch.),
cleave in twain, of persons and animals, A.Pers.426, S.Aj.56,299, E. Fr.1105, Hippiatr.22.
play the braggart, boast, Din.Fr.80, Hsch.

r(a^/x-is, ios, Att. ews, h( (but o( IG42 (v. infr.)),
the lower part of the back, the chine, suo\s r(. Il.9.208.
spine or
backbone, su/gkeitai h( r(. e)k sfondu/lwn, tei/nei d' a)po\ th=s kefalh=s me/xri pro\s ta\ i)sxi/a Arist.HA516a11, cf. PA654b12, al.; u(po\ r(a/xin page/ntes impaled, A. Eu.190, cf. S.Fr.20, E.Cyc.643; muelo\s koi/lhs r(a/xews Archel. ap. Antig.Mir.89, cf. Pl.Ti.77d, 91a.
anything ridged like the backbone:
ridge of a hill or mountain, Hdt.3.54, 7.216, IG42(1).71.14 (Epid., iii B.C.), Plb.3.101.2, D.H.5.44, Str.3.2.3 (pl.); a)\n r(a/xin along the
ridge, GDI5075.69 (Crete, i B.C.); so Archil.21 like ned Thasos to an o)/nou r(a/xis. r(. r(ino/s
bridge of the nose, Poll.2.79, Ruf.Onom.35. r(. fu/llou
mid-rib of a leaf, Thphr.HP3.7.5, al.
the sharp projection on the middle of the shoulder-blade, Gal. UP13.10, Ruf.Onom.71.
outer edge of the arm of the polypus, Arist.HA524a7.
trunk, of Dagon, LXX 1 Ki.5.4.

r(a^x-isth/s, ou=, o(,
he who cuts the victim through the spine, Phot.
boaster, braggart, Theopomp.Com.43: also r(axisth/r, h=ros, o(, Hsch.

r(a^x-isto/s, h/, o/n,
cut up, cleft, Amphis 16.

r(a^x-i/ths [i_], ou, o(, （r(a/xis)
in or
of the spine, muelo\s r(. the
spinal marrow, Hp.Coac.499, Arist.PA651b32; without m., ib.652a30, cf. r(a/xis 1; r(. mu/es Gal.UP12.8.

r(a_xiw/dhs, es,
with surf or
breakers, ai)gialo/s, a)ktai/, Str.5.4.4, 12.3.11; parali/a Id.16.2.13.

r(a/xnos, eos, to/, perh.
cloak, PGen.80.7 (iv A.D.), PKlein.Form.407 (vi A.D.).

r(a_x-o/s, h( (in codd. freq. r(a/xos, but the Ion. form r(hxo/s Hdt.7.142, and the compd. eu)/rrhxos show that it must be either r(a_xo/s or r(a=xos:— in EM703.1 r(a/xos, o():—
thorn-hedge, S.Fr.812 (pl.), X.Cyn.10.7, cf. Poll.1.225; in Hdt. l.c., r(hxo/s is prob.
palisade or
wattled fence; brushwood, r(axo\s (Dor. acc. pl.) kai\ fru/gana GDI5027 (Crete). generally,
twig, branch, of the vine, Thphr.CP3.7.3; of the tamarisk, Hsch., Phot., dub. in Orph.Fr.31 ii 10. at Troezen,
wild olive tree, Paus.2.32.10.

r(a_x-o/w,
cover with wattle-work, prob. in IG22.463.82.
r(ayavudo/s, late Boeot. for r(ayw|do/s, IG7.3195 (Orchomenos).

r(a/yis, ews, h(, (r(a/ptw)
stitching together, e)pw=n Eust.6.36.

r(ayw|d-e/w,
recite poems, esp. those of Homer, ti/ dh/ pot' ou)=n . . r(ayw|dei=s . . periiw/n; Pl.Ion 541b; a(/ te eu)= r(ayw|dei= kai\ a(\ mh/ ib.533c, cf. Isoc. 12.33; of the poems of Archilochus, Clearch.61; ti peri/ tinos Luc. JConf.1:—Pass., of the poems,
to be recited, Lycurg.102. abs., Arist.Po.1462a6; of Homer and Hesiod, r(. periio/ntas
reciting or
declaiming, Pl.R.600d; *cenofa/nhs . . e)rrayw/|dei ta\ e(autou= D.L.9.18; e)mme/trws e)rr. pro\s a)/ndras fi/lous Luc.Nec.1. in contemptuous sense,
repeat by heart or
rote, declaim, ou)de\n . . a)ll' h)\ r(ayw|dh/sousin oi( pre/sbeis periio/ntes D.14.12, cf. 25.2, Luc.DMort.15.2; [lo/goi] r(ayw|dou/menoi a)/neu a)nakri/sews kai\ didaxh=s Pl.Phdr.277e, cf. Phld.Rh.2.39S. c. acc. pers.,
sing of one,
celebrate, tou\s a)ndrei/ous Ar.Ec. 679.

r(ayw|d-i/a, h(,
recitation of Epic poetry, Pl.Ion 533b; a)=qla . . oi( pate/res e)/qesan r(. Id.Ti.21b.
Epic composition, opp. lyric (kiqarw|di/a）, e)pideiknu/nai r(. Id.Lg.658b; e)pi（v.l. a)po-）telei=n Clearch.62: generally, of all kinds of poetry, poiei=n mikth\n r(. e)c a(pa/ntwn me/trwn Arist. Po.1447b22.
portion of an Epic poem fit for recitation at one time, e.g. a
book of the Iliad or Odyssey, Plu.2.186e, Luc.DMort. 20.2, Cont.7. contemptuously,
rigmarole, Plu.2.514c (pl.).

r(ayw|d-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a rhapsodist: h( -kh/ (with and without te/xnh)
the rhapsodist's art, Pl.Ion 538b, 540a, al. Adv. -kw=s Eust. 3.55.

r(ayw|d-o/s, o(,
reciter of Epic poems, sts. applied to the
bard who recited his own poem, as to Hesiod, Nicocl. ap. Sch.Pi.N.2.2 (v. infr.); but usu.,
professional reciters, esp.
of the poems of Homer, Hdt.5.67, Pl.Ion 530c, etc.: also r(. ku/wn, ironically, of the Sphinx who
chanted her riddle, S.OT391. (Prob. from r(a/ptw, a)oidh/; Hes.Fr. 265 speaks of himself and Homer as e)n nearoi=s u(/mnois r(a/yantes a)oidh/n, and Pi.N.2.2 calls Epic poets r(aptw=n e)pe/wn a)oidoi/: not from r(a/bdos (cf. r(a/bdos 1.6) as if r(abdw|do/s (Eust.6.24, r(abdw|di/a ib.16).)
r(a/wn, r(a/|ws, v. r(a/|dios.

r(e/a^, Ep. Adv. of r(a/|dios,
easily, lightly, Il.5.304, 8.179, etc.; cf. r(ei=a, r(a=. [^^ or -, ll. cc.; but as one long syll. in 12.381, 13.144, Hes. Op.5.]

*(re/a_, h(, Ep. *(rei/h Il.14.203 (in gen. *(rei/hs, v.l. *(rei/as), h.Cer.442, h.Ap.93 (*(re/h codd.), h.Ven.43, Hes.Th.625 (*(rei/an ib.135); *(rei=a d' u(podmhqei=sa ib.453 (but with v.l. *(rei/h d' au)= dmhqei=sa); gen. *(rei/as AP6.219.20 (Antip.); the common form *(re/a is found in Il.15.187, as a monosyll.; contr. *(rh= Pherecyd.Syr.9; *(re/h h.Cer.459, Hes. Th.467:—Rhea, daughter of Uranos and Gaia, wife of Cronos, mother of Zeus and the gods, ll. cc. [Derived by Chrysipp.Stoic.2.318 from r(e/w, because rivers flow from Earth.] Pythag. name for 2, Anatolius ap.Theol.Ar.12; also for 23 or 8, ib.55.

r(e/ansis, ews, h(, prob. = le/ansis,
polishing with wine as a cleanser (cf. Varro RR2.11.7, Juv.5.24), Stud.Pal.22.183.109 (ii A.D.).

r(eanth/s, ou=, o(, prob. = *leanth/s,
polisher, BGU185.10 (ii A.D.).

r(egeu/s, e/ws, o(,
dyer, EM703.28 (vv. ll. r(agei=s, r(hgei=s); also r(egisth/s, ou=, o(, Hsch.; cf. r(ogeu/s.
r(egew/n, w=nos, h(,= r(egiw/n, BCH24.337 (Caria).

r(egewna/rxhs, ou, o(,
president of a regio, in pl., Lyd.Mens.4.138.

r(egiw/n, w=nos, h(, Lat.
regio, CIG3436 (Philadelphia).

r(e/gk-os, eos, to/,
snoring, stertorous breathing, Hp.Acut.17, Epid. 5.55; also r(e/gxh, h(, Erot. s.v. diaro/gxas, and r(e/gxos, to/, Hp.Epid. 5.104, 7.77; cf. sq.

r(e/gk-w,
snore, A.Eu.53, Eup. 267, Ar.Nu.5, al.; of horses,
snort, E.Rh.785; of a dolphin asleep, Arist.HA537b3, 566b15:—in Ar.Eq.115 also in Med. r(e/gketai, but (as Sch. observes) only to balance pe/rdetai; but cf. ll. cc. infr.—The form r(e/gxw occurs in Hp.Aph.6.51, Arist. ll. cc., Men.Mon.711, Herod.8.2, LXX Jn.1.5,6, Orph.Fr.148: Med., th=s pleura=s r(e/gxomai I
am wheezing from my lung, POxy.1414.26 (iii A.D.), cf. AP11.343.

r(egk-w/dhs, es,
as if snoring, only in form r(egx-, Hp.Epid.5.105, 7.14.

r(e/gma, atos, to/, (r(e/zw (B))
that which is dyed, Ibyc.10 B; cf. r(e/gos.

r(e/gcis, ews, h(, (r(e/gkw)
stertorous breathing, Hp.Acut.17.

r(e/gos, eos, to/, = r(h=gos (q.v.),
rug, coverlet, Anacr.138.
r(e/gxos, r(e/gxw, r(egxw/dhs, v. r(egk-. r(e/da, r(e/dion, v. r(ai=da, r(ai/dion. r(e/ddw, v. r(e/zw (A). r(e/eqron, Ion. and poet. for r(ei=qron (q.v.).

r(e/zw (A), freq. in Ep. and Trag. (v. infr.), but rare in Att. Prose and Com. (Pherecr. 152 is mock heroic): impf. e)/rezon Il.2.400, Ep. r(e/zon Od.3.5, Ion. r(e/zeskon Il.8.250: fut. r(e/cw Od.11.31, A.Eu.788 (lyr.), al.: aor. e)/rreca Il.9.536, 10.49, Pl.Lg.642c; poet. also e)/reca Hom. (v. infr.), Hes.Fr.174, S.OC538 (lyr.), etc.; Aeol. part. r(e/cais Pi.O. 9.94:—Pass., aor. 1 opt. r(exqei/h Hp.Epid.7.11; part. r(exqei/s Il.9.250, 20.198. (r(e/zw from vre/g-
yw, cogn. with e)/rdw from ve/rg-
yw [through ve/r
zdw]: Dor. and Boeot. r(e/ddw Eust.226.8, 984.1, Hsch.; aor. part. vre/canta IG4.1607 (Cleonae).)
do, act, deal, opp. ei)pei=n, Od.4.205, 22.314; opp. paqei=n, v. infr.:—Constr., abs., w(=de de\ r(e/cai Il.2.802; ou) kata\ moi=ran e)/recas Od.9.352, etc. more freq. trans. c. acc. rei,
do, accomplish, make, o(/s' a)\n pepnume/nos a)nh\r ei)/poi kai\ r(e/ceie 4.205; me/rmera e)/rga, o(/ss' a)/ndres r(e/cantes . . Il.10.525, cf. Od.22.314; ti/ r(e/comen; Il.11.838; me/ga r(e/cas ti kai\ e)ssome/noisi puqe/sqai 22.305, cf. 2.274; o(/ ti possi/n te r(e/ch| kai\ xersi/n Od.8.148; so in Lyr. and Trag., r(e/zonta/ ti kai\ paqei=n e)/oike Pi.N.4.32; ti/ r(e/cw; A.Eu.788, cf. Th.104 (both lyr.); ti/ r(e/cas tu/xoim' a)\n . . ; Id.Ch.316 (lyr.):—Pass., ou)de/ ti mh=xos r(exqe/ntos kakou= e)/st' a)/kos eu(rei=n for the mischief
if once done, Il.9.250; r(exqe\n de/ te nh/pios e)/gnw 17.32. c. dupl. acc. pers. et rei,
do something
to one, kaka\ r(e/cai tina/ 3.354, Od.2.73; a)gaqa\ r(. tina/ 22.209, cf. Il.9.647; ou)de/n se r(e/cw kaka/ 24.370, cf. 4.32, Od.2.72: with Adv., kakw=s min e)/r.
wronged him, 23.56; so h( po/lis h(ma=s ou) kalw=s e)/rrece Pl.Lg.642c: but c. dat. pers., mhke/ti moi kaka\ r(e/zete
do me (ethic dat.) no more mischiefs, Od.20.314; o(/sa brotoi=s e)/recas kaka/ E.Med.1292 (lyr.). with strengthd. signf., ei)/ ti no/os r(e/cei if it
shall avail aught,
be of any
service, Il.14.62. in special sense,
perform sacrifices, i(era\ r(. Od.1.61, 3.5; r(. e(kato/mbas a)qana/tois
offer a hecatomb to the gods, Il.23.206, cf. Od. 5.102, Pi.P.10.34; r(. qalu/sia/ tini Il.9.535; qu/mata *zhni\ th=s a(lw/s ews S.Tr.288: abs.,
do sacrifice, r(. qew=| Il.2.400, 8.250, etc.: sts. with the victim in acc., soi/ . . r(e/cw bou=n h)=nin
will sacrifice it, 10.292, cf. Od.9.553, 10.523.

r(e/zw (B), Dor. Verb,= ba/ptw,
dye, Phot., EM703.27, cf. Epich. 107. (Cf. r(e/gos, r(egeu/s, r(egisth/s, and lengthd. r(h=gos, r(hgeu/s, also r(ogeu/s:—cogn. with Skt.
rajyate 'is coloured or red'.)

r(eqoma_li/das, a, o(, (mh=lon (B))
with cheeks like apples, Alc.150.

r(e/qos, eos, to/,
limb, usu. in pl. r(e/qea,
limbs, yuxh\ d' e)k r(eqe/wn ptame/nh Il.16.856; r(eqe/wn e)k qumo\n e(/lhtai 22.68, cf. Theoc.23.39. in sg.,
face, countenance, S.Ant.529 (anap.), E.HF1204 (anap.), Theoc. 29.16: Aeol. in this sense acc. to Eust.1090.27; it occurs in broken context, Sapph.Supp.11.3.
body, Lyc.173.

r(ei=a, Ep. for r(e/a, r(a= (qq. v.), (sts. elided, Il.15.356, Od.17.273), Adv. of r(a/|dios,
easily, lightly, freq. in Hom. (v. infr.) and Hes. (Op.6, al., but r(e/a ib.5); qeoi\ r(ei=a zw/ontes the gods who live
at ease, Il.6.138, Od.4.805; tou/toisin me\n tau=ta me/lei, ki/qaris kai\ a)oidh/, r(ei=a
lightly, pleasantly, 1.160; strengthd. r(ei=a ma/l' Il.3.381, 15.362, etc.; w(s r(ei=a kubista=|
easily, deftly, 16.745, cf. 749.
*(rei/h, h(, Ep. and Ion. for *(re/a.

r(ei=qr-on, to/, Att. contr. from Ion. and Ep. r(e/eqron, which is used by Trag. once in dialogue, A.Pers.497, freq. in lyr.: (r(e/w):—
that which flows, a river, stream, potamoi=o r(e/eqra
the streams, waters of . ., Il.14.245; e)rateina\ r(. 21.218; *stugo\s u(/datos ai)pa\ r(. 8.369, cf. h.Hom.19.9, etc.; parqeno/sfaga r(.
streams of a maiden's blood, A.Ag. 210 (lyr.): sg., e)ktre/yasa tou= potamou= to\ r(e/eqron pa=n e)s to\ w)/ruce xwri/on Hdt.1.186, cf. 179, Th.7.74; *)alfeou= r(e/eqron Pi.O.9.18; r(e/eqron a(gnou= *strumo/nos A.Pers.497; o(/tan pera/sh|s r(ei=qron Id.Pr.790; esp. of
rivulets, brooks, X.Cyn.5.15, Plb.3.71.4, Jul.Or.3.126d.
bed or
channel of a river, a)/yorron . . ku=ma kat e/ssuto kala\ r(e/eqra Il.21.382; potamou= r(. a)pechrasme/non Hdt.7.109; potamo\n e)ktrape/sqai e)k tw=n a)rxai/wn r(. Id.1.75; parat re/yas [to\n potamo\n] di' w(=n nu=n r(e/ei r(ee/qrwn, i.e. e)k tw=n r(ee/qrwn di' w(=n nu=n r(e/ei, Id.7.130, cf. 127:—signf. 1 and 11 are sts. hard to distinguish, cf. Hdt.1.191, 2.11, 9.51.

r(eiqr-w/dhs, es,
full of streams, Gloss.
r(ei=os, Cypr. for a)sqenh/s, EM539.30.

r(eita/, ta/, name of sacred
streams at Eleusis, S.Fr.1089; also r(eitoi/, oi(, Paus.1.38.1, Hsch.; sg. in SIG86.5 (Eleusis, V B.C.); r(i=toi Hdn.Gr.2.577, wrongly, as shown by the spelling *(reto/n SIG l.c.
r(ei/ths, o(, only in Gramm., as part of the compds. baqur-, e)u+r-rei/ths, Choerob. in An.Ox.2.256, etc.
r(ei=tos or r(eito/s, o(, dub. sens., name of an object in a gymnasium, r(ei/tous e)pixru/sous du/o BCH54.101 (Delos, ii B.C.). v. r(eita/.
r(ei/w, Ep.for r(e/w. r(e/kos (gender unknown), expld. in Theognost. Can.11 by zw/nh.
r(e/k-teira, h(, fem. of sq., Man.1.212.

r(ek-th/r, h=ros, o(, (r(e/zw)
worker, doer, like Homer's prhkth/r, kakw=n Hes.Op.191. c. gen. objecti,
worker in a thing, xrusoi=o Man.1.297, cf. 4.149.

r(ek-th/rios, a, on,
active, busy, Ion Hist.1.

r(e/k-ths, ou, o(, = r(ekth/r,
active, Plu. Brut.12, Aret.SD1.6.

r(ek-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
able to do, tw=n e)f' h(mi=n mo/nwn r(ektiko\s o( spoudai=os Porph.ad Od.1.5.
r(emb-a/s, a/dos, pecul. fem. of r(embo/s, v.l. in LXX Si.26.8.

r(emb-asmo/s, o(,
roaming about: metaph.,
wavering, anxious turn of mind, ib.Wi. 4.12.
r(emb-eu/w, = r(e/mbomai, ib.Is.23.16.

r(e/mb-h, h(,
wandering, metaph., kata\ fwnh\n h)=n e)n th=| r(e/mbh| Hp.Epid.7.17 (restored for r(embi/h| from Gal.19.134).
r(emboeidh/s, e/s, f.l. in Hp.Art.45 and Erot.ad loc. (Fr.41) for r(aiboeidh/s.
r(embona/w, = r(umbona/w, Hsch.

r(emb-o/s, o/n,
roaming, roving, of a slave, prob. in BGU887.5, 16 (ii A.D.); of a lecturer on tour, Aristid.Or.33(51).28; r(. th=| dianoi/a| Antyll. ap. Orib.9.14.7; yuxh/ M.Ant.2.17(v.l.).

r(e/mb-os, o(,
roving, Plu.2.603e, Aret.SD2.6.

r(e/mb-w,
turn round and round, Act. r(e/mbei: plana=tai, Gal.19.134:—Pass., aor. inf. r(emfqh=nai Hsch. Med. r(e/mbomai,
roam, rove, roll about, Men.481.15, PCair.Zen.447.10 (iii B.C.), Ptol.Euerg.3J., POxy.1581.6(ii A.D.), D.Chr.62.7; e)/cw r(. LXX Pr.7.12; a)po\ tou= stratope/dou Plu.Fab.20; e)n *peiraiei= Id.Dem. 6; ei)n a(li/ AP9.415 (Antiphil.); o)/mmasi ib.5.288 (Agath.): metaph.,
to be unsteady, act at random, e)n toi=s pra/gmasi Plu.Pomp.20; e)n ei)dw/lois kai\ skiai=s Id.2.80f; of food eaten without an appetite, ib. 664a; r(e/mbetai h( le/cis
is vague, S.E.M.2.52. (Cf. Lith.
reñgtis 'bend, curve (intr.)'.)

r(emb-w/dhs, es,
roving, rolling, ble/mma Plu.2.45d. metaph.,
desultory, remiss, poliorki/a Plb.16.39.2; diatribai/
idle, Plu. Dio 7; to\ r(. （r(omb- codd.) kai\ a)ko/laston Id.2.715c; r(. puretoi/
irregular, opp. periodikoi/, Chrysipp. ap. Gal.5.433 (r(omb- codd.). Adv. -dw=s Hsch. s.v. skalapa/zein (-adw=s cod.).
r(e/mfos, eos, to/, Aeol. for r(a/mfos, Hsch. r(e/mw, = peirw=mai, du/namai, Theognost.Can.11, Suid., but = o)duna=|, sh/pei, Hsch., Phot.
r(e/on, ontos, to/, （r(e/w） = r(uto/n (r(uto/s 11), Astyd.3.3.
r(e/on, to/, = r(h=on, Aët.1.347, Alex.Trall.5.5,9.2,12, Paul.Aeg.7.11.59.

r(e/os, eos, to/, (r(e/w) like r(eu=ma,
anything flowing, stream, A.Ag.901, Pr.676,812; also of tears, dakrusi/stakton r(. ib.401.

r(ep-te/on,
one must incline, e)pi/ ti Archig. ap. Orib.8.2.22.

r(ep-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
inclining, o)/recis r(. pro/s ti Stoic.3.108.

r(e/p-w, mostly used in pres. and impf.: fut. r(e/yw Hdt.7.139, Paus.9.37.8: aor. e)/rreya Hp. Art.38,48, Pl.Phlb.46e; poet. e)/reya Cerc.4.32:—
turn the scale, sink, e)ti/taine ta/lanta, e(/lke de\ me/ssa labw/n, r(e/pe d' ai)/simon h)=mar *)axaiw=n, implying defeat and death, Il.8.72; r(e/pe d' *(/ektoros ai)/simon h)=mar 22.212; to\ tou=de/ g' au)= r(e/pei Ar.Ra.1393; tou= tala/ntou to\ r(e/pon ka/tw badi/zei to\ de\ keno\n pro\s to\n *di/a Id.Fr.488.4, cf. Cerc. l.c.; to\ me\n ka/tw r(e/pon . ., baru/: to\ de\ a)/nw, kou=fon Pl.Just.373e; a)ei\ tou)nanti/on r(. Id.R.550e, cf. Archim.Aequil.1 Praef. more generally, of things,
incline one way or the other, o(/ ti polla=| r(e/poi what
is always shifling, never steady, Pi.O.8.23; blemma/twn r(e/pei bolh/
inclines downward, falls, of a young girl's eye, A.Fr.242; u(/pnos e)pi\ glefa/rois r(e/pwn sleep
falling upon the eyes, Pi.P.9.25; e)s to\ lordo/n, kufo/n, Hp.Art.48; r(. pro\s th\n gh=n Arist.PA686a32, etc. of one of two contending parties,
preponderate, prevail, e)pi\ o(ko/tera [oi( *)aqhnai=oi] e)tra/ponto, tau=ta r(e/yein e)/melle Hdt.7.139; moi skopoume/nw| e)/rreye dei=n on consideration [the opinion] that it was necessary
prevailed, Pl.Ep.328b; h)qw=n . ., a(\ a)\n w(/sper r(e/yanta ta)/lla e)felku/shtai Id.R.544e. of persons, eu)= r(e/pei qeo/s
is favourably
inclined, A.Th.21; e)pi\ to\ prhne/s the doctor should
incline towards (
prefer) pronation, Hp.Fract.1 (unless in signf. 2, the subject being th\n xei=ra）; r(. e)pi\ to\ pei/qesqai Isoc.15.4; e)pi\ to\ lh=mma D.18.298; pro\s th\n a)ndrei/an Pl.Plt.308a, cf. Lg.802e; also r(. tai=s gnw/mais e)pi\ tou\s *(rodi/ous Plb.33.16.2; ei)/s tina Luc.
Bis Acc.6; but nomi/zwn tou/tous plei=ston r(e/pein e)pi\ to\ a)gaqo\n th=| po/lei
avail most,
have the greatest
influence, X.Lac.4.1, cf. Isyll.24; so also ei)s e(/n ti ai( e)piqumi/ai sfo/dra r(e/pousin Pl.R.485d, cf. Phlb.46e; r(. pro\s [th\n h(donh/n] Arist.EN1172a31; r(. pro\s th\n o)ligarxi/an Id.Pol.1293b20. r(. ei)/s tina
fall to, be directed towards, to\ mhtro\s e)/s de/ moi r(e/pei ste/rghqron A.Ch.240; tou)/rgon ei)s e)me\ r(e/pon that this deed
points to me, S.OT 847. of events,
fall, happen, in a certain way, filei= tou=to mh\ tau/th| r(e/pein Id.Ant.722; th=|de or e)kei/nh| r(. Pl.Lg.862c, Ti.79e; r(. ei)/s ti
turn or
come to something, sumfora\n . . kakw=n r(e/pousan e)s ta\ ma/ssona A.Pers.440; to\ mhde\n ei)s ou)de\n r(. naught
comes to naught, E.Fr. 532; o( xrhsmo\s e)s tou=to r(. Ar.Pl.51; o( gri=fos e)ntau=qa r(. Antiph.124.11. trans.,
cause the scale
to incline one way or the other, only in compds. e)pirre/pw, katarre/pw, exc. that A. uses the Pass., tw=nd' e)c i)/sou r(epome/nwn
being equally
balanced, Supp.405 (lyr.):—in B.16.25, o(/ ti me\n e)k qew=n moi=ra pagkrath\s a)/mmi kate/neuse kai\ *di/kas r(e/pei ta/lanton, r(. is prob. intrans. (sc. e)p' au)to/). (Perh. cogn. with Lith.
virpti 'quiver'.)
r(eru^pwme/nos, v. r(upo/w.

r(eu=ma, atos, to/, (r(e/w)
that which flows, current, stream, A.Pr.139 (anap.), X.HG4.2.11; meilixi/wn potw=n r(. S.OC160 (lyr.); e)lai/ou r(. a)yofhti\ r(e/ontos Pl.Tht.144b; r(eu=ma melissw=n AP9.404 (Antiphil.): metaph., r(. au)/chs kai\ trofh=s, o)/yews, Pl.Ti.44b, 45c; to\ a)kou/ein gi/netai r(eu/mato/s tinos ferome/nou a)po\ tou= fwnou=ntos Epicur.Ep. 1p.13U.
stream of a river, Hdt.2.20, 24; r(. *dirkai=on E.Supp.637, cf. IT401 (lyr.); to\ tou= *nei/lou r(. Pl. Ti.21e; also,
eruption of lava, Th.3.116, Carc.5.7: metaph.,
stream or
flood of men, mega/lw| r(. fwtw=n A.Pers. 88 (anap.); r(. *persikou= stratou= ib.412, cf. E.IT1437; pollw=| r(. prosnisso/menoi
S.Ant.129(anap.); so r(eu/mata e)pw=n Cratin.186; klauqmw=n kai\ o)durmw=n Plu.2.609b.
flood, katelqo/ntos ai)fnidi/ou tou= r(. Th. 4.75, cf. Hdt.8.12; ferome/nw| sunapenexqh=nai tw=| r(. Demad.15.
that which is always flowing or
changing, to\ th=s tu/xhs . . r(. metapi/ptei taxu/ the
ebb and flow of fortune, Men.Georg.Fr.2. Medic.,
humour or
discharge from the body,
flux, rheum, dia\ tw=n r(inw=n Hp. VM18; r(. ei)s tou\s po/das katelhlu/qei Luc.Philops.6; r(. noshmatika/ Arist.Sens.444a13; stoma/xou kai\ koili/as r(. Dsc.1.83; kataskh=yai r(. ei)s ta\ neu=ra Paus.6.3.10: abs.,POxy.1088.1(i A.D.), Plu.Mar.34, etc.

r(euma^t-i/zomai, Pass.,
flow as a current, Str.1.3.7.
suffer from a flux, Ti.Locr.103a, Dsc.2.126, 4.40, Plu.2.902a; so also in Act. r(eumati/zw, Porph.Abst.1.28.

r(euma^t-iko/s, h/, o/n, (r(eu=ma 111)
subject to a discharge or
flux, ei)s tou\s o)fqalmou/s Arist.Pr.957b25; e(/lkh r(. Dsc.2.126; trau=ma Plu.2.131b.

r(euma^/t-ion, to/, Dim. of r(eu=ma 111, Arist. Pr.901a3.
rivulet, Plu.Thes.27.
r(euma^t-ismo/s, o(,= r(eu=ma (signf. 111), Hp.Coac.567, Dsc.1.82, 4.64, Gal.14.276, Arch.Pap.4.270 (iii A.D.), etc.

r(euma^t-w/dhs, es,
like a flux, Hp.Epid.7.5: Comp., Gal.19.535.
in flood, swollen, potamoi/ Tz.H.3.122.

r(eu=sis, ews, h(,
flowing, Epicur.Ep.1p.11U., Hero Spir.1.3, Diog. Oen.4, Dsc.2.151 (interpol.).

r(eus-ta^le/os, a, on,
liquid, fluent, Orac. ap. Eus.PE4.9.

r(eus-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
flowing, liquid, Plu.Aem.14, 2.905e. Adv. -kw=s ib.878f.

r(eus-to/s, h/, o/n,
in a state of flux, flowing, e)/rga Emp.121.3; h( u(/lh Arist.Fr.207, S.E.P.1.217, Porph.Antr.5; of time flowing away, Ath.Mech.3.10. metaph.,
fluctuating, unsettled, ou)si/a Plu.2.268d; o)lisqhra\n kai\ r(. ei)s a(/panta th\n polupragmosu/nhn poiou=ntes ib.522a.
r(efa^ni/s, v. r(afani/s. r(e/fa^nos, v. r(a/fanos.

r(e/w, Il.22.149, etc.; Ep. r(ei/w Hes.Fr.263 (dub.), D.P.1074, AP7.36 (Eryc.), but not in Hom.: impf. 3sg. e)/rrei Il.17.86, Telecl.1.4, but elsewhere in Hom. e)/rree or r(e/e: fut. r(eu/somai Thgn.448, E.Fr. 384, Crates Com.15.4, Pherecr.130.5, Hp.Haem.5; also r(eusou=mai, Arist.Mete.356a16, 361a33; later r(eu/sw, AP5.124 (Bass.): aor. e)/rreusa Ar.Eq.526(anap.), Hp.Loc.Hom.11, Int.23, Mosch.3.33, AP5.32 (Parmen.), Plb.5.15.7 (a)p-), Paus.5.7.4, etc.:—but the Att. fut. and aor. are of pass. form, r(u^h/somai Isoc.8.140, cf. Hp.Nat.Hom.5; e)rru/hn [u^] Th.3.116, X.Cyr.8.3.30, Pl.Ti.84c, etc., as also in Hdt.8.138; Dor. e)c-erru/a, v. e)kre/w; 3sg. subj. e)[g]rua=| GDI3591a51 (Calymna); Ep. 3sg. r(u/h Od.3.455: pf. e)rru/hka Hp.Loc.Hom.10, Pl.R. 485d, Isoc.8.5; later e)/rruka, Gal.5.398.—A pres. Med. r(e/omai occurs also in Orac. ap. Hdt.7.140 (v. infr.), Plu.Cor.3, Luc.Salt.71, Philostr. VS1.25.9, etc.; so e)rrei=to E.Hel.1602, Philostr.VA8.31, etc.—This Verb does not contr. eh, eo, ew:—
flow, run, stream, gush, Od.19.204, Il.3.300, 17.86, etc.: with dat. of that which flows, [phgh\] u(/dati r(e/ei the fountain
runs with water, 22.149, cf. Od.5.70, IG12.54.7; r(e/e d' ai(/mati gai=a Il.8.65, etc.; fa/ragges u(/dati . . r(e/ousai E.Tr.449 (troch.); r(ei= ga/lakti pe/don r(ei= d' oi)/nw| Id.Ba.142(lyr.); oi)/nw| . . e)/rrei xara/dra Telecl.l.c.(v. sub fin.); (also in Med., i(drw=ti r(eou/menoi (metri gr. for r(eo/menoi, cf. maxeou/menoi) Orac. ap. Hdt.7.140; fo/nw| nau=s e)rrei=to E. Hel.1602); po/lin xrusw=| r(e/ousan Id.Tr.995: so metaph., pollw=| r(. e)pai/nw| Ar.Eq.527: rarely with acc. in the same sense (v. infr. 11.2): also with gen., a)sfa/ltou Str.7.5.8; pollou= u(/datos Arr.An. 5.9.4: sts. with nom., *zeu\s xruso\s r(uei/s Isoc.10.59, cf. AP5.32 (Parmen.). the post-Hom. expression for
a full stream is me/gas r(ei=, r(e/ousi mega/loi Hdt.2.25; me/gas e)rru/h Id.8.138, cf. Th.2.5; r(. ou)de\n h(=sson h)\ nu=n Hdt.7.129; also polu\s r(ei=, metaph. of men, r(ei= polu\s o(/de lew/s A.Th.80(lyr.); *ku/pris h)\n pollh\ r(uh=| E.Hipp.443 (cf. infr. 2); so r(. mou to\ da/kruon polu/ Ar.Lys.1034; also e)s e)/rwta a(/pas r(. Ps.-Phoc.193; pro\s to\n *)alkibia/dhn o( dh=mos o(/los e)rru/h Plu.Alc. 21. of a river, also r(. a)po\ thkome/nhs xio/nos
derive its stream from melted snow, Hdt.2.22. prov., a)/nw r(ei=n
flow upwards, of inversion of the usual or right order, E.Supp.520; a)/nw potamw=n e)rru/hsan oi( . . lo/goi D.19.287; cf. a)/nw (B)1. tau=ta me\n r(ei/tw kat' ou)=ron (v. ou)=ros (A))S.Tr.468. metaph. of things, e)k xeirw=n be/lea r(e/on from their hands
rained darts, Il.12.159; r(ei= ma/lista o( a)h\r r(e/wn e)n toi=s u(yhloi=s Arist.Mete.347a34, cf. 349a34; flo\c r(uei=sa Plu.Brut.31; so th\n *ai)/tnhn r(uh=nai Ael.Fr.2; esp. of a
flow of words, a)po\ glw/sshs me/litos gluki/wn r(e/en au)dh/ Il.1.249, cf. Hes.Th.39.97; e)/pe' e)k sto/matos r(ei= mei/lixa ib.84: abs., of the tongue,
run glibly, A.Th.557; so qrasunome/nw| kai\ pollw=| r(e/onti kaq' u(mw=n D.18.136: hence, of words or sentiments,
to be current, klhdo/nos kalh=s ma/thn r(eou/shs S.OC 259.
fall, drop off, e.g. of hair, Od.10.393, Hes.Fr.29, Theoc. 2.89, etc.; of ripe fruit, Plb.12.4.14, Gp.9.12; of over-ripe corn, h)/dh r(e/onta to\n sta/xun Babr.88.14;
wear out, ei) r(e/oi to\ sw=ma kai\ a)pollu/oito Pl.Phd.87d; of a house,
to be in a tumble-down condition, Gorg. ap. Stob.4.51.28, Teles p.27 H.; r(e/ousan su/gkrisin sth=sai to stay a
collapse of the system, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.5.27.1. of molten objects,
liquefy, run, r(ei= pa=n a)/dhlon S.Tr.698; th/ketai o( li/qos . . w(/ste kai\ r(ei=n Arist.Mete.383b6, cf. Thphr.Lap.9.
to be in perpetual flux and change, a(/panq' o(rw= a(/ma th=| tu/xh| r(e/onta metapi/ptonta/ te Com.Adesp.200; w(s i)o/ntwn a(pa/ntwn a)ei\ kai\ r(eo/ntwn Pl.Cra. 439c, cf. 411c; kinei=tai kai\ r(ei= . . ta\ pa/nta Id.Tht.182c: hence oi( r(e/ontes, of the Heraclitean philosophers, opp. oi( tou= o(/lou stasiw=tai, ib.181a. '
run', of ink, etc., metaph., stigmh=s r(uei/shs grammh\n fantasiou/meqa . ., grammh=s de\ r(uei/shs pla/tos e)poih/samen S.E.M.7.99; cf. r(ui/skomai 11. of persons, r(. e)pi/ ti
to be inclined, given to a thing, Isoc.8.5; pro/s ti Pl.R.485d; oi( tau/th| r(ue/ntes ib.495b.
leak, of a ship, opp. stegano\n ei)=nai, Arist.Fr.554, cf. Paus.8.50.7; lu/xnoi r(e/ontes prob.in Roussel
Cultes Egyptiens p.222(Delos, ii B.C.); of a roof, Men.Sam.248; [a)ggei=on] r(e/on Plu.2.782e; oi)noxo/ai r(e/ousai Michel 815.131 (Delos, iv B.C.).
to have a flux, ta\s koili/as ta\s r(eou/sas D.S.5.41. impers., e)k r(inw=n e)rru/h Hp.Epid.1.19. very rarely trans.,
let flow, pour, e)/rrei xoa/s E.Hec.528 (as v.l. for ai)/rei):—this differs from the usage c. acc. cogn., r(ei/tw ga/la, me/li,
let the land
run milk, honey, Theoc.5.124,126; ai(=ma r(uh/setai, of the Nile, Ezek.Exag.133; oi)=non r(e/wn Luc.VH1.7, cf. LXXJl.3(4).18, Sch.Ar.Pl.287:—in place of this acc. the best writers commonly used the dat., v. supr. 1.1. v. r(e/on. (Cf. r(o/vos, Skt.
sravati, Lith.
sravēti 'flow': I.-E.
srěw- alternating with
sr[ocaron]w- and
sr[ucaron]-.）
r(h=a, v. r(a=, ad fin.

r(hgeu/s, e/ws, o(, (r(h=gos)
dyer, Sch.Il.9.661, Hsch.
r(hgh/, prob. f.l. for r(agh/, Gal.19.134.

r(h=g-ma, atos, to/, (r(h/gnumi)
breakage, fracture, joined with spa/sma, Hp.
Aër.4, cf. D.18.198, Dsc.3.74; with stre/mma (a strain), D.2.21, 11.14.
laceration, rupture, Gal.10.160, 18(2).882, cf. Arist.HA 635a4.
rent, tear, in clothes, Archipp.38.
cleft, chasm, r(. th=s gh=s Arist.HA628b29;
chink, e)n toi/xois Plb.13.6.8;
breach in a dyke, PLond.1.131r.45,60 (i A.D.).
lesion or
rupture of tissue, o(/tan u(po\ bi/hs diaste/wsin ai( sa/rkes a)p' a)llh/lwn Hp.Flat.11, cf. Gal.1.238, 10.232; esp. oflung, Hp.Loc.Hom.14, Morb.1.20:hence r(hgma^ti/as, ou, o(,
one who has such a rupture, Id.
Aër.4, Dsc.3.146, 4.10; tou\s e)k bhxo\s r(hgmati/as Hippiatr.22; but r(hgmati/as pleu/monos perh. =
pleurisy, Hp.Morb.2.53; r(hgma^tw/dhs, es, Id.Epid.7.26.

r(hg-mi/n or r(hg-mi/s (neither form is found, unless [r(hgmi\]n is to be restd. in IGRom.4.272.1(Elaea, cf.
Wiener Sitzb.214(4).26)), gen.i=nos, h(,
sea breaking on the beach, surf (v. r(h/gnumi B.1), a)/kron e)pi\ r(hgmi=nos a(lo\s . . qe/eskon Il.20.229; kw/ph|sin a(lo\s r(hgmi=na baqei=an tu/ptete, of the
broken sea between Scylla and Charybdis, Od.12.214; with the Prep. e)pi/, it may be rendered
at the sea's edge, e)k . . bai=non e)pi\ r(hgmi=ni qala/sshs Il.1.437, cf. Od.9.150; koimh/qhmen e)pi\ r(hgmi=ni qala/sshs ib.169, cf. Pi.N.5.13; a)/krais e)pi\ r(hgmi=sin a)ce/nou po/rou E.IT253; also laoi\ de\ para\ r(. qala/sshs di/skoisin te/rponto Il.2.773, cf. Od.4.449; o(/tan kumai/nousa e)kba/llh| [h( qa/latta], . . paxei=ai kai\ skoliai\ gi/nontai ai( r(.: o(/tan de\ galh/nh h)=|, . . leptai/ ei)si kai\ eu)qei=ai Arist.Mete.367b14. metaph., r(. bi/oio
verge of life, i.e.
death, Emp.20.5; w(/sper r(hgmi=na ou)=san a)e/ros th\n nefe/lhn Arist.Mete.367b19. ta\ a)porpu/mata (fort. a)porrh/gmata） th=s pe/tras, Hsch.

r(hg-mo/s, o(,
fissure, gh= r(hgmw=n plh/rhs PSI4.422.15 (iii B.C.). = foreg., Hsch.

r(h/gnu_mi or r(hg-u/w (a)nar- Hp.Flat.10: impf. kat-errh/gnue D.21.63, etc.); later r(h/ssw, Gal.10.640, Orib.Fr.93, Gloss.; r(h/ssesqai PHolm.6.3, cf. 4.22; a)po-, dia-rrh/ssesqai, Hp.Int.17,42; r(h/ttw, Str.11.14.8, Dsc.4.150 (v.l. r(h/ssei), (peri-) Id.2.98, 3.18 (v.l. perirrh/ssei）; r(h/ttesqai Bito 45.8, Str.7.3.18: Ep. impf. r(h/gnuske Il.7.141: fut. r(h/cw 12.262, Hdt.2.2, (e)k-) S.Aj.775: aor. e)/rrhca Il.3.348, Pi.N.8.29, Ar.Nu.960; r(h=ca Il.6.6: pf. e)/rrhxa （di-) LXX 2 Ki.14.30, 15.32:—Med. r(h/gnu^mai, fut. r(h/comai, aor. e)rrhca/mhn, all in Il.（12.257, 224,291), pres. also in Hp.VC4,12: aor. e)rrhca/mhn E.Heracl.835, (kat-) X.Cyr.3.1.13; Ep. 3pl. r(h/canto Il.11.90:—Pass., subj. r(h/gnu_tai Hippon.19.4: Ep. 3sg. impf. r(hgnu/ato Arat.817: fut. r(a^gh/somai Plu.2.668a, (diar-, e)k-) Ar.Eq.340, A.Pr.369, etc.: aor. e)rra/ghn [a^] S.Fr.578, Ar.Nu.583, etc.; later e)rrh/xqhn, Tryph.11; dia-rrhxqh=| (v.l. -rragh=|) Hp.Int.29: pf. e)/rrhgmai （sun-) Od.8.137; but intr. pf. e)/rrwga is more freq., v. infr. c. 1; pf. part. fem. e)rrhgei=a, v. infr. c. 2; masc. pl. kat-errhgo/tas Hsch. The word is hardly used by correct Att. Prose-writers, exc. in Pass.:—
break asunder, rend, shatter, tei=xos Il.12.198; pu/las 13.124; sa/kos 21.165; qw/rhkas 2.544; i(ma/nta 3.375; neurh/n 8.328; o)ste/on 20.399; xro/a 23.673; only once in Od., proto/nous e)/rrhc' a)ne/moio qu/ella 12.409:—later, esp.
rend garments, in sign of grief, r(. pe/plous A.Pers.199, 468; r(. e(/lkea
make grievous wounds, Pi.N.8.29; r(. o)sta=, sa/rkas, E.HF994, Ba.1130; a)ro/trois gh=s da/pedon Ar.Pl.515: in Ion. and later Prose, r(h/gnusi . . to\n a)mfi\ th\n o)/yin xitw=na Hp.VM19; r(h/ttein neura/n Str.15.1.57; ta\ desma/ Luc.DDeor.17.1; ta\s pu/las Id.Par.46; mh\ strafe/ntes r(h/cwsin u(ma=s Ev.Matt.7.6:—Med.,
break for oneself, get broken, o)/rnusq' . . r(h/gnusqe de\ tei=xos Il.12.440, cf. 224, 257, 291:—Pass., v. infr. B.
break a line of battle or body of men, r(. fa/lagga, o(/milon, sti/xas a)ndrw=n, Il.6.6, 11.538, 15.615; to\ me/son r(h=cai
break through the centre, Hdt. 6.113: abs., e)rrhca/thn e)s ku/kla . . o(/plwn
broke through, S.Fr.210.9:— Med., r(h/casqai fa/laggas, sti/xas,
break oneself a way through the lines, Il.11.90, 13.680, cf. E.Heracl.835; r(hcame/nw| qe/sqai para\ nhusi\ ke/leuqon Il.12.411.
let break loose, e)/rida r(. 20.55 (Med.). after Hom., r(h=cai fwnh/n
let loose the voice, of children and persons who have been dumb or silent,
break into speech,
speak out, Hdt.1.85, 2.2, 5.93, cf. Ar.Nu.357,960; r(h=cai au)dh/n E.Supp.710; later r(h/casqai fwnh/n, qro/on au)dh=s, fqo/ggon,
utter, AP5.221 (Agath.), 7.597（Jul.), 9.61: abs., r(h=con kai\ bo/hson
cry aloud, LXXIs.54.1; v. infr.c. also dakru/wn r(h/casa . . na/mata
having let loose, having burst into floods of tears, S.Tr.919; klauqmo\n r(. Plu.Per.36; r(. ta\ o)/rh eu)frosu/nhn LXX Is.49.13; r(h/gnusi phga\s o( xw=ros Plu.Mar.19; r(. nefe/lhn e)/s tinas Philostr.Im.2.27; v. infr. B. Pass.,
break, break asunder, burst, ku=ma r(h/gnuto Il.18.67; ku=ma . . xe/rsw| r(hgnu/menon 4.425, Hes.Sc.377; of clouds, Ar.Nu.378; r(agh=nai/ ti th=s gh=s, as in an earthquake, Pl.R.359d; r(agei=sa *qhbai/wn ko/nis S.Fr.958; i(ma/tia r(age/nta X.Cyr.1.6.16; o)ste/on r(h/gnutai titrwsko/menon Hp.VC4; r(h/ttontai u(dri/ai (by the cold) Str.7.3.18; toi=s baska/nois ei)=nai r(h/gnusqai may the envious
burst, Aristid.Or.50 (26).69; toi=s ei)/ tis eu)dokimh/seien e)pi/ tw| r(hgnume/nois Lib.Or.29.13, cf. Or.1.207.
burst forth, like lightning, bronth\ d' e)rra/gh di'
a)straph=s S.Fr.578, Ar.Nu.583, cf. Plu.2.919b; so katamhni/wn r(age/ntwn Hp.Aph.5.32, cf. Nat.Mul.13, Arist.HA582b10, etc. of ships,
to be wrecked, D.56.21: metaph., pollw=n r(ageisw=n e)lpi/dwn A.Ag.505. of a stone, gra/mmati r(hgnu/menon
scored with lettering, i.e. inscribed, Puchstein Epigr.Gr.p.76 (Memphis, i B.C.). intr., like Pass.,
break or
burst forth, e)/rrhcen e)/metos Hp.Epid. 4.24; to\ pneu=ma r(h/gnusi Id.Nat.Puer.12; ei) e)qelh/sei r(h/cas u(perbh=nai o( potamo/s Hdt.2.99: metaph., o(poi=a xrh/|zei r(hgnu/tw S.OT1076 (in answer to the words de/doix' o(/pws mh\ . . a)narrh/cei kaka/): freq. in this signf. in pf. e)/rrwga,
to have broken out, e)/rrwge paga\ dakru/wn Id.Tr. 852 (lyr.): metaph., kakw=n pe/lagos e)/rrwgen A.Pers.433; ta/d' e)k duoi=n e)/rrwgen . . kaka/ S.OT1280; soi\ ta/d' e)/rrwgen kaka/ E.Hipp.1338; e)rrwgo/tes lo/goi
broken, disjointed, Com.Adesp.661. in lit. sense, gh= e)rrhgei=a （= -ui=a)
broken, arable, opp. a)/rrhktos, Tab.Heracl.1.18,al. (vrhg- (cf. Aeol. aor. Pass. eu)ra/gh Hdn.Gr.2.640, vrh=cis, au)/rhktos), cogn. with Lith.
rēžti 'cut, notch, furrow',
rúožas 'stripe, streak, strip'.)

r(h=gos, eos, to/,
rug, blanket, in Hom. mostly in pl. (sg. in Il.9.661, Od.13.73, 118); r(. kala/, porfu/rea, Il.24.644, Od.4.297; sigalo/enta 6.38, 11.189, etc.: used as covering of a bed, Il.9.661, 24.644, Od.3.349, etc.; or of a seat, 10.352; prob. a garment, 6.38: since, in 13.73,118, Hom. distinguishes r(h=gos and li/non, it is prob. that the r(h=gos was of wool. (from r(h=cai, = ba/yai, acc. to Eust.782.20, but elsewhere this verb is written r(e/cai, v. r(e/zw (B).)

r(h/dhn, Adv. only in A.D.Adv.198.15, EM363.42, as part of the compd.diarrh/dhn. r(h/dios, v. r(a/|dios. r(hdi/wn: karou/xwn, r(aidi/wn, Hsch. r(hqh=nai, r(hqh/somai, v. e)rw=. r(hi/+dios, v. r(a/|dios. r(hi/+zw, v. r(ai/+zw. r(h/i+stos, r(hi/+tatos, r(hi/+teros, v. r(a/|dios.

r(h/k-ths, ou, o(, (r(h/gnumi)
breaker, render; of an earthquake
that breaks the earth into fissures, Arist.Mu.396a5, Lyd.Ost.54.

r(hk-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
apt to burst, to\ yuxro\n flebw=n r(hktiko/n Hp.Epid.6.3.6.
causing abscesses
to break, Aët.15.17.

r(hk-to/s, h/, o/n,
that can be broken or
rent, penetrable, [a)nh\r] . ., xalkw=| te r(hkto\s mega/loisi te xermadi/oisin Il.13.323.

r(h=ma, atos, to/, (e)rw=)
that which is said or
spoken, word, saying, Archil.50, Thgn.1152, Simon.37.14,92 (where perh. it = r(h/tra 11.2), Pi. (v. infr.), etc.; in Prose first in Hdt. (s.v.l.), o( no/os tou= r(. 7.162; ta\ lego/mena/ tinwn [r(h/mata] 8.83; tou= *pittakou= . . periefe/reto tou=to to\ r(. Pl.Prt.343b; to\ do/gma te kai\ r(. Id.R.464a; opp. e)/rgmata, Pi.N.4.6; opp. e)/rgon, Th.5.111; opp. to\ a)lhqe/s, Pl.Phd.102b: prov., r(h/mata a)nt' a)lfi/twn 'fine words butter no parsnips', ap.Suid.; r(h/mata ple/kwn Pi.N.4.94; r(h/mata qhreu/ein catch at one's
words, And.1.9; r(. i(ppoba/mona, r(. muria/mforon, Ar.Ra.821, Pax 521; r(h/matos e)xo/menon depending on the
word, Pl.Lg.656c; tw=| r(. tw=| to/de prosxrw/menoi
the word to/de, Id.Ti.49e; tw=| r(. le/gein, ei)pei=n, say
in so many words, Id.R. 340d, Grg.450e, cf. Tht.166d; kata\ r(h=ma a)paggei=lai
word for word, Aeschin.2.122.
phrase, opp. o)/noma (a single word), Pl.Cra.399b, Aeschin.3.72; le/gontes e)n mu/qois te kai\ e)n r(h/masin Pl.Lg.840c.
verse, line, Ar.Ra.1379, cf. 97.
subject of speech, matter, Hebraism in LXX and
NT, Ge.15.1, 22.1, De.2.7, Ev.Luc.1.37,65, 2.15; cf. r(hto/s IV. 2. Gramm.,
verb, opp. o)/noma (noun), Pl. Sph.262a sq., Cra.425a, al., Arist.Po.1457a14, Diog.Bab.Stoic.3.213:— from the fact that a Verb usually forms
the predicate (Arist.Int. 16b6), r(h=ma is applied to an Adj.
when used as a predicate, ib.16a13, 20b1.

r(hm-a^tiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a verb: to\ r(.
a verbal form, D.H.Comp. 22, S.E.M.1.195;
