derived from a verb, A.D.Adv.135.14. Adv. -kw=s Eust.381.22.

r(hm-a/tion, to/, Dim. of r(h=ma,
pet phrase, phrasicle, Ar. Ach.444,447, Nu.943:—also r(hma^ti/skion, to/, Pl.Tht.180a, Them. Or.21.253c.
r(h/m-wn, onos, o(, = r(h/twr, acc. to Plu.2.675a, an old v.l. in Il.23.886, for kai/ r() h(/mones a)/ndres.

r(h/n, h(,
sheep, lamb (not found in nom.), r(h/nessi A.R.4.1497; r(h=na Nic.Th.453. (From vrh/n, old nom. of va/rna, varno/s, etc., v. a)rh/n, and cf. polu/-rrhn:—also r(a=na: a)/rna, Hsch. (perh. Elean); trano/n [i.e. perh. vra=non]: e(camhniai=on pro/baton, Id.)

*(rhneioergh/s, e/s,
made at *(rh/neia, tra/peza Critias 35 D.; e)/mbaqra *(rhniourgh= Poll.7.93.

r(hniko/s, h/, o/n,
of a sheep, Hp.Epid.5.58, etc.
r(h=nic, ikos, h(, = a)rnaki/s, Hp.Mul.1.58 (ap. Gal.19.135), cf. Hsch.

r(hnoforeu/s, e/ws, o(,
clad in sheepskin, of Dionysus, AP9.524.18.

r(hchn-ori/a, h(,
might to break through armed ranks, Od.14.217.

r(hch/n-wr, oros, o(,
breaking armed ranks, in Hom. always epith. of Achilles, Il.7.228, Od.4.5, etc., cf. Hes.Th.1007; of Apollo, AP9.525.18.

r(hci/-[zu^g]os, on,
breaking the thwarts, plaga/ Tim.Pers.10 (prob.).

r(hci-ke/leuqos, on,
opening a path, of Apollo, AP9.525.18.

r(hci/-noos, on,
breaking the wits, of Dionysus, ib.524.18.

r(h=cis, ews, h(, Aeol. vrh=cis Alc.149:—
breaking, bursting, flebi/ou Hp.Aph.4.78; sc. o)ste/ou Id.VC12; pleumo/nwn Phld.Ir.p.28 W. (pl.); e)mpu/rous t' a)kma\s r(h/ceis te, i.e. both the pointed flames and the
broken (the former a good omen, the latter bad), E.Ph.1256; kata\ r(h=cin ne/fous Arist.Mu.394b17, cf. Stoic.1.34; a)e/ros r(., as the effect of a mighty shout, Plu.Flam.10.
breaking forth, tw=n katamhni/wn Hp.Aph.3.28 (pl.); ai(/matos r(. dia\ r(inw=n Id.Prog.7;
discharge, Id.Aph.5.15, Epid.6.6.12.
rent, cleft, Plu.2.935c (pl.); r(h/ceis e)n toi=s tei/xesin Ph.Bel.84.22.

r(hci/-floios, on,
with cracked, split bark, Thphr.HP1.5.2.
r(hci/-frwn, onos, o(, h(, （frh/n） = katabalw\n th\n fre/na, Hsch.

r(hci/-xqwn, onos, o(, h(,
bursting forth from the earth, Orph.H.52.9, PMag.Par.1.2722, al., PMag.Lond.121.692, 123.3, Tab.Defix.Aud.38.11 (Alexandria, iii A.D.); written r(hsi/xqwn in PMag.Leid.V.9.10, Tab.Defix.Aud.23.13 (Cyprus, iii A.D.); r(hci/kqwn Tab.Defix. in Rh.Mus.55.261.

r(h=on, to/, = r(a=,
rhubarb, Gal.12.112.
r(hsi/-arxos [i^], f.l. in Suid. for r(hso/s: a)rxo/s, v. r(hso/s.

r(hsi/-dion, to/, Dim. of r(h=sis,
short speech or
saying, Gal.16.795, Hsch.: also r(hsei/dion, Ath.11.510a, Simp.in Ph.31.3, etc.

r(hsi-kope/w,
to be a phrasemonger, Polystr. p.11 W., Plb.12.251.9, Poll.6.119.

r(hsi-metre/w,
measure one's words, Luc.Lex.9, Pseudol.24.

r(h=sis, ews, Ion. ios, Arc. vrh=sis (IG5(2).343.19, Orchom., iv B.C.), h(, (e)rw=)
saying, speech, mu/qwn kai\ r(h/sios Od.21.291; r(. a)ggelw=n Pi.N. 1.59; kataple/cai th\n r(h=sin end one's
speech, Hdt.8.83; r(. braxei=a S.Fr.64; cunexh/s Th.5.85; makra\n r(. ou) ste/rgei po/lis A.Supp.273; ei)pei=n r(. ou) qrh=non qe/lw Id.Ag.1322; r(. le/gein a)mfi/ tinos Id.Supp.615, cf. S.Fr.142.20; peri\ smikrou= pra/gmatos r(. pammh/keis poiei=n Pl.Phdr. 268c; makra\n r(. a)potei/nein Id.R.605d, Luc.Prom.6; h( a)po\ *skuqw=n r(. the Scythian
answer, Hdt.4.127 (a phrase that became proverbial, cf. Plu.Prov.1.62; prob. interpol. in Hdt.).
resolution, declaration, *lakedaimoni/wn r(. Hdt.1.152, cf. Crates Com.56, IG l.c.
speaking, opp. reading (a)na/gnwsis), D.H.Isoc.2 (Wolf, for xrh/sews).
tale, legend, a)nqrw/pwn palaiai\ r(. Pi.O.7.55.
expression or
passage in an author, esp.
speech in a play, Ar.Nu.1371, V.580, Ra. 151, Men.Epit.585: pl. in Ephipp.16.3, D.18.267; r(. tine\s tw=n *)aristofanei/wn Plu.2.712d; esp. of the dramatic parts of epic poetry, Phot.
manner of speaking, style, h( kata\ pezo\n r(.
prose, Longin. Proll.Heph.1.3.
r(hsixqo/nh, h(, epith. of a Chthonian goddess, Tab.Defix.Aud.22.31, al. (Cyprus, iii A.D.); cf. r(hci/xqwn.
r(hskome/nwn: legome/nwn, Hsch., cf. Phot.
r(hso/s, o(, = a)rxo/s, o(\s ai(re/sei (dub.l.) ta\ qe/sfata, Epich.205.
r(h/ssw, v. r(h/gnumi. v. r(a/ssw. r(h|stw/nh, v. r(a|stw/nh.

vrh/t-a, a(,
treaty, agreement, Inscr.Cypr.135.28 H.(pl.).

vrht-a/omai,
make a treaty or
agreement with, ib.4,14.

r(hte/on,
one must say, mention, ti Pl.Lg.730c, Sph.227d;
one must pronounce, Id.Cra.410c. r(hte/os, a, on,
to be spoken or
mentioned, D.22.62, Hermog.Stat.7.
r(h/|teros, Ion. for r(hi/+teros, v. r(a/|dios. vrhteu/w, v. a)rhteu/w.

r(hth/r, h=ros, o(, （e)rw） = r(h/twr,
speaker, mu/qwn te r(hth=r' e)/menai prhkth=ra/ te e)/rgwn Il.9.443, cf. Hippon.63 (s.v.l.), AP7.579 (Leont.), IG3.625, Milet.1(9).341.

r(htia/rios, o(, = Lat.
retiarius, Artem.2.32, IGRom.3.44 (Nicaea); also r(htia=ris, ib.43 (ibid.), 1438 (Amasia).

r(hti/n-h [i_], h(,
resin of the pine, Hp.Art.63, Arist.HA617a19, Thphr.HP9.2.1, al., Nic.Al.300,554, Dsc.1.71, etc. (Prob. a foreign word.)

r(htin-i/zw,
to be resinous, smell or
taste of resin, Id.3.74.

r(htin-i/ths [i_t], ou, o(,
that tastes of resin, oi)=nos r(. Id.5.34.

r(hti_no/khron, to/,
wax dissolved in resin, Crito ap.Gal.13.879, Orib. Fr.97.

r(hti_n-o/w,
flavour with resin, Dsc.Eup.2.65: pf. part. Pass. e)rrhtinwme/nos,
mixed with resin, khrwth/ Hp.Art.62.

r(hti_n-w/dhs, es,
resinous, Id.Mochl.32, Thphr.HP3.15.3, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.2.57c.

r(htor-ei/a, h(,
oratory, Pl.Plt.304a, Phld.Rh.2.231 S., Plu.2.975c.
piece of oratory, set speech, Isoc.5.26, 12.2, Arist.Rh. 1356b20 (pl.).

r(htor-eute/on,
one must practise oratory, Hermog.Prog. 11.

r(htor-eu/w,
to be a public speaker, practise oratory, Isoc.Ep.8.7, Pl. Grg.502d, Arist.Rh.Al.1444a33; oi( meta\ gaste/ra -eu/ontes afterdinner
speakers, Ph.1.156; r(. kai\ politeu/esqai Chrysipp.Stoic.3.175; opp. politeu/esqai, Nausiph.2:—Pass., of the speech,
to be spoken, tou\s me\n [lo/gous] r(htoreu/esqai, tou\s de\ gegra/fqai Isoc.5.25:—later in Act. c. acc., th\n e)pestalme/nhn presbei/an e)rrhto/reue
was setting forth, Luc.Laps.2.
teach oratory, Str.14.1.48.
r(htor-i/zw, = foreg. 1, Satyr.Vit.Eur.Fr.1.

r(htor-iko/s, h/, o/n,
oratorical, h( r(htorikh/ (sc. te/xnh)
rhetoric, Pl.Phdr.266d, Phld.Rh.1.187 S.; to\ r(. Pl.Phdr.266c, Plt.304e; ta\ r(. D.L.4.49, etc.; r(. deili/an o( dhmo/sios kairo\s ou)k a)name/nei
an orator's timidity, Aeschin.3.163; r(. grafh/ an indictment
against an orator (parano/mwn), Is.Fr.64 S. Adv. -kw=s Pl.Grg.471e, Aeschin. 1.71, Arist.Po.1450b8, Phld.Rh.2.134 S.: Comp., -w/teron le/gesqai D.H.Is.8. of persons,
skilled in speaking, fit to be an orator, Isoc.3.8, Pl.Phdr.260c, 272d, al.; fu/sei r(. ib.269d, etc.; sxolastiko\s r(. OGI693 (Egypt).
student, Lib.Or.14.62.
belonging to a r(h/twr, dou=los Stud.Pal.1.67.289 (i A.D.).
r(htor-i/skos, o(, contemptuous Dim. of r(h/twr, 'spouter', PUniv.Giss.20 ii 14 (ii A.D.); in Lat. form, Gell.17.20.4.

r(htoro-ma/stic, i_gos, o(,
the Rhetoricians' scourge, as Aeschines of Mytilene was called, D.L.2.64.

r(htoro/-muktos, ou, o(, （mu/ssomai） mukth\r r(. a nostril (= nose = sneerer)
blown (i.e. trained)
by rhetoricians, of Socrates, Timo 25.3.

r(htoro-preph/s, e/s,
befitting an orator, dub. in Phld. Rh.1.165 S.

r(ht-o/s, h/, o/n, (e)rw=)
stated, specified, covenanted, misqw=| e)/pi r(. Il.21.445; parei=nai e)s xro/non r(. Hdt.1.77, cf. Aeschin.3.124; e)n h(me/rais r(. Th.6.29; e)pi\ r(htoi=s ge/rasi patrikai\ basilei=ai Id.1.13; r(. a)rgu/rion a
stated sum, Id.2.7, 4.69; e)pi\ r(htoi=si, Att. e)pi\ r(htoi=s, on
stated terms, on
certain conditions, according to
covenant, Hdt.5.57, E.Hipp.459, Th.1.122, And.3.22, al.; pare/sesqai ei)s r(. h(me/ran X.HG3.5.6; r(. a)po/krisis a
distinct, definite answer, Plb.32.6.7: r(hto/n, to/,
fixed date for a lawsuit, PSI4.463.14 (iii B.C.), etc.; so perh. a)po\ r(htw=n IG12 (9).1273 (Euboea, vi B.C.). Adv. -tw=s
expressly, distinctly, Plb.3.23.5, SIG685.77 (ii B.C.), Phld.Rh.1.105 S., 1 Ep.Ti.4.1, Gal.17(2).427: Sup. r(hto/tata S.E.M.7.16.
spoken of, famous, r(htoi/ t' a)/rrhtoi/ te Hes.Op.4. of language,
in common use (= sunh/qhs), A.D.Pron.
113.18; fra/sis Id.Synt.39.15. Adv. -tw=s Phld.Rh.1.161 S.
that may be spoken or
told, ei) r(hto/n, fra/son A.Pr.765; h)= r(hto/n; h)\ ou)xi\ qemito\n a)/llon ei)de/nai; S.OT993; au)dw=n a)no/si' ou)de\ r(hta/ moi ib. 1289; r(. a)/rrhto/n t' e)/pos Id.OC1001; deino\n ga/r, ou)de\ r(. Id.Ph.756; cf. a)/rrhtos 111.3.
that can be spoken or
enunciated, sullabh/ Pl.Tht.202b, cf. 205d, 205e; dia/lektoi Phld.Rh.1.110S.; ou) r(. kat' i)di/an ai( e)gklitikai/ A.D.Pron.36.30;
communicable in words, Pl.Ep. 341c. Math.,
rational, of magnitudes, opp. surds (a)/loga）, r(hta\ pro\s a)/llhla Id.R.546c, Hp.Ma.303b, cf. Euc.10 Deff.3 and 4, Hero
*Deff.128; in Metric, r(. pou/s, opp. a)/logos, Aristid.Quint.1.14; v. a)/rrhtos IV. to\ r(.
the precise, literal contents of a document,
the letter of the law, S.E.M.2.36, etc.; r(hto/s
literal, opp. allegorical, Ph.1.69, al. = r(h=ma 1.3, even of
a living thing, Hebr.
dâvâr, LXX Ex.9.4.

r(ht-o/ths, htos, h(,
rationality, of numbers, Iamb. in Nic. p.91 P.

r(h/tr-a, h(, Ion. r(h/trh, Elean vra/tra, v. infr.: (e)rw=):—
verbal agreement, bargain, covenant, a)ll' a)/ge nu=n r(h/trhn poihso/meq' Od.14.393; para\ th\n r(. X.An.6.6.28; r(. pro\s au)to\n kai\ o(mologi/a gi/netai Ael.VH2.7, cf. 10.18; poiou=ntai r(h/tras e)pi\ xrusi/w| pampo/llw| they lay
wagers, Id.NA15.24. in the Doric and Elean dialects,
compact, treaty, a( vra/tra toi=r valei/ois kai\ toi=s *(ervaoi/ois (i.e. h( r(h/tra toi=s *)hlei/ois kai\ toi=s *(hraieu=si) SIG9 (Elis, vi B.C.). of
the laws of Lycurgus, which assumed the character of
a compact between the Law-giver and the People, Plu.Lyc.6, cf. 13; later,
decree, ordinance, of the Spartan kings, as of Agis, Id.Agis 8; eu)qei/ais r(. a)ntapameibome/nous (perh. in reference to the skolia/ (sc. r(h/tra) mentioned in the addition made to the original r(h/tra, Plu.Lyc.6), Tyrt.2.8. at Byzantium,= probou/leuma, e)k ta=s bwla=s labw\n r(h/tran Decr.Byz. ap.D.18.90 (unless,
leave to speak, cf. infr. 111). generally,
law, X.Cyr.1.6.33;
ordinance of a festival, IG5(1).1498.12 (Messenia).
speech, r(. paralabei=n take up
the word, Luc.
Pro Merc. Cond.2; paradido/nai Id.Tox.35: pl.,
speeches, Lyc.470,1037, Nic. Al.132.

r(htr-eu/w,
pronounce, declare, di/kas Lyc.1400.

r(htrofu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
keeper of archives, Phot., Suid., EM703.46.
r(h/ttw, v. r(h/gnumi.

r(h/twr, oros, o(, also h( Ar.Fr.945 (cf. Th.292): (e)rw=):—
public speaker, mu/qwn r(h/tores E.Hec.124 (anap.), cf. Fr.597.4, Isoc.8.129, Arist. Top.149b25, Phld.Rh.2.272S., Plu.2.131a, etc.; esp. at Athens, oi( r(h/tores the
public speakers in the e)kklhsi/a, Ar.Ach.38,680, Eq.60, 358, al., Th.8.1, And.3.1, Lys.30.22, etc.; sg. prob. in IG12.45.21; oi( de/ka r(. the Ten Attic Orators, Luc.Am.29; o( r(. 'par excellence' = Demosthenes, Hermog.Inv.4.1, al.
one who gives sentence, judge, S.Fr.1090.
advocate, POxy.37.4 (i A.D.), etc. later,
teacher of eloquence, rhetorician, OGI712 (Egypt), etc. as Adj., r(. lo/gos
oratory, IG2.1386.7.

r(hxia/dhs or r(hxa/dhs, ou, o(,
one who threw convicts into the sea, Hsch., Suid. r(hxi/h, r(hxo/s, Ion. for r(axi/a, r(axo/s.
r(hxmo/s, o(,= r(hgmo/s, Mnemos.42.332 (Argos).

r(hxw/dhs, es,
thorny, rough, Nic.Al.230.
r(i/aina: phgh/, liba/s, Hsch. r(i/ga: siw/pa, Id.(fort. Cypr.i(/ga, i.e. si/ga).

r(i_g-a^le/os, a, on, (r(i=gos)
cold, chilling, o)/mbros Emp.21.5.

r(i_g-eda^no/s, h/, o/n,
making one shudder, r(igedanh\ *(ele/nh
at whose name one shudders, horrible, Il.19.325; so r(. gh=rus A.R.4.1343, cf. Opp.H.5.37; moi=ran r(igedanou= bio/tou IG12(3).869.10 (Thera).
shivery, cold, r(. phguli/s AP9.384.24. Adv. -nw=s Tryph.558.
r(i_g-ei/w,= r(ige/w, EM 620.46.

r(i_g-esi/bi^os [si^], on,
living in the cold, Poll.4.186, Phryn.PS p.106 B.

r(i_g-e/w, Pi.N.5.50: fut. -h/sw Il.5.351: aor. e)rri/ghsa, Ep. r(i/ghsa (also in S.OC1607), Il.5.596: pf. (with pres. sense) e)/rri_ga 17.175 (prob. f.l. in Thphr.Ign.74); Dor. 3pl. e)rri/ganti Theoc.16.77; Ep. subj. e)rri/gh|si Il.3.353; Ep. dat. part. e)rri/gonti (for e)rrigo/ti) Hes.Sc.228: plpf. 3sg. e)rri/gei Od.23.216:—
shudder or
bristle with fear or horror, i)dw\n r(i/ghse Il.5.596, etc.; e)rri/ghsan o(/pws i)/don 12.208; once in Trag., ai( de\ parqe/noi r(i/ghsan (the augm. being omitted although in an iambic verse) S.l.c.: c. inf.,
shudder to do, shrink from doing, o)/fra tis e)rri/gh|si . . ceinodo/kon kaka\ r(e/cai Il.3.353, cf. 7.114; cf. a)porrige/w: folld. by a clause, qumo\s e)rri/gei mh\ . . Od.23.216.
cool or
slacken in zeal, Pi.N.5.50.
bristle with arms, *foi/nikes . . e)rri/ganti Theoc. l.c. trans.,
shudder at anything, r(igh/sein po/lemon Il.5.351; e)/rriga ma/xhn 17.175 (in 16.119 r(i/ghse/n te is best taken parenthetically). (Cf. Lat.
frīgeo, from
srīg-.）

r(i_g-hlo/s, h/, o/n,
making to shudder, terrible, o)i+stoi/ Hes.Sc.131; u(lagmo/s Nic.Al.220; o)/neidos AP7.351 (Diosc.); a)gw/n Nonn.D.37.149; r(. nau/tais e)ri/fwn du/sis AP7.640 (Antip.). of persons,
susceptible to cold, Anon. ap. Suid. Adv. -lw=s Poll.5.111.

r(i_/g-ion, Comp. neut. Adj. formed from r(ige/w,
more horrible or
miserable, to/ oi( kai\ r(. e)/stai Il.1.325, cf. 563, 11.405; to\ de\ r( . . . a)/lgea pa/sxein Od.20.220; [gunaiko\s] kakh=s ou) r(. a)/llo Hes.Op.703; cf. Semon.6.
colder, poti\ e(/spera r(. e)/stai Od. 17.191.—The masc. r(igi/wn is not found.

r(i_/g-istos, h, on, Sup. Adj. formed from r(ige/w,
most horrible, r(i/gista qeoi\ tetlho/tes ei)me/n Il.5.873; [*zeu\s] r(i/gistos a)litroi=s A.R.2.215, cf. 292; o(\ dh\ r(i/giston o)/dwden Nic.Th.64.
r(igi/tanon, to/, name of a plant, Gp.12.1.2.
r(igno/omai,= r(ikno/omai, Phot. r(igno/s, h/, o/n,= r(ikno/s, Hsch.

r(i_go/-lu^ton, to/,
hot bath administerea' to an epileptic patient, cj. in Cael.Aur.TP1.93 (
pygolithon codd.).

r(i_go-ma/xhs, or r(i_/go-xos [a^], ou, o(,
fighting with cold, AP11.155 (Lucill.).

r(i_go-pu/retos [u^], o(,
fever with shivering fits, ague, Gal.19.560,567, Ptol.Tetr.115, Vett.Val.210.5; also r(i_go-pu/reton, to/, Phryn.PSp.73B.; Dim. r(i_go-ti/on, to/, Hsch. s.v. h)pio/lion.

r(i=g-os, eos, to/,
frost, cold, Od.5.472, Hdt.6.44, etc.; u(po\ limou= kai\ r(i/gous Pl.Euthphr.4d; limw=| kai\ r(i/gei maxo/menos X.Cyr.6.1.15: pl., r(i/gh kai\ qa/lph Id.Oec.7.23.
shivering, Pl.Ti.62b;
shivering fit, as in ague, Hp.VM16, Aph.4.29, BGU956.2 (iii A.D.); r(. puretw/dh Hp.Fract.34.

r(ig-o/w, fut. -w/sw X.Mem.2.1.17, Ep. inf. -wse/men Od. 14.481: aor. e)rri/gwsa Hp.Epid.3.1.s/, （e)n-) Ar.Pl.846: pf. e)rrigwko/tes Thphr.Ign.74 (vv. ll. e)rrigo/tes, e)rrignwko/tes), Gal.11.556.—Like i(dro/w, has an irreg. contr. into w, w|, for ou, oi, 3sg. subj. r(igw=| Pl.Grg. 517d, cj. in Phd.85a; opt. r(igw/|h Hp.Int.10, Plu.2.233a; inf. r(igw=n Ar.Ach.1146, V.446, Av.935, Pl.R.440c, X.Cyr.5.1.11; part. fem. r(igw=sa Semon.7.26, but acc. masc. r(igou=nta Phld.Vit.p.22J.:—
to be cold, shiver, Od.14.481, Hdt.5.92.h/, Hp.VM16, etc.; though several forms may belong either to this word or to r(ige/w, as r(igw=n te kai\ peinw=n Ar.Ach.857, cf.Nu.416, Crates Com.33, Pl.Grg.517d.

r(ig-w/dhs, es,
provocative of shivering, Hp.Coac.609, Gal.19.146.

r(i/g-wsis, ews, h(,
shivering, prob. cj. for r(a/sin in Thphr.Vent.23.

r(i/z-a, hs, h(: Ion. nom. r(i/zh Hp. ap. Erot., acc. r(i/zhn Marc.Sid.89 (before a vowel), but r(i/zan Il.11.846 (whence Ion. nom. r(i/za may be inferred):—
root, Od.10.304, 23.196, etc.; used as a medicine, Il.11.846; r(. e)lath/rios, of a purgative medicine, Hp.Epid.5.34: mostly in pl.,
roots, Il.12.134, Od.12.435, etc.; de/ndrea makra\ au)th=|sin r(i/zhsi Il.9.542: hence metaph.,
roots of the eye, Od.9.390 (but r(i/zas e)n o)/ssois ai(matw=pas in E.HF933 prob. bloodshot
streaks); the
roots or
foundations of the earth, Hes.Op.19; xqo/na . . au)tai=s r(. pneu=ma kradai/noi A.Pr.1047 (anap.); i)pou/menos r(i/zaisin *ai)tnai/ais u(/po ib.367; of feathers, hair, etc., Pl.Phdr.251b, Arist.HA518b14; of the teeth, Id.GA789a13; gastro\s r(. o)mfalo/s Id.HA493a18, etc. to\n po/lemon e)k r(izw=n a)nh/|rhke 'root and branch', Plu.Pomp.21, cf. Heraclid. Pont. ap. Ath.12.523f; e)k r(izw=n a)pw/lesen LXX Jb.31.12; cf. r(izo/qen, pro/rrizos.
that from which anything springs as from a root, r(i/zan a)pei/rou tri/tan a third continental
foundation, of Libya, Pi.P.9.8; a)ste/wn r(., of Cyrene, as the
root or
original of the Cyrenaic Pentapolis, ib.4.15;
root or
stock from which a family springs, r(. spe/rmatos Id.O.2.46, cf. I.8(7).61, A.Ag.966, S.Aj.1178, etc.; so,
race, family, A.Th.755 (lyr.), E.IT610, OGI383.31 (Nemrud Dagh, i B.C.), etc.; sukofa/ntou . . spe/rma kai\ r(. D.25.48;
sect, party, Jul. Gal.106e; also r(. kakw=n E.Fr.912.11 (anap.); a)rxh\ kai\ r(. panto\s a)gaqou= Epicur.Fr.409, cf. 1 Ep.Ti.6.10; phgh\ kai\ r(. kaloka)gaqi/as Plu. 2.4c; a)rxai\ kai\ r(. gh=s kai\ qala/tths Arist.Mete.353b1, etc.; cf. r(i/zwma 11.
base, foundation, r(. pa/ntwn kai\ ba/sis a( ga= e)rh/reistai Ti. Locr.97e, cf. Pl.Ti.81c;
base of a vertical pillar, Procl.Hyp.3.23; tw=n lo/fwn Onos.10.6. Math.,
root or
base of a series, Anatolius ap.Theol.Ar.9. (Aeol. bri/za (q.v.): cf. Goth.
waúrts, Lat.
radix.）

r(iz-a/gra, h(,
instrument for extracting the roots of a tooth, Cels.7.12.1, Paul.Aeg.6.88.

r(iz-ai=os, a, on,
forming a base (cf. r(i/za 11.2), r(. li/qos, of a column, opp. spei=ra, Sardis 7(1) No.181 (prob. i A.D.).
r(iz-ei=on, to/,= r(i/zion, Nic.Al.265: a pl. form r(i/zea ib.69, 145,588, Th.646, 940 (r(izi/a is a freq. v.l.).

r(iz-hdo/n, Adv.
like roots, Hld.1.29.

r(i/z-hqen, Adv.
from the roots, A.R.3.1401.

r(iz-i/as, ou, o(,
made from the root of a plant, o)po\s r(., opp. kauli/as, Thphr.HP6.3.2, 9.1.7, cf. Plin.HN19.43.

r(iz-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the root, lo/gos Plu.in Hes.84.

r(i/z-inos, h, on,
made from a root (viz. of e)reuqe/danon）, porfu/ra PHolm.26.29.

r(i/z-ion or r(izi/on, to/, Dim. of r(i/za,
little root, Ar.Av.654, Antiph.45, Thphr.CP2.18.2, HP4.2.3, etc.; porfu/ra r(izi/ou
vegetable purple (cf. r(i/zinos), POxy.1051.13 (iii A.D.).
r(iz-i/s, i/dos, h(, poet. for r(i/za in Nic.Al.403,531 (v.l. r(iza/s).
r(i/zis, o(, an Ethiopian animal of the elephant kind, Str.17.3.5.

r(izo-bole/w,
strike root, Dsc.3.38, AP11.246 (Lucill.), S.E.M.5.57.

r(izo-bo/los, on,
striking root, Nic.Th.69.

r(i/zo-qen, Adv. = r(i/zhqen,
by, from the roots, Id.Al.257, Th.307, Luc.Tyr.13, Q.S.6.381; w(=| to\ di/kaion sth/rikto e)g gnw/mh| r(. e)k fu/sews Supp.Epigr.2.482 (Kertch):—also r(i/zo-qi, Nic.Fr.27.

r(izo-ke/fa^los, on, of plants,
of which the flower grows straight from the root, Thphr.CP1.10.5.

r(izo-loge/w,
root out, tura/nnous D.S.16.82 (s.v.l.).

r(izo-pa^gh/s, e/s, (ph/gnumi)
firmly rooted, Nonn. D.2.247.

r(izo-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
dealer in roots, Poll.7.196 ( = Critias 70 D.).

r(izo/-shmos, on,
with a stripc of vegetable purple (cf. r(i/zion), POxy.1051.3 (iii A.D.).

r(izotom-e/w,
cut or
prune the roots of a tree by digging round it, sukh= r(izotomhqei=sa Thphr.CP1.17.10, etc.
cut up by the roots, extirpate, D.S.32.4: esp. for Medic. purposes, r(. bota/nas
cut and gather their
roots, Hp.Ep.16, cf. Thphr.HP4.5.1;
gather roots for food, Str.16.4.9: metaph., Philostr.VA7.26.

r(izotom-i/a, h(,
cutting and gathering of roots, Thphr.HP6.3.2, 9.8.2: pl., books
on roots, herbals, Ruf. ap. Orib.7.26.31.

r(izotom-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the cutting and gathering of roots: r(izotomiko/n, to/, botanical work of Amerias, Ath. 15.681f.

r(izo/tom-os (parox.), o(,
one who cuts or
gathers roots, esp. for purposes of medicine or witchcraft,
herbalist, Hp.Ep.16, Thphr.HP 9.1.7, 9.8.1, Dsc. Prooem., Luc.DDeor.13.1, Phot., etc.; *(rizoto/moi, ai(, title of play by Sophocles, Macr.Sat.5.19.9, etc. as Adj., r(. w(/ra the time
for cutting roots, Nic.Th.494. h( r(., name of a kind of
iris, Plin.HN21.41.

r(izotrofe/w,
grow, nourish roots, Poll.1.235; v.l. for o)ruzotrofe/w in Str.17.3.23 in Cod. in
sitzb.Heidelb.Akad.1931/2.23.

r(izouxi/a, h(,
root, origin of a family, Tz.H.4.330 (pl.).

r(izou=xos, on, (e)/xw)
upholding the roots or
foundation, epith. of Poseidon, Call.Fr.285: generally,
upholding, qemei/lia r(. Opp.H.5.680.

r(izofa^g-e/w,
eat roots, Str.3.2.6, 11.8.7.

r(izo/fa^g-os (parox.), on,
eating roots, Arist.HA595a16, PA662b14; oi( *(r.
Root-eaters, name of an Ethiopian tribe in D.S.3.23, Str.16.4.9.

r(izo-foi/thtos, on,
coming from a root, fle/bes foi/nikos Chaerem. 39.

r(izo-fo/ros, on,
bearing roots, EM515.10.

r(izo-fu^e/w,
put out roots, Thphr.CP1.2.1.

r(izo-fu^h/s, e/s,
putting out roots, ib.1.8.1.
growing from a root, Id.HP7.10.1.

r(izo-fu^i/+a, h(,
putting out of roots, Sch.Hes.Th.304.

r(izo/-fullos, on,
with leaves from the root, Thphr. HP6.4.9, 7.11.3.

r(izo/-fu^tos, on,
growing from a root, Ocell. 1.13.

r(iz-o/w,
cause to strike root: metaph.,
plant, fix firmly, o(/s min [th\n nau=n] la=an qh=ke kai\ e)rri/zwsen e)/nerqen Od.13.163; [nh/sous] kata\ busso\n prumno/qen (s. v.l.) Call.Del.35:—Pass., of trees and plants,
take root, strike root, X.Oec.19.9, Thphr.CP1.2.1:—Med., a)/riston r(izw/sasqai, of the fig, Id.HP2.5.6; so ai( pi/nnai e)rri/zwntai, opp. a)rri/zwtoi, Arist. HA548a5; r(. e)pi/ tinos AP6.66 (Paul.Sil.); o)do\s ba/qroisi gh=qen e)rrizwme/nos
made fast or
solid, S.OC1591; of a bridge, ai)w/nios e)rri/zwtai Epigr.Gr.1078.7 (Adana). metaph., e)rri/zwse th\n turanni/da Hdt.1.64:—Pass., turanni\s e)rrizwme/nh ib.60, cf. Pl.Lg.839a; e)c a)maqi/as pa/nta kaka\ e)rr.
have their root in . . , Id.Ep.336b, cf. S E. Med.1.271; e)n a)ga/ph| e)rr. Ep.Eph.3.18. Pass. also of land,
to be planted with trees, a)lwh\ e)rri/zwtai Od.7.122.

r(iz-w/dhs, es,
like a root, Thphr.HP7.2.1, Hero Metr.2.20.

r(i/z-wma, atos, to/,
the mass of roots of a tree, Thphr.CP3.3.4.
element, te/ssara me\n pa/ntwn r(izw/mata prw=ton a)/koue Emp.6.1; a)ena/ou fu/sews r(. Pythag.15.
stem, race, A.Th.413; qei/wn d' a)p' a)mfoi=n e)/kgonon r(izwma/twn, i.e. on the side of both parents, Theodect.3.

r(iz-wnu^xi/a, h(,
root of the nail, Poll.2.145 (pl.), cf. Paul.Aeg.6.85:—in Ruf.Onom.85, r(iz-nu/xia, ta/; but -i/ai Id. ap. Orib.25.1.32.

r(iz-wru^xe/w,
dig up roots, Plu.2.473a.

r(iz-wru/xos [u^], on,
root-grubbing, of grammarians, AP11.322 (Antiphan.).
r(ika/zetai, v. r(icika/zetai.
r(ikn-h/eis, essa, en, poet. for r(ikno/s, Nic.Th.137.

r(ikn-o/omai, Pass.,
grow stiff or
be shrivelled by frost, heat, or old age, Arist.HA553a13, Opp.H.5.593, Sor.1.15.
dance with unseemly contortions, S.Fr.316, cf. Luc.Lex.8. later Act.,
have sexual intercourse, pro\s a)/ndra, pro\s gunai=ka, PMag.Leid.W.6.28.

r(ikn-o/s, h/, o/n,
shrivelled with cold,= pefrikw/s, S.Fr.1091;
shrivelled by old age or disease,
shrunk, contracted, Hp.Prog.2 (s. v.l.), Xenarch.4.8, Cerc.2, Call.Fr. 49, etc.: generally,
withered, shrivelled, crooked, *(/hfaistos r(ikno\s po/das h.Ap.317; a(/yea Opp.C.2.346; r(iknoi\ po/des A.R.1.669, cf.APl. 4.306 (Leon.); r(. kai\ kw/dion
shrivelled and (like) leather, IG14.1363.15 (Rome, iv A.D.).

r(ikn-o/ths, htos, h(,
shrivelledness, Hsch. s.v. dierriknou=nto.

r(iknofu^h/s, e/s,
shrivelled or
crooked-shaped, Hsch.

r(ikn-w/dhs, es,
shrivelled-looking, of gooseflesh, Hp.Epid.6.3.14; of a person, gh/rai+ r(. AP5.272 (Agath.).

r(i/kn-wsis, ews, h(,
shrivelling of the skin, Hp.Epid.6.3.16.
r(i/mbai: r(oiai\ mega/lai. a)/meinon de\ dia\ tou= c ci/mbai, Hsch. (cf. ci/mbrai). r(i/mbhsis: a)gku/lh tou= w)/mou, oi( de\ to\n braxi/ona tou= i(erei/ou, Id.

r(i=mma, atos, to/, (r(i/ptw)
throw, cast, podw=n r(i/mmata Arion 6; = h( r(i=yis kai\ to\ be/los, Hdn.Epim.118.

r(i/mf-a^, Adv.
lightly, swiftly, r(i/mfa e( gou=na fe/rei Il.6.511, cf. Hes. Sc.342; toi\ de\ pe/tonto r(. ma/l' Il.13.30; r(. ma/la trwxw=si 22.163; dei=pnon e(/lonto . . r(. 8.54; r(. toceu/ein u(/mnous Pi.I.2.3; be/baken r(. A.Ag. 407 (lyr.), cf. A.R.1.387, 1194.

r(imf-a^le/os, a, on,
light, swift, EM135.24, 262.7.

r(imf-a/rma^tos, on,
of a swift chariot, difrhlasi/a Pi.O.3.37; r(. a(mi/llais with the
swift racing
of chariots, S.OC1063 (lyr.).
r(i/n, v. r(i/s. r(i=na, h(, Hellenistic for r(i/nh 1, Moer.p.338P.

r(i_na/rion, to/,
small file, Aët.8.82. a sort of
eye-salve, Id.7.115, Paul.Aeg.3.22, 7.16.

r(i_n-aule/w, (r(i/s)
blow through the nose, snort, from anger, cj. for r(inauste/w in Luc.Lex.19 (cf. Sch.).

r(i_n-a/w (A),
lead by the nose, Pherecr.23, Men.895:—Pass., e)rrinw/meqa
we were chaffed, Alciphr. Fr.6.2 (unless metaph. use of sq.).

r(i_n-a/w (B), (r(i/nh)
file, fine down, Arist.Aud.802a38, 803a2, Ph.Bel.70.15, Ael.NA6.3; yh=gma r(inhqe/n
filings, AP9.310 (Antiphil.): metaph. of literary work, D.H. Th.24.
r(ine/ai: ai( me/lainai i)sxa/des, Hsch.

r(i_n-egka^ta^phci^-ge/neios, on, (r(i/s, e)gkataph/gnumi)
with a nose reaching to the chin, with a nutcracker nose and chin, Epigr. ap. Hegesand. 1.
r(i_n-egxusi/a, v.l. for r(ino\s e)/gxusin, Dsc.2.181.

r(i_n-egxu^te/w or r(i_n-o/w,
inject at the nose, ib.179, in Pass.

r(i_n-egxu/ths [u^], ou, o(,
instrument for passing such iniections, Cael.Aur.TP 2.4, Aët.6.52.

r(i_n-e/gxu^ton, to/,
injection for the nose, Gal.12.582.

r(i_n-e/gxu^tos, on,
injected at the nose, Crateuas Fr.8.
r(i_n-e/w,= r(ina/w (B), Sch.Ar.Ra.931.

r(i_/n-h, h(,
file, rasp, X.Cyr.6.2.33, Arist.Aud.803a2, Aen.Tact.18.5, IG11(2).173.11 (Delos, iii B.C.), etc.; xaraktai\ r(i=nai AP6.205 (Leon.).
shark with a rough skin, used (like shagreen) for polishing wood and marble,
Rhina squatina, angel fish, Hp.Int.1, Epich.59, Archipp.25, Anaxandr.41.53, Arist.HA540b11, al. (r(inh/ 1, r(i/nh 11 acc. to Hdn.Gr.1.333.)

r(i_nhl-a^si/a, h(, (e)lau/nw)
tracking by the nose, hunting by scent, Anon. Lond.33.16, Longus 1.21.

r(i_nhl-a^te/w,
track by scent, i)/xnos kakw=n r(. A.Ag.1185, cf. S.Ichn.88, Ph.1.628, Longus 2.13.

r(i_nhl-a/ths [a^], ou, o(,
one who tracks by scent, ku/wn r(. Poll.2.74.

r(i_nh/l-a^tos, on,
tracked by the scent, i)/xnos Opp.H.2.290.

r(i/n-hma [i_], atos, to/, （r(ine/w)
that which is filed off, filings, in sg. and pl., xalkou= Hp.Mul.1.78, Herod.7.81; a)rgu/rou S.E.P.1.129; e)le/fantos tou= o)do/ntos Aret.CD2.13; pristoi=si lo/gxhs . . r(inh/masin E.Fr. 724. an eyesalve, Gal.12.778.

r(i/n-hsis, ews, h(,
filing, of teeth, ib.872; of bones, Id.14.782.
r(in-hth/rion, to/,= r(i/nh 1, Gloss.

r(in-hth/s, ou=, o(,
one who files, ib.

r(in-i/zw,
file, POxy.1066.19 (iii A.D.), Gloss.:— Pass., Aët.8.32.

r(in-i/on, to/, Dim. of r(i/nh 1,
small file, Gal.12.871, Hdn.Epim.119. = r(ina/rion 2, Cels.6.6.30, Gal.12.736. Dim. of r(i/s, in pl. r(ini/a,
nostrils, Arist.Phgn.808a34.
r(i/n-isma, atos, to/,= r(i/nhma 1, Ctes.Fr.57.25 (p.101 Dind.), Antyll. ap. Orib.10.19.7, Ruf.Fr.75.

r(i_no/-ba^tos, o(,
a rough-skinned fish, between the species r(i/nh (signf. 11) and ba/tos (B), perh.
Rhinobatus Columnae, Arist.HA566a28; also r(i_no-ba/ths, ou, o(, Id.GA746b6.

r(i_no-bo/los, on,
striking the nose, of smells, Hsch. proparox. r(i_no/bolos, Pass.,
emitted through the nose, of a snorting sound, AP9.769 (Agath.).

r(i_node/yhs, ou, o(, (r(ino/s)
leather-dresser, Hsch.

r(i_no/kerws, wtos, o(, (r(i/s)
the Rhinoceros or
Nose-horn, Callix.2, Str. 16.4.15, Ael.NA17.44, IG14.1302 (Praeneste); r(. li/qos, of its horn, Cyran.36.
wild bull, Aq.Jb.39.9, Ps.28(29).9. = poio\s o)/rnis e)n *ai)qiopi/a|, Hsch. (perh.
hornbill).

r(i_noko/llhtos, on,
made of glued hides, S.Ichn.366 (lyr.).

r(i_no-kolou=ros, on, (kolou/w) =
mutilatis naribus, Erasistr. ap. Gal. 19.142.

r(i_no-kolou/sths, ou, o(,
nose-clipper, of Heracles, Paus.9.25.4.

r(i_no-kope/w,
cut off the nose, r(. tina/ Suid.

r(i_no-la^bi/s, i/dos, h(,
instrument for taking hold of the nose, Id.

r(i_no/n, to/,= r(ino/s 11.1,
hide, Il.10.155, AP9.328 (Damostr.). = r(ino/s 11.2,
shield, Od.5.281, v. Sch.

r(i_nopu/lh [u^], h(,
side-gate, wicket, Plb.8.25.8, 8.29.5, 15.31.10.

r(i_no/s (v. sub fin.),
skin of a living person, Il.5.308, Od.5.426,435, etc.; rarely of a corpse, Od.14.134, Hes.Sc.152.
hide of a beast, esp.
ox-hide, Od.1.108, al.; also r(. polioi=o lu/koio Il.10.334; r(. le/ontos Pi.I.5(6).37; not in Hom. of the skin of a live beast, but so used by Hes.Op.515, Sc.427; pwlikh=s r(inou= E.Rh.784.
oxhide shield, su/n r(' e)/balon r(inou/s Il.4.447 (imitated by Ar.Pax 1274); cf. Il.16.636 and r(ino/n 2. pl.,
thongs of boxing-gloves, A.R.2.58.
leather of a sling, AP7.172 (Antip. Sid.).—The gender is fem. in Il.7.248, 20.276, Od.22.278 (v.l.), Hes.Sc.152, E.l.c., Nic. Th.361, A.R.4.174; masc. in Nic.Al.476, Opp.C.3.277: cf. r(ino/n, to/. （vri_no/s, as shown by gri=nos: de/rma, Hsch., gri/nths: burseu/s, Id.: cf. talau/rinos.)

r(i_no/-si_mos, on, (r(i/s)
snub-nosed, Luc.Bacch.2.
r(i_no-spa/qion [a^], to/, a surgical instrument, Hermes 38.283.
r(i_no-tome/w,= r(inokope/w, Eust.1839.16.

r(i_no-to/mos, on, (r(ino/s)
piercing shields or
hides, dub.l. for -to/ros in Nonn.D.21.87.

r(i_no-tori/nion, to/, dub. in Hermes 38.283 as name of surgical instrument (cod. Laur. r(inh to r(inion; cod. Par.
rinotorine).

r(i_no-to/ros, on, (r(ino/s)
hide-piercing, shield-piercing, of Ares, Il.21.392, Hes.Th.934; qu/rsos Nonn.D.45.288, etc.

r(i_noulke/w, (r(i/s)
inhale, Thessalus in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(3).138.

r(i_nou=xos, o(, (r(i/s 11)
sewer, Str.14.1.21, Gloss.
r(ino/xoos: xw/nh, Hsch.

r(i_n-w/leqros, on, (r(i/s 1)
nose-plaguing, o)smh/ Com.Adesp.899.
r(i_n-wthri/a, h(,= e)folki/s (q.v.), Poll.1.86.
r(icika/zetai: r(ika/zetai, strobei=tai, Hsch.

r(i/on [i^], to/,
any jutting part of a mountain, whether upwards or forwards; hence,
peak, peri\ r(i/on *ou)lu/mpoio Il.8.25, cf. 14.154, 225, etc.; r(. o)re/wn Od.9.191; r(. ou)/reos h.Ap.139.
headland, Od.3.295; hence as pr. name of several places, esp. *(r. *molukriko/n and *(r. *)axai+ko/n at the mouth of the gulf of Corinth, Th.2.86 (cf. 84). later,
bay formed by a foreland, Ael.NA15.3. (Perh. akin to r(i/s, cf.
Ness, Naze with
nose.）

*(ri)pai, ai(, name of a fabulous range of mountains in the far North, Alcm.58 (leg. *(ripa=n), Arist.Mete.350b7 (for S.OC1248, v. r(iph/ 1): hence *(ripai=os, a, on, Rhipaean, o)/rh Hellanic.Fr.187(b) J., Damastes Fr.1 J., Str.7.3.1,6.

r(i_pa/rios, o(,= Lat.
riparius, police official in Egypt, Wilcken Chr. 469.2 (iv A.D., pl.), POxy.2110.23 (iv A.D.), 904.3 (v A.D.), etc.

r(i_p-h/, h(, (r(i/ptw) poet. Noun,
swing or
force with which anything is thrown, o(/ssh d' ai)gane/hs r(iph\ . . te/tuktai as far as is the
flight of a javelin, Il.16.589; la=os u(po\ r(iph=s 12.462, Od.8.192; pe/trinai r(. E. Hel.1123 (lyr.); bele/wn r(. Pi.N.1.68; u(po\ r(iph=s . . *bore/ao
the sweep or
rush of the N. wind, Il.15.171, 19.358, cf. B.5.46; kuma/twn r(ipai\ a)ne/mwn te Pi.P.4.195, cf. Parth.2.20, Fr.88.2; r(. a)ne/mwn Id.P.9.48, S.Ant.137 (lyr., here metaph. of
gusts of passion, cf. 930); r(. *dio/qen teu/xousa fo/bon
storm, A.Pr.1089 (anap.), cf. A.R.1.1016; r(. puro/s
rush of fire, Il.21.12; a)ndro/s 8.355; a)qana/twn Hes.Th.681, 849; keraunw=n, xala/zhs, Opp.H.3.21, Q.S.14.77; u(po\ r(iph=|s *)afrodi/ths, of love, Opp.H.4.141; nuxia=n （e)nnuxia=n Lachm.) a)po\ r(ipa=n from the night
storms, i.e. from the North, the land of darkness and storms, S.OC1248 (lyr., but Sch. understands *(ripa=n, v. *(ri=pai). pteru/gwn r(ipai/
flapping of wings, A.Pr.126 (anap.), cf. E.Fr.594.4;
buzz of a gnat's wing, A.Ag.893; of the lyre's
quivering notes, Pi.P.1.10.
quivering, twinkling light, r(ipai\ a)/strwn S.El.106 (anap.). of any
rapid movement, r(. podw=n E.IT885 (lyr.); r(. w)kua/lw|, of a dolphin, Opp.H.2.535; of a bird's wing, ou)de\ tina/ssei r(iph/n A.R.2.935; e)n r(. o)fqalmou= the
twinkling of an eye, 1 Ep.Cor.
15.52.
a strong smell, r(. oi)/nou Pi.Fr.166.
r(i_/p-hma, atos, to/, = foreg., Hsch. s.v. e)n a)to/mw|.

r(i_p-i/dion, to/, Dim. of r(ipi/s,
small bellows, Hdn.Epim.118.

r(i_p-i/zw, (r(ipi/s)
blow up or
fan the flame, pole/mou e)/rin Cypr.Fr.1; sta/sin a)negei/rei kai\ r(ipi/zei Ar.Ra.360; r(. pu=r Plu.Flam.21; flo/ga AP5.121 (Diod.):—Pass., tema/xh r(ipi/zetai the fish
is fanned to boiling-point, Ar.Ec.842.
fan a person, in Med.,
fan oneself, Hp.VM16:—Pass., r(ipi/zesqai u(po\ tw=n peristerw=n Antiph.202.5;
to be fanned or
blown about, u(p' a)ne/mou Com.Adesp. 1324, cf. Arist.Pr.967a21; pro\s a)ne/mwn Ph.2.511; klu/dwn a)nemizo/menos kai\ r(ipizo/menos Ep.Jac.1.6; r(ipizome/nh a)/xnh D.C.70.4: metaph., r(. tai=s e)lpi/si Alciphr.3.47.
hurl, Hld. 10.32, cf. 30 (Pass.).

r(i_p-i/s, i/dos, h(, (r(i/y)
fan for raising the fire, Ar.Ach.669,888; r(. d' e)gei/rei . . *(hfai/stou ku/nas, i.e. the slumbering flames, Eub.75.7; pteri/na r(. AP 6.306 (Aristo).
lady's fan, Stratt.56, AP6.290 (Diosc.), D.H.7.9. = r(i/y, Crates Com.13. r(ipi/r (prob. Elean): r(ipi/s, to\ ple/gma, h)\ e)k sxoi/nou pe/tasos. *)attikoi\ de\ r(ipi/da, w(=| to\ pu=r kai/ousi: kai\ trape/zas ou(/tw le/gousi, Hsch.; Elean r(ipi/r also in Inscr.Olymp.718, perh. = di/skos,
quoit, unless it is a pr. n. r(ipi/s: tou= ske/lous to\ a)krokw/lion, Hsch. [The acc. r(ipi=da occurs in AP6.306 (Aristo); but r(ipi/da, -i/di in Ar., etc.]

r(i_/p-i^sis, ews, h(,
blowing with a bellows or
fan, Thphr.Ign.36 (dub. rest.), Gal.8.416, Alex. Aphr.Pr.1.113.

r(i_/p-isma, atos, to/,
air of a fan, etc., r(. lw/phs AP 5.293 (Agath.).

r(i_p-ismo/s, o(,
fanning, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus.58.100,101 (written r(up-).

r(i_p-isth/s, ou=, o(,
fan, Gloss.

r(i_p-isto/s, h/, o/n,
ventilated, airy, u(perw=|a LXX Je.22.14.

r(i=pos, eos, to/,= r(i/y,
mat or
hurdle, r(i/pei+ kala/mwn v.l. in Hdt.2.96; a)xu/rwn r(.
Docum.Ant.dell' Africa Italiana 1.86, al. (Cyrene, iv B.C.): also r(i=pos, o(, Aen.Tact.29.6 (pl.), PPetr.3p.328 (pl.), Agatharch. 63, Dsc.1.45.

r(ipt-a/zw, Frequentat. of r(i/ptw,
throw to and fro, toss about, r(ipta/zwn kata\ dw=ma qeou/s Il.14.257; o)fru/si r(ipta/zeske
moved the eyebrows
up and down, h.Merc.279:—Pass.,
toss about, esp. in bed, Hp. Epid.4.31 (so r(ipta/zein e(auto/n Morb.2.69; and r(ipta/zein alone,
Acut. (Sp.）18); pra=gma pollai=si . . a)grupni/aisin e)rriptasme/non Ar.Lys.27; u(/fh gunaikw=n . . e)rripta/zeto S.Fr.210 iii 12; th=| gnw/mh| polla\ r(iptasqei\s e)p' a)mfo/tera Plu.Cic.37; r(ipta/sai peridew=s BCH48.518 (Palestine). Pass. also,= r(i/ptomai, AP5.164 (Mel.).

r(ipt-asmo/s, o(,
throwing or
tossing about, tw=n mele/wn Hp.Acut.54: abs.,
tossing about in bed, Id.Coac.81, Plu.2.455b; a)/sh lu/ph meta\ r(iptasmou= Stoic. 3.100.

r(ipt-astiko/s, h/, o/n,
tossing to and fro: to\ r(.,= r(iptasmo/s, M. Ant.1.16.

r(ipt-e/w, used only in pres. and impf., collat. form of r(i/ptw, first in Od., a)n-erri/ptoun a(/la phdw=| 13.78, where it suits the metre (but not the Ion. dialect); so in Ar., r(iptei=te xlai/nas Ec.507; diarriptou=nte Id.V.59; in Trag. r(ipte/w is never either guaranteed or disproved by the metre, r(iptei/sqw A.Pr.1043 (anap., cod. Med.), r(iptei= S.Aj.239 (anap.), Ant.131 (anap.), Tr.780, r(iptei=n E.Tr.734 cod. P, r(iptou=nq' Hel.1096 cod. L, r(iptou=ntes Heracl.149 codd. LP; r(i/ptet' and e)/rripton are guaranteed by the metre in E.HF941, Ba.1097, so that r(i/ptwn, r(i/ptei may be accepted in E.Ba.150 (lyr.), Hel.1325 (lyr.); r(ipte/w is found also in Prose, r(ipteu=si Hdt.4.94 (v.l.); r(ipte/ousi ib.188, cf. 7.50 (a)na-), 8.53, Th.4.95 (a)na-), Pl.Ti.80a, Arist.Ph.266b30, Mu.396a2, Plb.1.47.4, al., Agatharch.26; r(eiptoume/nwn OGI629.158 (Palmyra, ii A.D.), etc.
r(ipt-i/zomai, Pass.,= r(ipi/zomai (perh. f.l. for it), Arist.Pr.866a18.

r(ipt-iko/s, h/, o/n,
capable of throwing, Simp.in Ph.1228.37.

r(ipt-o/s, h/, o/n,
thrown, cast, hurled, r(. mo/ros death
by throwing down (a precipice), S.Tr. 357.

r(i/pt-w, also r(ipte/w, and (in frequentat. sense) r(ipta/zw (qq. v.): —Ion. Iterat. r(i/ptaskon Il.15.23, Od.11.592, -eskon Nic.Fr.26: fut. r(i/yw Il.8.13, etc.: aor. e)/rriya 23.842, etc. (e)/riya Arion 18, Mosch. 3.32, a)pe/riya Pi.P.6.37), Ep. r(i=ya Il.3.378; also 3sg. aor. 2 e)/rri^fe Opp.C.4.350: pf. e)/rrifa Lys.10.9:—Med., aor. r(i/yanto Man.6.10, a)po-ri/yasqai Gal.16.146:—Pass., fut. r(ifqh/somai （a)por-) S.Aj.1019; r(i^fh/somai LXX Ez.7.19, Plu. CG3 (v.l. in S.l.c.); 3 fut. e)rri/yomai Luc.Merc.Cond.17: aor. e)rri/fqhn A.Supp.484 (a)po-), E.Andr.10 (v.l.), Pl.Lg.944d; also e)rri/fhn [i^] E.Hec.335, Fr.489, Pl.Lg.944a, Sosith.3, etc.; poet. e)ri/fhn AP12.234 (Strat.): pf. e)/rrimmai Orac. ap.Hdt.1.62, E.Med.1404 (anap.), Ar.Ec.850, etc.; poet. redupl. r(eri/fqai Pi.Fr.318, cf. PMag.Par.1.194, 2039 (a)po-): plpf. e)/rripto Luc.Nec.17. [i_ by nature, Hdn.Gr.2.10; freq. written with ei in later Inscrr. (cf. r(ipte/w, katarri/ptw) and Papyri, as Phld.Ir.p.38 W., (pros-) Rh.2.94 S.; the Ep. aor. 1 is r(i=ya, not r(i/ya: i^ in fut. 2 and aor. 2 Pass.]:—
throw, cast, hurl, so/lon, sfai=ran Il.23.842, Od.6.115; xersi/ Pi.P.3.57; r(. a)po\ bhlou= Il.1.591, etc.; h)/ min e(lw\n r(i/yw e)s *ta/rtaron 8.13, cf. A.Pr.1051 (anap.); e)s to\ dustuxe/s Id.Ch.913; e)s flo/ga S.Tr.695; poti\ ne/fea Od.11.592; xqoni\ r(. e(auto/n
throw on the ground, S.Tr.790, cf. E.IA39 (anap.); e)s u(/dwr yuxro/n Th.2.49: abs., e)rrimme/nos
prostrate, e)rrimme/nous kai\ mequ/ontas Plb.5.48.2; e)/ti tw=n nekrw=n . . e)rrimme/nwn e)pi\ th=s a)gora=s
lying, Plu.Galb.28; klw=nas e)/xousa e)pi\ gh=s e)rrimme/nous Dsc.1.29, cf. 4.169; e)/rriptai nekroi=s o(/moia, of hibernating animals, Aët.16.67; ta\ meli/sseia e)n a)grw=| e)/riptai
have been deposited, PCair.Zen.467.5 (iii B.C.);
cast a net, e)/rriptai o( bo/los the cast
have been made, Orac. ap. Hdt.1.62; au)tou= xerma/das . . e)/rripton
threw stones
at him, E.Ba.1097, cf. Cyc.51 (lyr.); r(. tina\ pro\s pe/tran
throw him against a rock, S.Tr.780; but kata\ stu/flou pe/tras down from a rock, E.IT1430, cf. A.Pr.748; kata\ krhmnw=n down a precipice, Th.7.44, Pl.Lg.944a (Pass.); w)le/nas pro\s ou)rano/n E.Hel.1096. like r(ipta/zw, r(. e(wuth/n
toss oneself
about, as in a fever, Hp.Mul.1.2; e)pi\ laia\ kai\ e)pi\ decia\ sauto/n AP5.118 (Crin.): generally,
throw about, ploka/mous E.IA758, cf. Ba.150 (both lyr.);
winnow, Gal.6.541.
cast out of house or land, S.OT719, Ph.265, etc.; mh\ r(ifqw= kusi\n pro/blhtos Id.Aj.830.
throw off or
away, of arms, E.El.820; of clothes, Pl.R.474a, Lys.3.12; so e)/rriye *pa/gasos despo/tan
threw him, Pi.I.7(6).44; esp. r(. a)spi/da (cf. r(i/yaspis), Lys.10.9, etc.; bibli/on PUniv.Giss.20.12 (ii A.D.). r(. lo/gous
cast them
forth, hurl them, A.Pr.314, E.Alc.680; to\ proeirhme/non a)napodei/ktws e)rri/fqai Phld.Rh.1.57 S.; also,
throw them
away, waste them, A.Ag.1068, cf. E.Med.1404 (anap., Pass.); lo/goi ma/thn r(ife/ntes Id.Hec.335; so oi)/xetai . . tau=t' e)rrimme/na
set at naught, S. Aj.1271. r(. e)pi\ pa/ntas tou\s klh/rous, as in a scramble, Pl. R.617e; r(. pa/nta ku/bon kefalh=s u(/perqen e)mh=s AP5.24 ([Phld.]): hence r(. ki/ndunon
make a bold throw, run a risk, E.Fr.402.7. r(. e(auto/n
throw or
cast oneself
down, X.Cyr.3.1.25: abs.,
fling oneself, e)s po/nton Thgn.176; e)s a(/lmhn E.Cyc.166; ta/fron e)s koi/lhn Id.Alc. 897 (anap.); r(. e)n pe/nqei kata\ dri/a Id.Hel.1325 (lyr.), cf. Men.312, Vett. Val.126.22; cf. ba/llw A. 111. dub. l. in Orph.Fr. 264.

r(i/s, h(, gen. r(i_no/s, acc. r(i=na, pl. r(i=nes:—
nose or
snout of men and beasts, Il.5.291, Od.4.445, Hdt.3.154, Ar.Pax 21, Pl.Prt.329d, etc.; e(/lkein tina\ th=s r(ino/s lead him by the
nose, Luc.Herm.73; e(/lkesqai th=s r(. ib.68; mh\ th\n xolh\n e)pi\ r(ino\s e)/x' eu)qu/s Herod.6.37. in pl.
nostrils, but freq., like Lat.
nares, nose, Il.16.503, Od.5.456, al., Hes.Sc.267, S.Aj.918, Ar.Nu.344, etc.; sto/ma te r(i=ne/s te Il.14.467, cf. 23.395, al., Pl.Ti.79e. prob.
brow of a hill or projecting
spur of land, IG14.352 ii 36, al. (Halaesa).—A later nom. form is r(i/n, Hp.Vict.1.23 (prob. f.l. for r(i=nes), Aret.CA1.2, Luc.Asin.12; as name of a bandage, Sor.Fasc.11. [i_, but i^ in AP11.418 (Trajan).]

r(ish=s, o(,
superintendent of the lake, title of Egyptian priest, Sammelb.5231.2 (i A.D.), al.; also r(ishge/ths, ou, o(, ibid.

r(i/skos, o(,
coffer, chest, esp. for plate or money, Antiph.130, Phylarch. 10J., Posidipp.10, Phleg.Fr.36.1 J.,
PLond.ined.2312.11, PSI 4.428.45, cf. 411 (both iii B.C.), Phot.;
travelling-trunk, portmanteau, PCair.Zen.92.1 (iii B.C.).
sarcophagus, IG14.1934f3. r(i/skoi: ei)=do/s ti muw=n, Hsch. (Phrygian word acc. to Donat. ad Ter. Eun.754.)

r(isko-fu^la/kion [a^], to/,
treasury, Aristeas 80.

r(isko-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
treasurer, r(. e)n *perga/mw| Sardis 7(1).4 (ii B.C.), cf. Aristeas 33.
r(i^fh/, h(,= r(i=mma and r(i=yis, Lyc.235,1326.

r(i/y, r(i_po/s, h( (later also o(, Arist.Pr.911b11),
plaited work of osiers or rushes,
wicker-work, mat, fra/ce de/ min [sxedi/hn] r(i/pessi diampere\s oi)sui/+nh|si, ku/matos ei)=lar e)/men, evidently as a kind of
bulwark (cf. para/rruma), Od.5.256; r(iyi\ katastega/zein Hdt.4.71; pa/recis r(ipw=n SIG57.32 (Milet., V B.C.): prov., qeou= qe/lontos ka)\n e)pi\ r(ipo\s ple/ois E. Fr.397, cf. Ar.Pax 699, Luc.Herm.28, Favorin. in PVat.11.7.27; cf. r(i=pos.

r(iy-aspi/a, h(, (r(i/ptw, a)spi/s)
throwing away of the shield, Sch. Hermog. in Rh.4.253 W.
r(iy-a/spi^dos, on,= sq., xei/r Eup.Oxy. 1087.46.

r(i/y-aspis, idos, o(, h(,
throwing away one's shield in battle, craven, Ar.Nu.353, Pax1186, Pl.Lg.944b.

r(iy-au/xhn, enos, o(, h(,
tossing the neck (or
head), properly of horses: metaph., r(iyau/xeni su\n klo/nw| Pi.Dith.Oxy.1604 ii 13.

r(i=yis, ews, h(,
throwing, hurling, tocikh\ kai\ pa=sa r(. Pl.Lg.813e, cf. Arist.Ph.243a20, 257a3, Str.6.1.1. pl.,
glances, r(i/yeis o)mma/twn Plu.Sull.35; but r(i=yis o)/mmatos
drooping of eyelid, read by Gal.（17 (1).895) for e)/rriyis in Hp.Epid.6.1.5.
being thrown or
hurled, *(hfai/stou r(i/yeis u(po\ patro/s Pl.R.378d; r(. kai\ ptw=sis ou)rani/wn swma/twn Plu.Lys.12;
throwing oneself, r(i/yeis e)pi\ pro/swpon Id.2.166a.

r(iyokindu_n-eusi/a, h(,
fool-hardiness, Ptol.Tetr.182.

r(iyokindu_n-e/w,
to be fool-hardy, Hp.Ep.17, D.C.66.8.
r(iyokindu_n-i/a, h(,= -eusi/a, Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.173.

r(iyoki/ndu_n-os, on,
fool-hardy, reckless, e)/rgon X.Mem.1.3.9; nautili/a Alciphr.1.3; of persons, Id.3.52, Poll.1.179; to\ r(. Ph.1.326, App.BC5.84. Adv. -nws ib.1.103, POxy.2131.16 (iii A.D., r(eiy-).

r(iyologe/w,
utter rashly, Plb.12.8.5, 32.2.8.

r(i/y-oplos, on,
throwing away one's arms, a)/th r(., of a panic flight, A.Th.315.
r(iy-ofqalmi/a, h(,= taxuth\s peri\ to\ i)dei=n to\ poqou/menon, Stoic.3.97.

r(iy-o/fqalmos, on,
easting the eyes about, Ptol.Tetr.164, 171.

r(o/a, h(, Ion. and Ep. r(oih/; later r(oia/, Arist.Col.796a21, Pr.923b25, al., Thphr.HP1.6.3, al., PHib.1.121.57 (iii B.C.), Gal.6.605:—
pomegranate-tree, Punica Granatum, Od.7.115, IG11(2).287 A 147 (r(oan), 155 (r(ohn) (Delos, iii B.C.). the fruit,
pomegranate, h.Cer.372, 412, A.Fr.363, Ar.V.1268, Hermipp.36, Pl.Lg.845b, Thphr.HP7.13.4, IG11(2).161 B 44 (Delos, iii B.C.), Dsc.1.110.
knob shaped like a pomegranate, r(oiai\ xru/seai, a)rgu/reai, Hdt.7.41;
tassel of like shape,= r(oi/+skos, LXX 3 Ki.7.18, J.AJ3.7.4, BJ5.5.7.—Cf. si/dh. [Both r(oa/ and r(oia/ are oxyt. acc. to Hdn.Gr.1.301, 2.271.]
r(oa/, h(, Dor. for r(oh/ (q.v.).

r(oa/s, a/dos, h(, (r(e/w)
shedding of fruit, a disease of vines, f.l. for r(ua/s, Thphr.HP4.14.6.

r(o/ba, h(,
dress, garment, r(a/pths r(obon (i.e. r(obw=n) MAMA3.581 (Corycus). (Cf. French
robe.）

r(obdei=: a)narriptei= met' h)/xous, Hsch. (cf. r(oibde/w). r(o/billos: basili/skos o)/rnis, Id. r(oblei=: r(ofei=, pnei=, Id. r(obopw/lhs, v. r(wpopw/lhs. r(o/gan: to\n fone/a, to\n au)to/xeira, Id. r(o/gan: r(w=ga, Id. r(ogei=: o)rga=, a)kma/zei, dama/zei, Id.

r(ogeu/s, e/ws, o(,
dyer, IG5(1).209.27 (Sparta), Hsch.; cf. r(egeu/s, r(e/zw (B).
r(ogh/, h(,= r(ogi/on, Ps. -Democr.Alch.p.55 B.
r(ogi/a: a)ke/stria, Hsch.

r(ogi/on, to/,
receiver of a still, Zos.Alch.p.142 B.
r(ogkia/w,= r(e/gkw, Dor. inf. r(ogkih=n Epich.197.
r(ogmo/s, v. r(wxmo/s.

r(ogo/s, o(, in Sicily and Magna Graecia,
granary, barn, Epich.22, Tab.Heracl.1.102, Hsch. (Cf. Lat.
rogus.）

r(ogxa/zw,= r(ugxia/zw, Hsch. s.h.v. =
runcino, Gloss.

r(ogxa^li/zw,
snore, Gloss. ad Theoc.6.30, Gloss.
r(ogxasmo/s, o(,= r(e/gxos, Gal.19.467 (pl.).

r(ogxasth/s, ou=, o(,=
nasator, Gloss.
r(ogxo/s, v. r(wxmo/s.

r(od-a/kanqa, h(,
wild rose, Gloss.

r(od-a/kinon, to/,
nectarine, Alex. Trall.7.1, Febr.1; also r(odakine/a Id.Verm.（2p.595P.).
r(od-a^lo/s, h/, o/n,= r(o/dinos, pareiai/ Opp.C.1.501.
r(o/d-amnos, v. o)ro/damnos.

r(oda/n-h [a^], h(, （r(odano/s) like kro/kh,
spun thread, woof or
weft, Batr. 183, cf. Eust.1527.60, Sch.Ar.V.1137, etc.; Hsch. gives r(ada/nh, but (s.v. tolu/ph） r(oda/nh.
r(odan-i/zw,= to\ sunexw=s th\n kro/khn tina/ssein, Sch. B Il.18.576, cf. Eust.1527.60; r(adani/zw, Id.1165.22, cf. Heracleon ap.EM702.8, Hsch. (Pass.).

r(odan-isth/rion, to/,=
tramarium, Gloss.

r(oda^no/s, h/, o/n, perh.
wavering, flickering, para\ r(odano\n donakh=a Il. 18.576:—this is the reading of most codd., but ancient critics differed as to the form; Zenod. gave dia\ r(adalo/n (which he derived from kradalo/n); the reading of Aristoph. and Aristarch. is uncertain, perh. para\ r(adino/n, v. Sch. ad loc.; cf. also r(adino/s (Apollon. Lex., who reads r(adino/n, absurdly interprets as lepto/n, oi(onei\ r(adono/n, para\ to\ r(a|di/ws donei=dqai).
r(od-a/rion, to/, Dim. of r(o/don, as an ornament, BGU781 iii 19 (pl., i A.D.); cj. for r(oida/rion in Hsch. s.v. a)/fuka.
r(od-e/a, h(, contr. r(odh= (q.v.).
r(o/d-eios, on,= sq., Suid.

r(o/d-eos, a, on,
of roses, a)/nqea, pe/tala, Ibyc.5, E.Med.841 (lyr.), Hel.244 (lyr.); li/pos Nic.Al. 155.
like a rose, rosy, stafulh/ AP6.102 (Phil.); mazoi/ Nonn.D. 9.296.

r(od-ew/n, w=nos, o(,
rose-bed, BGU1119.11 (i B.C.), Anacreont. App.2.57 p.353 Bgk. (Constant. Sic.).

r(od-h=, h(, contr. for r(ode/h = r(ode/a,
rose-bush, Archil.29, Asclep.Myrl. ap. Ath.2.50e, Pamphil.ib. 52f; Ion. r(ode/h A.R.3.1020 (but v. r(o/don init.).
r(odi/a, v. *(ro/dios. r(odih/, h(,= r(odew/n, Schwyzer 719.9 (Theb. ad Mycalen, iv B.C.).

*(rodia^ko/s, h/, o/n,
of Rhodes, Str.2.5.14:—*(rodiako/n (sc. sku/fos), to/,
a kind of cup made at Rhodes, Epig.5, Diph.5, IG11(2).110.21, 27 (Delos, iii B.C.), etc.; also called *(rodiakh\ xutri/s, Arist.Fr.110; *(rodiakh/ alone, IG11(2).110, al. (Delos, iii B.C.), 7.3498.6 (Orop.); and *(rodia/s, a/dos, h(, Ath.11.496e, Phot.

r(odi/zw, (r(o/don)
to be like the rose, Ath.15.677e; th=| o)smh=| Dsc.1.13; in colour, Gp.14.16.2. trans.,
scent with roses, ta\s sunqe/seis Thphr.Od.47; to\ de/rma Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.12.
deck a person's grave
with roses, BCH24.415 (Bithynia):—Pass.,
to have one's grave decked with roses, CIG3754 (Nicaea).

r(odi^noporfu^rou=s, a=, ou=n,
rose-purple, Stud.Pal.20.245.11 (vi A.D.).

r(o/di^nos, h, on, (r(o/don)
made of or
from roses, ste/fanos Anacr.83; a)/leifa Hippon.58; mu/ron Cephisod.3; mu/ron is understood in Thphr. Od.25, al., PPetr.2p.114 (iii B.C.), Dsc.1.43; sc. e)/laion,
Edict.Diocl. Delph.6, SIG1172.8 (Lebena).
pink, POxy.496.4 (ii A.D.), Cod.Just.11.9.3, etc.

*(ro/dios, a, on, (*(ro/dos)
Rhodian, of or
from Rhodes, Il.2.654, etc.; *(r. te/xnh the art of
painting, Anacreont.15.3; h( *(r. (sc. xw/ra) Str.2.4.3, etc.; r(. (sc. draxmh/)
Rhodian drachma, Roussel
Cultes Egyptiens p.236 (Delos, ii B.C.), Inscr.Délos 442 B204 (pl., ii B.C.): *(ro/dia, ta/, a kind of shoes, Hsch.: *(ro/dion, to/, sc. me/tron, Ostr.Bodl.iii 369, Ostr.Strassb.615-617 (ii A.D.), Ostr.i p.765:—cf. *(rodiako/s.

r(od-i/s, i/dos, h(,
pastille made from roses, Dsc.1.99.3, Damocr. ap. Gal. 14.133.
r(od-i/sia, ta/,= sq., Jahresh.26 Beibl.17 (Ephesus).

r(od-ismo/s, o(,
ceremony at which graves were decked with roses, Inscr.Perg.374 B 8 (ii A.D.), Supp.Epigr.1.330B8 (Istria, ii A.D.), BCH24.425 (Bithynia).

r(od-i/ths [i_] oi)=nos, o(, wine
flavoured with roses, Dsc.5.27, Gp.8.2 tit.
r(od-i=tis, idos, h(, name of a gem, Plin.HN37.191.

r(odo-ba^fh/s, e/s,
rose-coloured, PHolm.19.31.

r(odo-da/ktu^los, on, Aeol. brododa/ktulos (q.v.),
rosy-fingered, as epith. of *)hw/s in Hom. and Hes., Od.2.1, Hes.Op.610, etc.; *)ina/xou r(ododa/ktulos ko/ra B.18.18; *ku/pris Coluth.99.

r(odo-da/fnh, h(,
rose-laurel, i.e. prob.
Nerium Oleander, or perh.
rhododendron, Dsc.4.81, cf. Plin.HN16.79, Luc. Asin.17, Pseudol.27, Artem.1.77, 2.25.
r(odo/-dendron, to/,= foreg., Dsc.4.81, Plin.HN16.79.

r(odo-eidh/s, e/s,
rose-like, rosy, Musae.114, AP15.40.18 (Cometas); xitw/n f.l. for r(agoeidh/s in Poll.2.70; -e/s, to/, name of a remedy for nose-bleeding, Orib.Fr.15.

r(odo/-eis, essa, en,
of roses, e)/laion Il.23.186; a)/nqea E.IA1298 (lyr.); r(. xa/ris
as of roses, AP5.80 (Dionys.), cf. Diosc. in PLit.Lond.99.6. e)pi\ r(odo/enti *luko/rma| on the
rose-clad banks of L., B.15.34.
rosecoloured, ei)/ria AP6.250 (Antiphil.).

r(odo/-kolpos, on,
rosy-bosomed, *eu)nomi/a Lyr.Adesp.140.
r(odo/-ma_lon, v. r(odo/mhlon.

r(odo/-meli, itos, to/,
rose-honey, Dsc.5.27, Philagr. ap. Orib.5.17.5, Edict.Diocl.Delph.14, Aët.3.104.

r(odo/-mhlon, Dor. r(odo/-ma_lon, to/,
rose-apple: metaph. of
a plump rosy cheek, Theoc.23.8 (r(odoma/llon codd., r(o/da ma/lwn Ahrens).
a confection of roses and quinces, Alex.Trall.1.10.

r(o/don, to/, metaplast. dat. pl. r(ode/essi v.l. in A.R.3.1020:—
rose, first in h.Cer.6, cf. Thgn.537, Pi.I.4(3).18(36), Hdt.8.138, IG12.289; Aeol. bro/don (q.v.); mostly of
Rosa gallica, red rose, Thphr.HP6.6.4, etc.; r(. e(katonta/fullon,
Rosa centifolia, cabbage rose, ibid.; r(. a)/grion,
Rosa dumetorum, wild rose, ib.6.2.1: metaph., r(o/da m' ei)/rhkas you've spoken
roses of me, have said
all things sweet and
beautiful, Ar.Nu.910; pa/tte polloi=s toi=s r(o/dois ib.1330: prov., u(=s dia\ r(o/dwn 'a bull in a china shop', Crates Com.4. = r(odwnia/, Coluth.348. *(ro/da, ta/,= r(odismo/s, Rev.Hist.Rel.97.275 (Bulgaria).
pudenda muliebria, Pherecr.108.29.

r(odo/-peplos, on,
with roseate veil or
robe, Q.S.3.608.
r(odo/-phxus, Dor. etc.

r(odo/-pa_xus, Aeol. brodo/paxus (q.v.), u, gen. u^os,
rosy-armed, h.Hom.31.6, Hes.Th.246,251, B.12.96, Theoc.2.148, Anacreont.53.21.

r(odo-pi^tu^i/+nh, h(,
rose-pine resin, Hippiatr.35.

r(odo/-pnoos, on,
breathing of roses, Ephipp.26.

r(odo/-pu_gos, on,
rosy-rumped, AP5.54 (Diosc.).

r(odo-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
rose-seller, Gloss.
*(ro/dos, h(, the island (also the city) of Rhodes, Il.2.654, etc.
*(rodoska/rfa, title of a deity in Cyprus, Berl.Sitzb.1911.639 (Rantidi); cf. skarfa=sqai.

r(odo/-stagma, atos, to/, (sta/zw)
extract of roses prepared with honey, like r(odo/meli, Sch.Ar.Pl.529; also r(odo/-stakton, to/, Paul.Aeg.7.15.

r(odo/-sternos, on,
with rosy breast, epith. of Isis, CIG5115 (Nubia).

r(odo-stefh/s, e/s, (ste/fw)
rose-crowned, Nonn.D.48.681.

r(odo/-sfu^ros, on,
rosy-ankled, Q.S.1.138; *xa/rites Him.Or.1.19; *)antoli/h PMag.Berol.2.93.

r(odounti/a, h(,
dish flavoured with roses, Ath.9.403d; cf. r(odwnia/ IV.

r(odo-feristh/s, ou=, o(, dub. sens. in PRyl.224（
a)Intr. (ii A.D.).
r(odo-fo/ria, ta/,= r(odismo/s, prob. in Supp.Epigr.2.432 (Macedonia, iii A.D.).

r(odo-fo/ros, on,
bearing roses, name of Ptolemaïs (Acre), LXX 3 Ma.7.17 (v.l. -fo/nos); dub. sens. in Sammelb.4425 v 6 (ii A.D.).

r(odo/-fullon, to/,
rose-leaf, v.l.in Paul.Aeg.3.66.
r(odo/-xeir, xeiros, o(, h(,= r(odo/phxus, Sch.Theoc.2.148.

r(odo/-xroos, on, contr. r(odo/-xrous, oun, (xro/a)
rose-coloured, AP5.55 (Diosc.), Dsc.1.111, 2.106, Opp.H.1.130, Anacreont.53.22.
r(odo/-xrws, wtos, o(, h(,= foreg., Theoc.18.31.

r(od-w/n, w=nos, o(,
rose-bed, AP5.35 (Rufin.), POxy.729.32 (ii A.D.). pl. r(odw=nes,= a)/nemoi o)rniqi/ai, leuko/notoi, at Alexandria, Olymp. in Mete.177.21.

r(od-wnia/, h(,
rose-bed, garden of roses, Hecat. 37 J., D.53.16, etc.;
the rose, Thphr.HP2.2.1, 6.1.1, Ael.NA14.24.
vine with rose-coloured grapes, Phot. = r(ododa/fnh, Id., AB299. = r(odounti/a, Aemilian. ap. Ath.9.406a. = r(o/don 111, Cratin.109. gloss on *)afrodi/ths a)ka/nqh (sic), prob. = r(oda/kanqa, Cyran.27.

r(od-wpo/s, o/n, (w)/y)
rosy-faced, rosy, Dsc.5.113; poet. fem. r(odw=pis, idos, Nonn.D.10.176.

r(od-wto/s, h/, o/n, as if from r(odo/w: to\ r(.
rose-water, Gloss.

r(oei/dion, to/, Dim. of r(o/os,
conduit or
brook, IG14.352 i 36, al. (Halaesa).

r(o/zw,= r(u/zw,
snarl, of dogs: metaph. of men, Phot., Suid.

r(oh/, h(, Dor. r(oa/ (dat.pl. rjovai=si, IG9(1).868 (Corc., vii/vi B.C.)), (r(e/w)
river, stream, freq. in Hom., always in pl., and mostly with gen. added, e)p' *)wkeanoi=o r(oa/wn Il.3.5; *maia/ndrou te r(oa/s 2.869; potamoi=o r(oh=|si Od.6.216; u(/datos kalh=|si r(. Il.16.229, cf. Schwyzer 289.107 (Priene, ii B.C.); *)wkeanou= r(. Hes.Th.841; also *skama/ndrioi r(. S.Aj. 419 (lyr.); tenage/wn r(. Pi.N.3.25; a)mpe/lou r(.
the juice of the grape, E.Cyc.123; me/litos Id.Ba.711; ai(/matos Id.Supp.690: rarely in sg., par' *)ismhnou= r(oa/n Pi.N.11.36 codd. (but r(oa=n is prob.); a)mpe/lou r(oh/ E.Ba.281: in Dor. Prose, SIG1183 (Gort.): metaph.,
stream of song or poesy, r(oai\ *moisa=n, e)pe/wn, Pi.N.7.12, I.7(6)19; h( dia\ tou= sto/matos r(. Pl.Tht.206d; promaqei/as r(oai/ Pi.N.11.46; also r(oai/
streams of events, tide of affairs, Id.O.2.33.
flowing of sap, Thphr.CP1.13.5 (pl.).
flux, as a philosoph. term, Pl.Tht.152e, v. Cra. 402a; cf. r(e/w 1.5. Cf. r(o/os 11, r(oi/a 1.

r(ohto/kos, on,
producing streams, Jo.Gaz.Ecphr.2.311.

r(oq-e/w, (r(o/qos)
make a rushing noise: hence, of a
roaring fire, e)n r(oqou=nti kriba/nw| A.Fr.309. of any confused
noise, tau=ta . . e)rro/qoun e)moi/ such
clamours they raised against me, S.Ant.290; lo/goi . . e)rro/qoun kakoi/
there was a noise of angry words, ib.259.

r(oq-ia/zw, strengthd. form of foreg.,
ply the dashing oar, Cratin.345, Hermipp. 54; also of the ship, e)k pitu/lwn r(. Ar.Fr.84. of pigs eating,
make a guttling noise, Id.Ach.807; cf. r(o/qios 1.2.

r(oq-ia/s, a/dos, h(, poet. fem. of r(o/qios,
dashing, kw/ph A.Pers.396.
r(o/q-ion, to/, v. sq. 11.

r(o/q-ios, on, also a, on AP9.32, 10.2 (Antip.Sid.):—
rushing, roaring, dashing, esp. of waves, a)mfi\ de\ ku=ma be/bruxen r(o/qion Od.5.412; of oars, r(. pla/tai E.IT1133 (lyr.); of a ship
dashing through the waves, AP10.2 (Antip. Sid.); meta\ r(oqi/ou bi/as Arist.Mu.396a14: metaph. of an orator, Poll.6.147; of a horse, J.BJ6.2.8. Adv. -i/ws Poll.4.24 codd., Vett.Val.345.33. of fishes,
guttling, Numen. ap. Ath.7.306d; cf. r(oqia/zw 2.
swift, po/des Leonid.Oxy.662.45. Subst. r(o/qia, ta/,
waves dashing on the beach, breakers, waves, S.Ph.688 (lyr.); a)ne/mwn eu)ae/ssin r(oqi/ois E.Fr.773.36 (lyr.); cf.ou)tidano/s 11; and collectively in sg.,
surf, surge, A.Pr.1048 (anap.), E.IT426 (lyr.), Th.4.10: esp. of
the dash and sound of oars, r(oqi/ois . . kw/pas E.IT407 (kw/pais codd., lyr.), cf.Cyc.17; so in sg., Th. l.c. (acc. to Sch.), Hyp.Fr.157, Str. 15.2.12, D.S.13.99, etc.; glukera\ r(., of wine, AP11.64 (Agath.): generally, of
rushing, dashing motion, th=s i(/ppou to\ r(. a)ne/xesqai D.H. 6.10, cf. Arr.Frr.164, 165 J.; so th=s o(rmh=s, tou= qumou=, Luc. Tox.19,55: metaph., a)oida=n r(o/qia Pi.Pae.6.129; r(oq[i/w| tini\] h(/kw tu/xhs prob.in Men. Pk.353.
loud shout, esp. of applause, r(. ai)/resqai/ tini Ar.Eq.546: generally,
tumult, riot, e)xw/rei r(. e)n po/lei kako/n E.Andr.1096.

r(oq-io/ths, htos, h(,
impetuosity, vehemence, of language, v.l. in Poll.4.22.
r(oqopu_g-i/zw, r(oqopu_g-ismo/s, v. r(aqapugi/zw.

r(o/qos, o(,
rushing noise, roar of waves, dash of oars, e)c e(no\s r(. with one
stroke, i.e. all at once, A.Pers.462. of any confused, inarticulate sound, *persi/dos glw/sshs r(. the
noise of the Persian (i.e. barbarian) tongue, ib.406; th=s de\ *di/khs r(. e(lkome/nhs, h(=| k' a)/ndres a)/gwsi dwrofa/goi but there is
tumult or
confusion, when Justice is dragged
whithersoever bribed judges lead her, Hes.Op.220. of any
rushing motion, pteru/gwn r(. Opp.H.5.17. Boeot.,=
mountain path, Plu.in Hes.13; ai)go\s r(. a goat-
track, Nic.Th.672.

r(oi/a, h(, (r(e/w)
flow, flux, Hp.Loc.Hom.9(pl.). = kuli/stra tw=n i(/ppwn para\ tw=| potamw=| kai\ ya/mmw|, Hsch. (cf. r(oai/: . . i(ppo/dromos, Id.).
r(oia/, h(, later Att. for r(o/a. r(oi/agc: fa/ragc, Hsch. r(oiadiko/s, v. r(uadiko/s.

r(oia/s, a/dos, h(, v.l. for r(ua/s 111.2, Gal.UP10.11.
corn poppy, Papaver Rhoeas, Thphr.HP9.12.4, Dsc.4.64.

r(oibd-e/w,
move with a whistling or
rustling sound, r(oibdou=sa ko/lpon ai)gi/dos
letting the swelling aegis
rustle (as she flies), A.Eu.404: intr., of wind,
whistle, r(oibdh/sas *eu)=ros AP7.636 (Crin.).
suck down, of Charybdis, Od.12.106; ku=ma d' e)rroi/bdei me/ga su/neggus h(mw=n Ezek.Exag.237, cf. Aristid.Or.46(3).38.
cause to gush forth, o(/tan . . krhnai=on e)c a)/mmoio-h/sh ga/nos Lyc.247. (In signf. 11 r(ubde/w shd. perh. be written, cf. a)narroibde/w; signf. 1 is found also in a)porroibde/w, e)pirroibde/w.)
r(oibd-hdo/n,= r(oizhdo/n, Q.S.5.381; also r(oi/bdein (sic), Phot.; cf. r(u/bdhn.

r(oi/bd-hma, atos, to/,
rustling sound, S.Ichn. 107.

r(oi/bd-hsis, ews, h(,
whistling, piping, bouko/lwn E.IA1086 (pl., lyr.).

r(oi=bdos, o(,
any rushing noise or
motion, pterw=n r(.
whirring of wings, S.Ant.1004; [a)ne/mou] r(. kai\ r(u/mh
rushing of the wind, Ar. Nu.407. (Cogn. with r(oi=zos.)

r(oibdw|de/w, 3sg. pres. r(oibdw|dei=, glossed meta\ r(oi/zou saleu/ei, a)|dei= (sic), Theognost.Can.24; r(oibdw|dei= （-w/dei cod.): meta\ h)/xou a)/|dei （a)hdei= cod.) w(s oi( poime/nes, Hsch. <r(o>idamo/s: o( a)spa/ragos, Id.

r(oida/rion or r(oi+da/rion, to/, a cosmetic (
rouge?) containing a)/gxousa, Aët.2.68, dub. in Hsch. s.v. a)/fuka (v. r(oda/rion); cj. in Orib.Fr.15.

r(oi/+dion, to/, Dim. of r(oia/, r(o/a,
small pomegranate, Men.146, POxy. 1757.11 (ii A.D., written r(ou/+dion).
rind of pomegranate, Gloss.
r(oidmo/s: poio\s yo/fos, Hsch. r(oi/dnas: da/knas, and r(oiliai=s: da/knais, Id.
r(oiz-ai=os, a, on,= r(oizh/eis, Orac.Chald.300.

r(oiz-e/w, Ion. and Ep. impf. r(oi/zeske Hes.Th.835: aor. e)rroi/zhsa Opp. (v.infr.), Ep. r(oi/zhsa Il.10.502:—Pass., v. infr.: (r(oi=zos):—
whistle, Il.l.c.; of a snake,
hiss, Hes. l.c., A.R.4.129, etc.; e(o\n no/mon e)rroi/zhse Opp.H.1.563; of birds,
rush or
whirr through the air, Luc.Am.22, cf. Arist.HA535b27: in late Prose,
shoot an arrow, LXX 4 Ki.13.17 (cod. A); of a stream, ib.Ca.4.15:—so in Pass., i)w=n thlo/qen r(oizoume/nwn Lyc.1426, cf. 1325, Orac. in App.Anth.6.140.10; ta/x' a)\n e)rroi/zhto di' ai)qe/ros AP11.106 (Lucill.); of a stream, Orac.Chald.109.

r(oiz-hda/, Adv.
with rushing sound or
motion, Nic.Al.182,498; also r(oiz-hdo/n, Id.Th. 556, Lyc.66, 2 Ep.Pet.3.10, Aesop.30, Aret.CA1.7.

r(oiz-h/eis, essa, en,
whizzing, rushing, lo/gxas a)kwkh/ IG12(7).115.7 (Amorgos, ii/i B.C.); surigmo/s Nonn.D.6.191.

r(oi/z-hma, atos, to/,
rushing, whirring noise or
motion, as of birds, Ar.Av.1182 (pl.), cf. Luc.Musc. Enc.2; steropa=s Id.JTr.1; of the planetary spheres, Iamb.VP15.65(pl.); tragikw=| -h/mati r(h/cato fwnh/n AP5.221 (Agath.).

r(oiz-h/twr, oros, o(, h(,
one who moves with a rushing sound, Orph.H.6.5,8.6.

r(oi=z-os, o(, Ion. h(,
whistling or
whizzing of an arrow, Il.16.361, cf. Plu.Marc.15, Onos.19.3, etc.; of a scourge, Opp.H.2.352: any
whistling or
piping sound, as of a shepherd, pollh=| r(. Od.9.315; pneuma/twn r(. Plu.2.18c;
rush of wings, LXX Wi.5.11, Ael.NA2.26; of a stream, LXXEz.47.5, Ael.NA17.17; of the sea, Hymn.Is.150; of the
noise of a falling tree, Q.S.1.251;
hissing of a serpent, A.R. 4.138, 1543; used of the sound made by filing, Arist.Aud.802a39; of the letter r, Phld.Po.Herc.994.29, D.H.Comp.14, S.E.M.1.102.
rushing motion, rush, swing, Plu.Marc.15, Demetr.21, Epic. in Arch.Pap.7p.4.
r(oiz-o/w,= r(oize/w, Hsch.; also r(oi/zomai, Iamb.Myst.3.2 (codd.), 3.9 (as v.l. for r(oizoume/nas).

r(oi/+zw i(/ppon, （r(oh/)
water a horse, ride him
in a pond, r(oi/+santa ei)s u(/dwr gluku/ Hippiatr.87.—The form r(oi+zome/nous is dub.l.in Str.14.5.12.

r(oizw/dhs, es,
like or
with a rushing noise, of the pulse, Archig. ap. Gal.8.647; of emission of breath, Id.5.231: to\ r(.
rapid, whizzing motion, Plu.2.923c.
r(oih/, v. r(o/a.

r(oikoeidh/s, e/s,
crooked-looking, Gal.18(1).537; cf. r(aiboeidh/s.

r(oiko/s, h/, o/n,
crooked, koru/na, lagwbo/lon, Theoc.7.18,4.49; peri\ knh/mas r(oiko/s
bow-legged, Archil.58.4 (v.l. r(aibo/s, q.v.); r(. mhroi/ Hp. Mochl.22; to\ r(.
curvature of the leg, Arist.SE181b38.—Ion. word, acc. to EM242.2 (cod. Leid., where r(uko/s).

r(oi+ko/s, h/, o/n, (r(e/w, r(o/os)
fluid: hence,
flabby, sw/mata Hp.
Aër. 20.
suffering from a flux, of women, Dsc.1.68.5 (leg. -kai=s), 5.34, al.; gunai=kes r(. Id.1.117.
r(oikw/dhs, es,= r(oikoeidh/s, o)ste/a Hp.Mochl.30 (f.l. for r(oiw/dhs, cf. r(ow/dea o)ste/a ap.Erot.);= gau=sos kai\ streblo/s, Hp.（Art.86) ap.Erot. (r(oiw/dh codd. Hp., v. r(oiw/dhs).
r(oiliai=s, v. r(oi/dnas.

r(o/i+nos, h, on,
of the r(o/a,
of pomegranate, mosxeu/mata PCair.Zen.162 (iii B.C.); r(a/bdos An.Ox.3.226.

r(oi/+skos (A), o(, Dim. of r(o/a,
small pomegranate: hence,
knob or
tassel shaped like a pomegranate, LXX Ex.28.29(33), al., J.AJ3.7.4.

r(oi/+skos (B), o(, Dim. of r(oh/,
rivulet, brook, IG14.352 i 16, al. (Halaesa).
r(oi+smo/s, o(, (r(oi/+zw) = o( tw=n i(/ppwn r(ismo/s (sic), Hsch.

r(oi/+ths [i_] oi)=nos, o(, （r(o/a)
pomegranate-wine, Dsc.5.26: also r(oi+tiko/s (sc. oi)=nos), POxy.1142.16 (iii A.D.).

r(oiw/dhs, es,= r(ow/dhs,
watery, o)fqalmo/s Gal.17(1).967. of bones,
unjointed, held together only by ligaments, Hp.Art.86, Mochl.30: cf. r(oikw/dhs.

r(omb-e/w,
cause to spin like a r(o/mbos,
whirl, gloss on r(umbe/w (Pl.Cra. 426e codd.), Tim.Lex., cf. Hsch. s.v. bembiki/zei.

r(omb-hdo/n, Adv.
like a r(o/mbos, Man.4.108.

r(omb-hth/s, ou=, o(,
one-that spins like a r(o/mbos, Orph.H.31.2.

r(omb-hto/s, h/, o/n,
spun round like a r(o/mbos,
whirled about, r(ombhtou\s done/wn ploka/mous AP6.219 (Antip.), cf. 218 (Alc.).

r(omb-i/zw,= r(ombe/w, ei)/ se klwsth\r *moire/wn e)ro/mbisen
Mélanges Nicole 308 (Panticapaeum).
r(omb-i/on, Att. r(umb-, to/, Dim. of r(o/mbos 1.2, Sch.A.R.4.143 (r(umb-).

r(omboeidh/s, e/s,
rhombus-shaped, rhomboidal, Hp.Art.35, Str.2.1.22, etc.; r(. sxh=ma
rhomboid, i.e. a four-sided figure with only the opposite sides and angles equal, Euc.1 Def.22, Ph.Bel.52.30, Ptol. Alm.7.5, cf. Hegesand.37; to\ r(. stereo/n (v. r(o/mbos B.1 b) Simp.in Cael.410.5:—to\ r(., a place at Megara, Plu.Thes.27.

r(o/mbos or r(u/mbos, o(, (r(e/mbw)
bull-roarer, instrument whirled round on the end of a string, used in the mysteries, r(o/mbou q' ei(lissome/na ku/klios e)/nosis ai)qeri/a E.Hel.1362, cf. Archyt.1, Theoc.2.30; as a boy's toy, AP6.309 (Leon.), Orph.Fr.31.29, Fr.34, M.Ant.5.36; defined as culh/fion, ou(= e)ch=ptai to\ sparti/on, kai\ e)n tai=s teletai=s e)donei=to, i(/na r(oizh=|, Sch.Clem.Al.Protr.2.17.2, cf. Hsch.
magic wheel, spun alternately in each direction by the torsion of two cords passed through two holes in it, used as a love-charm, Luc.DMeretr. 4.5; called i)/ugc in Theoc.2.17, AP5.204; Lat.
rhombus, Prop.2.28.35, Ov.Am.1.8.7. troxi/skos o(\n stre/fousin i(ma=si tu/ptontes, kai\ ou(/tws ktu/pon a)potelou=si Sch.A.R.1.1134; w)= r(u/mbe masti/cas e)me/ (dub. sens.) Eup.72.
tambourine or
kettle-drum, used in the worship of Rhea and of Dionysus, Ar.Fr.303, Diog.Ath.1.3, A.R. 1.1139, AP6.165 (Phal.); r(u/mbos cu/linos e)pi/xrusos IG22.1456.49, cf. 1517.207.
membrum virile, PLond.1821.164.
whirling motion, as of a bull-roarer, a)ko/ntwn i(e/nta r(o/mbon shooting forth
whirling darts, Pi.O.13.94; ai)etou= r(. the eagle's
swoop, Id.I.4(3).47(65); r(. tupa/nwn Id.Dith.Oxy.1604 Fr.1 ii 9; e)n ai)qeri/w| r(u/mbw| Critias 19.2D.; r(o/mbou a)peiresi/ou dineu/masin oi)=mon e)lau/nwn, of the Sun, Orph.H. 8.7: metaph., *ne/mesis kai\ r(. a)la/stwr IG14.1389ii34 (perh. an Adj., = r(embo/s).—The Gramm. hold r(u/mbos to be Att., r(o/mbos Hellenic, Sch.Theoc.2.30, Ath.7.330b.
rhombus, lozenge, i.e. a four-sided figure with all the sides, but only the opposite angles, equal, Arist.Mech.854b16, Euc.1 Def. 22. r(. stereo/s, a figure composed of two cones on opposite sides of the same base, Archim.Sph.Cyl.1.26, al. a species of fish, of which
turbot and
brill are varieties, so called from its rhomblike shape, Nausicr.2.13; *(rwmai=oi kalou=si th\n yh=ttan r(. Ath.7.330b, cf. yh=tta.
surgical bandage, so called from its shape, Hp. Off.7, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.20.14.
pattern of the same shape, in weaving cloth, Democr.Eph.1; diaplokh\ r(o/mbwn Aristeas 74.

r(ombotetra/gwnon sxh=ma, the figure
of a rhombus, Tz.H.8.581.

r(omb-o/w,
bring into the shape of a rhombus, Hero Bel.102.12 (pf. Pass.).
r(omb-w/dhs, es, f.l. for r(embw/dhs, Plu.2.715c.

r(omb-wto/s, h/, o/n,
made in the shape of a rhombus, panelled in lozenges, Callix.1, AP6.111 (Antip.), Aristeas 67, J.AJ12.2.10.

r(o/mica: ei)=dos a)konti/ou, Hsch. (Lat.
rumex.）
r(o/mma, atos, to/, （r(o/fw） = r(o/fhma, Hp. ap. Gal.19.135.

r(o/mos, o(,
wood-worm, Arc.59.24; r(o/moc, Hsch.(s.v.l.).
r(omfa/zw,= basta/zw, Hsch.

r(omfai/a, h(,
large, broad sword, used by the Thracians, o)rqa\s r(. barusidh/rous a)po\ tw=n deciw=n w)/mwn e)pisei/ontes Plu.Aem.18, cf. Phylarch. Fr.57 J., Arr.Fr.103J.: generally,
sword, LXX Ge.3.24, al., Ev.Luc.2.35, Apoc.6.8, Jul.Ep.89b; of the
sword of Goliath, LXX 1 Ki. 17.51, J.AJ6.12.4. = nukteri/s, Cyran.36.
r(omfei=s: i(ma/ntes oi(=s r(a/ptetai ta\ u(podh/mata, Hsch. (cf. o(rmoi/).

r(oo/kokka, ta/,
pomegranate seeds, Steph.in Hp.1.222D.
r(o/on, to/, only in pl. r(o/a,= ta\ e)k th=s sukami/nou mo/ra ta\ a)/wra chranqe/nta, Hp. ap. Gal.19.135: but in sg., o(

entryFree.sense: o( e)k tw=n sukami/nwn Diocl. Fr.140, cf. Hp.Mul.1.31.

div0.entryFree:
r(o/os, o(, Cypr. r(o/vos Inscr.Cypr.135.19 H., Att. contr. r(ou=s: Ion. and later writers have the heterocl. dat. r(oi/+ (like noi/+ from nou=s), Hellanic. 28J., Ach.Tat.3.20; also gen. r(oo/s Peripl.M.Rubr.46: (r(e/w):—
stream, flow of water, current, Hom. only in sg., freq. with gen., r(. *)alfeioi=o, *)wkeanoi=o, etc., Il.11.726, 16.151, al.; ku=ma r(o/oio 21.263; proxe/ein r(o/on ei)s a(/la ib.219; potamou\s e)/treye ne/esqai ka\r r(o/on to flow in
their own bed, 12.33; kata\ r(o/on down, i.e. with, the
stream, Od.5.327,461, Hdt.2.96, etc.: metaph., fe/resqai kata\ r(ou=n Pl.R.492c; tauti\ kata\ r(. proxwrei= Luc.JTr.50; pro\s r(o/on against
it, Il.21.303; *bo/sporos, r(. qeou= A.Pers.746 (troch.);
current at sea, u(po/ te tou= r(ou= kai\ a)ne/mou Th.1.54; ei)kh=| kata\ r(ou=n ple/ontas Phld.Rh.1.381S.: also,
current of air, Emp.100.14; r(o/os kapnou= Pi.P.1.22.
flux, discharge of morbid humours, Hp.Aph.5.56, Arist HA521a28, Thphr.HP9.12.1. = r(oh/ 3, Pl.Cra.411d. v. r(o/on.
r(opa^l-i/zei: stre/fei, kinei= w(s r(o/palon, Hsch.

r(opa^l-iko/s, h/, o/n,
like a club, i.e.
thicker towards the end: hence,
versus rhopalicus, a verse
in which each word is one syllable longer than that before (such as Il.3.182), Serv. in Gramm.Lat.4.467K. (
rhopalius Sacerd.ib.6.505K.).

r(opa^/l-ion, to/, Dim. of r(o/palon, PPetr.3p.59 (iii B.C.), Promathid. ap.Ath.11.489b; part of a ku/lic, Inscr.Délos 442B146 (ii B.C.); part of a sku/fos, Roussel
Cultes Egyptiens p.217 (Delos, ii B.C.).

r(opa^l-ismo/s, o(,
priapism, Ar.Lys.553 (pl.).

r(opa^lo-eidh/s, e/s,
like a club, r(i/za Dsc.3.132.
r(opa^lo-ma/xos [ma^], on, = korunh/ths, Hsch.sub h.v.

r(o/pa^lon, to/,
club, cudgel, used to beat an ass, Il.11.559,561; to walk with, Od.17.195;
club of the Cyclops, 9.319; of Heracles, S. Tr.512 (lyr.), Ar.Ra.47,495;
war-club or
mace, shod with metal, pagxa/lkeon Od.11.575, cf. X.HG7.5.20; r(o/pala cu/lwn tetulwme/na sidh/rw| Hdt.7.63; a hunter's
staff, X.Cyn.6.11,17: as votive offering, SIG1106.124 (Cos, iv/iii B.C.): metaph., *peiqo/laos th\n *pa/ralon r(. tou= dh/mou e)ka/lei Arist.Rh.1411a13.
membrum virile, APl.4.261 (Leon.). v.l. for r(o/ptron 111, X.HG6.4.36. = numfai/a, Plin.HN25.75.

r(opa^lofo/ros, on,
club-bearing, of Heracles, Eust.1699.31.
r(opa^l-w/dhs, es, t. t. of the pulse, invented by Archig., Gal.8.943.
r(opa^/l-wsis, ews, h(, name of a disease of the hair, Id.19.430.

r(opa^l-wto/s, h/, o/n, as if from r(opalo/w,
club-shaped, ku/lic D.C.72.18.

r(op-h/, h(, (r(e/pw)
turn of the scale, fall of the scale-pan, weight, Arist. Cael.307b33; me/xri tou= me/sou th\n r(. e)/xein
gravitate to . ., ib.297a28;
downward momentum, tw=| mei/zoni ba/rei kai\ r(. plei/wn pare/petai Ph. Bel.69.21; r(. poiei=n make (counter-)
weight, Thphr.CP5.4.7; a( ga= e)rh/reistai e)pi\ ta=s au)ta=s r(.
in equilibrium, Ti.Locr.97e; diastrefo/ntwn th\n r(. disturbing the
balance, Plu.Cam.28. metaph.,
balancing, suspense, a) d' (sc. a) po/lis） e)/xetai r)o/pas Alc.25; r(. *di/kas A.Ch.61 (lyr.); e)n ou)=n r(. toia=|de keime/nw| S.Tr.82; pontonau=tai . . leptai=s e)pi\ r(oph=sin e)mpola\s makra\s a)ei\ pararri/ptontes staking distant ventures on nice
balancings, Id.Fr.555 ( = Philol.88.2); r(. bi/ou moi the
turning-point or
sinking-point of life, i.e. death, Id.OC1508; r(. 'stin h(mw=n o( bi/os w(/sper o( zugo/s Men.Mon.465.
turn of the scale, poiei=n r(.
turn the scale, Arist.Pol.1295b38; tou= pole/mou Isoc.12.50; polla/kis mikrai\ duna/meis mega/las ta\s r(. e)poi/hsan Id.4.139; mega/lhn e)/sesqai th\n r(., ei) . . Id.14.33; ei)s e(ka/tera ta\ me/rh r(opa\s lamba/nonta to\n po/lemon Plb.1.20.7, cf. Trag.Adesp.102: hence,
decision, outcome, ble/pw du/o r(.: h)\ ga\r qanei=n dei= m' . . h)\ . . E.Hel.1090; a)sqenei=s kai\ e)pi\ r(. mia=s o)/ntes at the mercy of a single
weighing in the scales, Th.5.103.
weight placed in the scale-pan, Arist.Mech.850a13; esp.
small additional weight, make-weight, casting weight, IG22.1013.35, al.; w(s r(. e)k plasti/ggwn LXX Wi.11.22; w(s r(. zugou= e)logi/sqhsan 'as
dust in the balance', ib.Is.40.15; ou)d' o(/son r(. Herod.7.33. metaph., smikra\ palaia\ sw/mat' eu)na/zei r(.
casting weight, S.OT961; sw=ma nosw=des smikra=s r( . . dei=tai proslabe/sqai pro\s to\ ka/mnein Pl.R.556e; de/dorke fw=s e)pi\ smikra=s r(. E.Hipp.1163, cf. Plu.Art.30. dei= r(. dido/nai tai=s au(tw=n patri/si tou\s suggrafe/as give the
casting weight to . ., Plb. 16.14.6.
weight, decisive influence, w(s toi=sde kai\ di\s a)ntishkw=sai r(oph=| A.Pers.437; mega/lh ga\r r(., ma=llon de\ o(/lon, h( tu/xh para\ pa/nta ta\ pra/gmata D.2.22; r(. e)/xein have
influence, Id.11.8, cf. SIG761.5 (Delph., i B.C.); e)/xei ti bri=qos kai\ r(. pro\s to\n bi/on Arist.EN1101a29, cf. 1094a23, 1172a23; plei/sthn pare/xetai r(. ei)s to\ nika=n Plb.6.52.9.
decisive moment, crisis (i.e.
victory), kai\ to\n *balaa\m . . a)pe/kteinan e)n th=| r(. LXX Jo.13.22: so generally,
moment, pro\s mi/an r(. . . diefqa/rh in one
moment, ib.Wi.18.12; u(sta/thn bi/ou r(. au(toi=s e)kei/nhn do/cantes ei)=nai ib.3 Ma.5.49; e)n r(oph=s kairw=| braxei= AP11.289 (Pall.).
discount deducted from a payment, PLond.3.780.4 (vi A.D.), POxy.143.3 (vi A.D.), etc.; perh.
illicit commission, Cod. Just.4.59.1.1.

r(op-iko/s, h/, o/n,
inclined, pro\s th\n sunousi/an Antig.Mir. 115 (Comp.).
r(opti/on: kleidi/on, Hsch.

r(o/pton, to/,
operating-table, IG42(1).122.41 (Epid., iv B.C.).
r(opto/s, h/, o/n, （r(o/fw） = r(ofhto/s, Hp. ap. Gal.19.136.

r(o/ptron, to/, (r(e/pw)
the wood in a trap which falls when touched and catches the mouse, Archil.90, Poll.7.115: metaph., di/khs e)/paisen au)to\n r(. E.Hipp.1172.
musical instrument of the Corybantes,
tambourine or
kettle-drum, Corn.ND30, Luc.Trag. 36, Orph.Frr.105,152, AP6.74 (Agath.); r(. bursopagh= kai\ koi=la peritei/nantes h)xei/ois xalkoi=s Plu.Crass.23; cf. r(o/mbos A.1.3.
knocker on a door, E.Ion 1612 (troch.), Ar.Fr.39, Lys.6.1, X.HG6.4.36; cf. r(o/palon 111.

r(osa=ton, to/,= Lat.
rosatum, Edict.Diocl.2.19 (r(oss-), Alex.Trall. 1.16.
r(otari/a: toru/nion, Hsch. (cf. r(ata/nan, brata/nan).

r(ou/a, h(,
road, SIG1231.11 (Nicomedia, iii/iv A.D.). (Lat.
ru(g)a, Fr.
rue.）
r(ouboto/s: r(o/fhma, Hsch. r(ougo/s: pro/swpon, Id. (perh. r(u/gxos or a dialectal form r(ou/gxos).
r(ou/dion, to/,= klu/sma pro\s r(ou=n gunaikei=on, Aët.16.64.
r(oudo/n, v. r(udo/n. r(ouma/zetai: fri/ttei, Hsch. r(ou=s, o(, Att. contr. for r(o/os. v. r(o/on.

r(ou=s, o( and h(: uncontr. acc. sg. masc. r(o/on Hp.Mul.1.31; dat. sg. fem. r(o/w| ib.78; gen. r(ou= Id.Nat.Mul.32,34, Thphr.HP3.18.5 (fem.), etc.; but r(oo/s Hp.Mul.2.181, Dsc.1.108; dat. r(oi/+ interpol. in Dorio ap. Ath.7.309f:—
sumach, Rhus coriaria, Dsc. l.c.
its fruit, Sol.41, Antiph.142.2, Alex.127.6, PCair.Zen.83.4, 702.29 (iii B.C.); used in medicine, Hp. ll. cc.:—the fruit of one kind (r(. *suriakh/ Gal.19.741; r(. e)ruqro/s Hp.Mul.1.31, Gal.12.353, cf. 922) was used as a spice:— of another, in tanning, r(. bursodeyikh/ Hp.Mul.1.78; skutodeyiko/s Ruf. ap. Orib.8.24.3.
red ray, Lolium perenne, Dsc.4.43.

r(ousi/zw,
to be reddish, Gp.11.23.1.

r(ou/sios, on,
reddish, Lat.
russus, russeus, Dsc.4.130 (interpol.), Stud.Pal.20.245.18 (vi A.D.). oi( r(. the Red faction in the Circus, Lyd.Mens.4.30: sg., tou= r(ousse/ou Tab.Defix.Aud.242.53 (Carthage, iii A.D.); tou= r(wse/ou ib.160.80 (Rome, iv/v A.D.); r(o/seon *silouano/n ib.237.23 (Carthage, i A.D.):—cf. APl.5.386.
r(ousio/sta^xus, = r(ou=s 11, Ps.-Dsc.4.43.

r(ousiw/dhs, es,
of a reddish colour, Sch.Od.9.125.
r(oussa=toi, oi(, = r(ou/sioi 11, Lyd.Mens.4.30.
r(ou=to: tou=to, *makedo/nes, Hsch. r(ou/fisma, gloss on bro/gxos, Id.

r(of-e/w, A.Eu.264, Ar.V.906, etc.; also r(ofa/nw (r(u^f-), Hp. Morb.2.12, 19, etc.; r(ofa/w, PMag.Lond.121.182 (r(ofwme/nhn together with r(ofou=nti Colot. in Ly.7 [col. 9]), Sch. T Il.5.126:—fut. r(ofh/somai Ar.V.814; whence Elmsl. alters r(ofh/seis into -h/sei in Ach.278, Eq.360 (e)k-), Pax 716: aor. e)rro/fhsa Hp.Morb.2.42, Ar. Eq.51, (e)pek-) ib.701, (a)p-) X.Cyr.1.3.10:—Pass., aor. part. r(ofhqei/s Nic.Al.389:—a form r(u^fe/w (Ion. acc. to Phot.) occurs in Hippon. 132; aor. r(ufh=sai Ar.Fr.450; Med. r(ufh/sasqai Hp.Epid.7.11:—
sup greedily up, gulp down, a)po\ zw=ntos r(. e)ruqro\n . . pelano/n A.Eu.264(lyr.), cf. Ar.V.812,814, etc.; tinos
some of a thing, Luc.Lex.5; r(ofou=nta pi/nein w(/sper bou=n X.An.4.5.32: abs., Ar.Eq.51, V.906,982; of Charybdis, Arist.Mete.356b15.
drain dry, empty, tru/blion Ar. Ach.278, Eq.905; so r(. a)rthri/as, of the poison on the robe of Heracles, S.Tr.1055.
live on slops, opp. chro\n siti/on, Hp. VM6. (Cf. Lat.
sorbeo, Lith.
srebiù 'sip', etc.)

r(o/f-hma, Ion. r(u/f-, atos, to/,
that which is supped up, thick gruel or
porridge, opp. po/ma, Hp.Aph.7.68, VM5, Fist.7, Arist.Pr.863b6.
r(of-hma/tion, to/, Dim. of foreg., A.D.Conj.219.26.

r(of-hma^tw/dhs, es,
of the nature of a r(o/fhma,
gruel-like, Gal.6.247, Sor.1.98.

r(o/f-hsis, ews, h(,
supping up, opp. e)dwdh/, Arist.Mete.381a2.

r(of-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
drawing in, absorbing, tinos Str.15.1.38.

r(of-hto/s, h/, o/n,
that can be or
is supped up, Id.15.1.53, Dsc.5.107, Gal.6.706, Sor.2.11; cf. r(opto/s.
r(o/fia: ku/mata, h)\ r(o/qia, Hsch.
r(o/fisma, atos, to/, = r(o/fhma, Cyran.9.
r(o/fw, collat. form of r(ofe/w, EM705.26: hence r(o/mma, r(opto/s.

r(o/xa^non, to/,
strickle, Hsch.

r(oxq-e/w,
dash with a roaring sound, of the sea, r(o/xqei ga\r me/ga ku=ma poti\ cero/n Od.5.402; proti\ d' au)ta\s [pe/tras] ku=ma me/ga r(oxqei= 12.60; u(po\ ku/mati pe/trai r(o/xqeon
sounded with the dashing of the waves, A.R.4.925; r(oxqeu=sin de\ ka/lwes Opp.H.1.228.—Cf. o)rexqe/w.

r(o/xq-os, o(,
roaring, of the sea, Lyc.402,696,742, Nic.Al.390.
r(oxmo/s, v. r(wxmo/s.

r(ow/dhs (A), es,
with a strong stream, running violently, of a sea
in which there are strong currents, Th.4.24, Arist.Mete.366a25; to\ ma/lista r(. tou= pela/gous Ael.NA7.24: hence, of rocks, promontories, etc.,
exposed to such seas, krhmno/s Str.8.5.1; a)/krai Ael.NA14.24; to/poi r(. regions
of rapid currents, Arist.HA621a16, cf. Thphr.CP3.3.4. Medic.,

rhythm, opp. me/tron and a(rmoni/a, Ar. Nu.638 sq., Pl.R.397b, 398d, 601a, Arist.Rh.1403b31; lo/goi meta\ mousikh=s kai\ r(uqmw=n pepoihme/noi Isoc.15.46; of Prose rhythm, Arist.Rh.1408b29, D.H.Comp.17: defined by Aristox.Rhyth.1, Aristid.Quint.1.13. special phrases: e)n r(uqmw=| in
time, of dancing, marching, etc., bai/nein e)n r(. Pl.Lg.670b, cf. X.An.5.4.14; o)rxei=sqai Id.Cyr.1.3.10; e)n tw=| r(. a)napnei=n respire

form, shape of a thing, Democr.5i; identified by Arist. with sxh=ma, Metaph.985b16, 1042b14; mete/balon to\n r(. tw=n gramma/twn changed the

features of a country, D.P.271,620;
structure of a substance, kegxroeide\s tw=| r(., tw=| r(. spoggw=des, Dsc.5.77,118.
