dirt, filth, pollution, Apollon.Lex. s.v. lu/mata: but r(u^pasmo/s, o(, is f.l. in Eust.1849.12.

r(up-a/w, Ep. r(u^po/w,
to be filthy, slovenly, ma/la per r(upo/wnta kaqh=rai Od.6.87; r(wgale/a, r(upo/wnta 13.435; h)= o(/ti dh\ r(upo/w 19.72; nu=n d' o(/tti r(upo/w 23.115; r(upo/wnta de\ e(/sta xitw=na 24.227; r(upw=nta, kufo/n, a)/flion Ar.Pl.266; of the habits of Spartans and philosophers, e)rru/pwn, e)swkra/twn Ar.Av.1282; tou\s *puqagorista\s . . r(upa=n e(ko/ntas Aristopho 9.2, cf. Luc.Nec.4; ta\ r(upw=nta tw=n trauma/twn Ael.NA 14.4. Pass.,
to be filled with wax, of the ear, prob. in S.Fr. 858.

r(up-e/laion, to/,
foul, dirty oil, Paul.Aeg.7.17.
r(u^po/-eis, essa, en, = r(uparo/s, Nic.Al.470; o)/lph AP6.293 (Leon.); pi/nos ib.11.158 (Antip.).
r(u^po-ke/ramos, v. r(uparoke/ramos.

r(u^po-kibdoto/kwn, wnos, o(,
miser, 'dirty usurer', Cerc.4.10.

r(u^po-ko/ndu^los, on,
with dirty knuckles, esp. of one who imitates the Laconians, Pl.Com.124, Ar.Fr.718.

r(u/pon [u^], to/, = o)ro/s,
whey, Phot.

r(u/pos [u^], o(,
dirt, filth, used by Hom. once in heterocl.pl., ka/qhra/n te r(u/pa pa/nta Od.6.93: later in sg., Semon.7.63, A.Fr.82 (cf. Ar. Fr.892), Pl.Prm.130c, Eup.252, Alex.197, etc.; o( e)n toi=s w)si\ r(. Arist. Pr.960b18, cf. Artem.1.24, PMag.Osl.1.332; r(. o( a)po\ tw=n e)n toi=s gumnasi/ois a)ndria/ntwn Gal.12.116; to\n a)po\ tw=n o)nu/xwn r(u/pon Suid. s.v. gru/; a(/pan r(u/pon all of it
filth (acc.), Theoc.15.20; of a person, pro\s to\ mh\ lou=sqai r(u/pos Aristopho 10.4:—also r(u/pos, eos, to/, of cheese-
parings, Hp.Mul.1.64. metaph.,
sordidness, meanness, o( r(. tou= xamai\ bi/ou M.Ant.7.47.
sealing-wax, tou\s r(. a)naspa/sai Ar. Lys.1198.

r(u^po-fore/w,
wear dirty clothes, Sch.Ar.Av.1554, where Hemsterhuis cj. r(uparof.

r(u^po/-w,
make foul and filthy, befoul (cf. r(upa/w):— Pass.,
to be foul and filthy, Ep.pf. part. Pass., ei(/mata . . ta/ moi r(erupwme/na kei=tai Od.6.59, cf. Hp.Mochl.33, Mul.1.66; e)rrupwme/nos Sch. Ar.Ach.425; r(upwqh=nai Ph.Fr.9 H.:—Act., dub. l. in Thphr.Char. 15.6.

r(uppa^pai=, a cry of the Athenian rowers,
yoho! Ar.Ra.1073: hence comically, to\ r(. the
crew, one's messmates, Id.V.909; also r(upapai= AB446.—Cf. i(ppapai=.

r(u/p-teira, as if fem. of r(upth/r (which is only f.l. for a)ruth/r in Dsc. 2.74),
that cleanses from dirt, r(. koni/h
soap, lye, v.l. for qru/pteira in Nic. Al.370.
r(up-th/rion: kaqarth/rion, Suid. (post r(u/sion).

r(up-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
fit for cleansing from dirt, r(uptikwta/th ko/nis Plu.2.697a; -kh\ du/namis
detergent, Gal.10.565: c. gen., r(. tou= fa/ruggos
cleansing or
clearing the throat, Arist.Pr.903b29, cf. Pl.Ti.65d, Thphr.CP6.1.3: but c. gen. objecti, r(. chro/thtos
fit for cleaning it
off, Arist.Sens.443a1.
purgative, Id.Pr.873b1.

r(u/p-tw, (r(u/pos)
cleanse, wash, esp. with soap or lye, r(. ta\ i(ma/tia Id.Mete.359a22; ta\n glw=ttan Ti.Locr.100e; ta\s xei=ras Phylotim. ap. Ath.3.79c:—Med.,
wash oneself, Antiph.148.3, Thphr.HP9.9.3, f.l. in Nic.Al.530; aor. e)rru/yanto Ph.1.613; louome/nh ta\s tri/xas e)rru/pteto Polyaen.8.27: prov., e)c o(/tou 'gw\ r(u/ptomai ever since I
began to wash, i.e. from my childhood, Ar.Ach. 17.

r(up-w/dhs, es,
filthy, dirty, Dsc.1.73, Artem.2.4, al., Vett.Val. 249.25; [e)/mplastroi] mela/gxlwroi kai\ r(. w)nomasme/nai Gal.13.460, cf. Cels.5.19.15, al.
r(u_s-a/, = r(ush/, Phot., Suid.

r(u_s-ai/nomai, Pass.,
to be wrinkled, Nic.Al.78, AP14.103.

r(u_s-a^le/os, h, on,
wrinkled, o)pw/rh Nic.Al. 181.
r(u_s-a/w, = r(usai/nomai, Hsch. s.v. r(usoi=si.

r(u_s-h/, h(,
withering, decay, dub. in Suid.

r(u_/s-hma, atos, to/,
wrinkle, in pl., Phot., Suid.
r(u=sqai, v. e)ru/w (B).

r(u_si^-a/zw, Dor. r(u_tia/zw IG42(1).77.11,al. (Epid., ii B.C.):—
treat as a r(u/sion,
seize, distrain upon, ou) r(usia/zw, ta)ma\ d' eu(ri/skw fi/la E.Ion 523, cf. SIG629.20 (Delph., ii B.C.), al., Ph.1.638; of
plundering a city
as reprisal for stolen property, th\n po/lin D.S.8.7:—Pass.,
to be so treated, A.Supp.424 (lyr.), E.Ion1406, IGl.c.; ti/ r(usiasqei/s;
robbed of what? cj. in E.Heracl.163; of debtors at Rome, Plu.Cor.5: metaph., yeudo/deipna . . margw/shs gna/qou e)rrusia/sqh cj. in A.Fr. 258.

r(u_si^/-bwmos, on,
defending altars, Id.Eu.920 (lyr.).

r(u_si^/-difros, on,
preserving the chariot, of a charioteer, Pi.I.2.21.
r(u/silla, h(, = r(uti/s, Hsch.
r(u/si^mon [u^], to/, f.l. in Nic.Al.607.

r(u/sion [u_], Dor. r(u/tion SIG56.41 (Argos, v B.C.): to/: (e)ru/w (B)):—
surety, pledge.
property held or
seized as a pledge or
compensation, r(u/si' e)launo/menos driving off his cattle
in distraint, Il.11.674; r(u/sia do/ntes Sol.11.3 (v.l. r(u/mata
protection); mei=zon r(u/sion po/lei qh/seis: e)fa/yomai ga\r ou) tau/tain mo/nain, i.e. Oedipus shall himself be seized, not his daughters alone, as a
pledge or
surety to Thebes, S.OC858; e)page/tw r(u/tion de/ka stath/rwn shall impose a
pledge of ten staters, SIG l.c.; r(u/sion qei\s to\n pai=da J.BJ1.14.1; r(u/sia kata\ tw=n polemi/wn a)/gwn ib.1.19.2; r(u/sia tw=n xrhma/twn kai\ tw=n par' e)kei/nois lh|stw=n e)poiei=to Id.AJ16.9.2; th=s proqesmi/as parelqou/shs r(u/sia lamba/nein ib.16.10.8; r(u/sia kaqe/contes a)nq' w(=n . . a)fei/lonto . . *(rwmai=oi xrhma/twn D.H.5.33.
stolen property taken back as compensation for the theft, tou= r(usi/ou q' h(/marte A.Ag.535; r(usi/wn e)fa/ptores laying hands on
alleged stolen property, Id.Supp.728, cf. 412.
reprisals, fo/non fo/nou r(u/sion tei/sw suffer death as
reprisals for death, S.Ph.959; r(u/sia kath/ggeilan toi=s *(rodi/ois proclaimed
reprisals, Plb.4.53.2; kata\ r)r(u/sion
by way of distraint or
reprisals, IG12(2).15.19 (Mytil., iii B.C.); but kata\ r(u/sion prob.
in search of persons to seize and hold to ransom, ib.12(5).653.11 (Syros, i B.C.). r(u/sia, ta/, the
right of reprisals, h)|tou=nto r(u/sia tou\s *)a xaiou\s oi( *dh/lioi kata\ tw=n *)aqhnai/wn Plb.32.7.4; a)pe/dwke toi=s ai)toume/nois ta\ r(. kata\ tw=n *boiwtw=n granted the
right of reprisals against . . , Id.22.4.13. r(u/sia, ta/ (cf. r(u/sios),
restitution, deliverance, *)/epafos a)lhqw=s r(usi/wn e)pw/numos A.Supp.315.
offerings for deliverance, r(. a)na/gousin D.P.527; w)di/nwn r(. AP6.274 (Pers.).

r(u/sios [u_], on, （e)ru/w (B))
delivering, saving, A.Supp.150 (lyr.); r(u/sia yuxh=s dw=ra AP7.605 (Jul.Aegypt.). (e)ru/w (A)) r(usi/an bola/n: th\n tw=n to/cwn ta/sin, Hsch.

r(u_si/-polis [i^], ews, o(, h(,
saving the city, A.Th.129 (lyr.); r(. *danaw=n, opp. perse/polis *trw/wn, Poet. ap. Hld.3.2.

r(u_si/-ponos, on,
setting free from trouble, AP9.525.18.
r(u_si/-ptolis, poet. for r(usi/polis, Epigr.Gr. (add.) 888a (Ephesus).

r(u=sis, ews, h(, (e)ru/w (B))
deliverance, qana/tou from death, Epigr.Gr. 200 (Cos), LXX Si.51.9.

r(u/sis [u^], ews, h(, （r(e/w)
flow, u(/datos Pl.Lg.944b; ei)s to\ koilo/taton h( r(. Arist.Mete.355b17; opp. a)/mpwtis, ib.366a19; e)k r(inw=n ai(/matos -ies Hp.Aph.3.27; koili/hs ib.2.14; [e)lai/ou], i.e.
yield of oil, Thphr. HP4.14.10, PRev.Laws 60.16 (iii B.C.); flebw=n Arist.PA668a11; of fire, Thphr.Ign.54;
shedding, trixw=n Dsc.2.120, Gal.19.431; used for gono/rroia, LXX Le.15.2 sq.
course of a river, stream, potamo\s poiei=tai th\n r(. Plb.2.16.6, cf. D.H.1.9, D.S.4.35, Str.6.2.4. Math., [stigmh=s] r(u/sin fasi\n ei)=nai oi( gewme/trai th\n grammh/n (cf. r(ui/+skomai, r(e/w 1.5b) Iamb. in Nic.p.57 P., cf. Plot.3.7.3, Procl. in Euc.p.97 F.; oi(=on a)/strou r(. Arist.Mu.395b8.
r(u^si/s, i/dos, h(, = r(u^to/n, v.l. for xrusi/s in Cratin.124.
r(u/skomai, v. )ru/w (B). r(usmo/s, r(usmo/w, v. r(uqmo/s, r(uqmo/w.

r(u_so/karfos, on,
with shrivelled branches, Dsc.1.14, Anon.Lond.32.46.

r(u_so/s, h/, o/n,
shrivelled, wrinkled, Il.9.503, E.El.490, Ar.Pl.266, Pl. R.452b; r(usa\ sarkw=n polia=n katadru/mmata the tearing of old
wrinkled flesh (cf. r(uti/s), E.Supp.49 (lyr.); r(. bouleuth/ria, prob. = r(usoi\ bouleutai/, Theopomp.Com.75; masto/s Sor.1.88; e(/lkos Gal.10.404; r(uso/teron ballanti/wn pro/swpon Alciphr.3.55; r(. e)pisku/nion AP6.64 (Paul. Sil.); also of fruits, etc., [a)kro/drua] i)sxna\ kai\ r(. Plu.2.735d; e)lai=ai Archestr.Fr.7; su=ka Philostr.Im.1.31.—The forms r(usso/s, r(ussai/nomai, etc., are freq. in codd.

r(u_so/-ths, htos, h(,
wrinkledness, wrinkles, Plu.Galb.13, Antyll. ap. Orib.44.8.2.

r(u_so-xi/twn [i^], wnos, o(, h(,
with shrivelled coat or
skin, ko/kkos Orph.L.721 (prob. for xrus-).

r(u_so/w, (r(uso/s)
make wrinkled, shrivel, Dsc.5.92, Hippiatr.11, Sch. Od.13.401:—Pass.,
to be or
become wrinkled, shrivel, de/rma Arist.Pr. 937a9; r(eruswme/nai, of skins
hung loosely on xelw=nai, opp. proteino/menai, Apollod.Poliorc.142.4; of fruits, Dsc.5.6.14, Gp.7.18.3, 10.38.10.
r(ussai/nomai, r(usso/s, r(usso/omai, etc., v. r(uso/s.

r(u/s-tagma, atos, to/,
dragging away, maltreatment, in pl., Lyc. 1089.

r(us-ta/zw, Frequentat. of e)ru/w (A),
drag about, polla\ r(usta/zesken . . peri\ sh=ma
he dragged it many times round the grave of Patroclus, Il.24.755; dmw|a\s . . r(usta/zontas a)eikeli/ws kata\ dw/mata Od.16.109; cf. sq.

r(us-taktu/s, u/os, h(,
dragging about, rough handling, 18.224.

r(us-th/r, h=ros, o(, rare and late form for r(uth/r (B),
deliverer, Tryph.266.
rein, Phot.; cf. bru/thr. perh. to be read for r(hsth/r,
ladle of an irrigating-machine, PLond.1821.210.

r(u/s-ths, ou, o(, (e)ru/w (B))
saviour, leliverer, LXXPs.17(18).2, al., Ps.-Luc. Philopatr.6.

r(us-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
protective, saving, [pra=cis] PMag.Berol.1.197; xarakth=res ib.266, cf. PMag.Par.1.9.
r(usto/n: do/ru, *krh=tes, Hsch.

r(u_s-w/dhs, es,
wrinkled-looking, AP5.75 (Rufin.), Dsc.5.79.

r(u_/s-wsis, ews, h(,
wrinkling, an eye-disease, Gal.14.767.
r(u_ta/, ta/, v. r(u_to/s (B) 2.

r(u_ta^gwgeu/s, e/ws, o(,
rope of a horse's halter, X.Eq.7.1, Poll.10.55; cf. r(uth/r (A) 2b.
r(u/te<*>ra [u_], h(, fem. of r(uth/r (B), Suid.

r(u_th/, h(, Peloponnesian word for ph/ganon,
rue, Nic.Al.306, Th. 523, Aret.CD2.5, Hippiatr.130; r(ute/wn f.l. for brute/wn in Aret.SD2.9.

r(u_th/r (A), h=ros, o(, (e)ru/w (A))
one who draws or
stretches, r(. biou=, o)i+stw=n,
drawer of the bow, of arrows, Od.21.173, 18.262.
strap by which one holds a horse, rein, Il.16.475 (pl.); speu/dein a)po\ r(uth=ros
with loose rein, at full gallop, S.OC900; a)po\ r(. e)lau/nein tou\s i(/ppous D.H.4.85, cf. 11.33, D.S.19.26 (Phryn.PSp.41 B. expl. a)po\ r(. by a)/neu xalinou=): r(uth=ra xalino/n Pancrat.Oxy.1085.4; xalino\n . . e)/xon r(uth=ras PCair.Zen.659.11 (iii B.C.).
strap to flog with, D.19.197, Aeschin.2.157, cf. S.Aj.241 (anap.), Fr.501.

r(u_th/r (B), h=ros, o(, (e)ru/w (B))
saviour, guard, defender, staqmw=n r(. Od.17.187,223; r(uth=res *dio/s Opp.C.3.13: fem. abs., Id.H.1.669; cf. r(u/teira. (Cf. r(usth/r 1.)
r(utia/zw, v. r(usia/zw.

r(u^ti^do/floios, on,
with shrivelled rind, su=kon AP6.22 (Zon.).

r(u^ti^d-o/w,
make wrinkled, shrivel up, Arist.Pr.936b10:—Pass.,
to be wrinkled, r(utidou/menoi [o)fqalmoi/] Hp.Epid.6.1.13; de/rma e)rrutidwme/non Arist.HA578a9, cf. GA780a32; fu/lla Thphr.HP3.10.3; mh=lon Dsc.1.115; th\n o)/yin e)rrutidwme/nos Luc.Luct.16; of bandages, Sor.1.83.

r(u^ti^d-w/dhs, es,
wrinkled-looking, gaste/res Hp.Prorrh.2.23, cf. Arist.HA604a28; ta\ r(. tw=n prosw/pwn Id.Phgn.808a8; fu/llon -e/steron Thphr.HP4.6.6.

r(u^ti^/d-wma, atos, to/,
wrinkle, Sch.Ar.Pl. 1052, 1066.

r(u^ti^/d-wsis, ews, h(,
wrinkling, contraction, e.g. of the eye, Gal.10.171 (pl.), Ruf.Fr.78.
r(u/tion, v. r(u/sion. v. r(u^to/s.

r(u^ti/s, i/dos, h(, Aeol. bru^ti/s (q.v.),
pucker, wrinkle, Ar.Pl.1051, Pl. Smp.190e, 191a.
r(u/tis [u^], ews, h(,= r(u/sis, in a play on words, Ps.-Democr. ap. Zos. Alch.p.119B.

r(u/tisma [u^], atos, to/,
darn or
patch, Men.1059 (pl.).
r(u_to/n, to/,= ph/ganon, Cratin.270; cf. r(uth/.
r(u^to/n, to/, v. r(u^to/s 11.

r(u_to/s (A), h/, o/n,
quarried, r(utoi=sin la/essi Od.6.267, 14.10. (Cf. Lat.
rāta caesa.）

r(u_to/s (B), h/, o/n, (e)ru/w (A))
dragged, hauled, sani/des Ph.Bel.95.48 (s.v.l.). Subst. neut. pl. r(u_ta/, ta/,
reins (cf. r(uth/r (A) 2a), r(uta\ xalai/nein Hes.Sc.308.

r(u^to/s, h/, o/n, (r(e/w)
flowing, fluid, liquid, r(uta=s e)c a(lo/s A.Ag.1408 (lyr.); r(. po/roi (v. po/ros 1.3) Id.Eu.452; r(utw=n u(da/twn loutra/ S.OC 1598; paga/ E.Hipp.123 (lyr.); u(gro\n r(., opp. pakto/n, Ti.Locr.99c; [u(/data] r(. distd. fr. sta/sima, Arist.Mete.353b19, cf. Thphr.CP2.6.3; distd. fr. freatiai=a, Plu.2.954c. r(u^to/n, to/,
drinking-cup or
horn, running to a point, where was a small hole, through which the wine ran in a thin stream, S.Fr.772, D.21.158, PPetr.3p.113 (iii B.C.), Inscr.Délos442B27 (ii B.C.), Plb.14.11.2, Plu.Alex.67; made in the form of an elephant, a trireme, the god *bhsa=s, Damox.1.2, Epin.2.1, Hedyl. ap. Ath.11.497d;
funnel used as a filter, Ps.-Democr. ap. Zos. Alch.p.155B.; v. krouni/zw:—Dim. (ru/tion [u^], to/, only in Lat. form
rhytium, Mart.2.35.2.
r(u=tra: luth/ria, swth/ria, sw=stra, Hsch.

r(u/tros, eos, to/, a plant with prickles at the ends,
globe-thistle, Echinops viscosus, Thphr.HP6.4.4.
r(u/trus: xu/tas, Hsch.

r(u/twr (A) [u_], oros, o(, （e)ru/w (A))
one who draws, xruse/wn r(. to/cwn, of Apollo, Ar.Th.108 (lyr.).

r(u/twr (B) [u_], oros, o(, （e)ru/w (B))
saviour, deliverer, defender, po/lews A.Th.318 (lyr.); swfrosu/nhs r(. kai\ bio/tou IG3.1171.6; r(. boukoli/wn AP6.37; r(. xai/tas kekru/falos ib.207 (Arch.): c.gen.objecti,
one who saves or
delivers from, limou= kai\ qana/tou ib.9.351 (Leon.Alex.). r(u/toras: tou\s qallou\s tou\s kaqarthri/ous, Hsch.
r(u^fa/nw, r(u^fe/w, r(u/fhma, Ion. for r(ofa/nw, -e/w, -hma (qq.v.).
*r(u/fw, in aor. inf. r(u/yai: . . r(ofh=sai, and fut. r(uyo/meqa: . . r(ofhso/meqa, Hsch. r(uxa/nhsis, v. r(uka/nhsis. r(uxa/xetos, v. r(ua/xetos.

r(u/yis, ews, h(, (r(u/ptw)
cleansing, purifying, Pl.Ti.65e, Ti.Locr.100e.

r(u^w/dhs, es, (r(e/w)
running, flowing; of persons, r(. ta\ ou)=ra
incontinent of urine, Hp.Art.48; spe/rma polu\ kai\ r(.
flowing freely, Pl.Ti. 86c, cf. d; of fevers,
continuous or
frequent, Gal.19.552 (nisi r(ow/dhs legend.).

r(wbi/das, a, o(, at Sparta,
boy of less than one year old, *le/ceis *(hrodo/tou in Stein Herodotus ii p.465 (Berol.1871).

r(wbiko/s, h/, o/n,
unable to pronounce the letter r(w=, r(wbikw/teros D.L. 2.108.

r(wg-a^le/os, h, on, (r(w/c A)
broken, cleft, xitw\n xalkw=| r(. Il.2.417; r(. ph/rh
torn, ragged, Od.17.198; r(a/kos . . h)de\ xitw=na, r(wgale/a 13.435.

r(wg-a/s, a/dos, o(, h(,= foreg.,
ragged, ph/rh Babr.86; r(. pe/trai
cloven rocks,
clefts in the rocks, Theoc.24.95, cf. A.R.4.1448, Nic. Th.389; ka/petos r(. Posidipp. ap. Ath.8.414e.
r(wg-h/, h(, in pl. r(wgai/: r(h/ceis, Hsch.
r(wg-ma^ti/as, ou, Ion. r(wg-i/hs, o(,= r(hgmati/as, Hp. ap. Gal. 19.136.

r(wg-mh/, h(,= r(wgh/,
fracture, Hp.VC3; r(. cu/lou
cleft, Arist.HA 614b15, cf. 556a5.

r(wg-moeidh/s, e/s,
like a fracture, r(afai/ Hp.VC12.
r(wgmo/s, v. r(wxmo/s (B). r(w/digges: plhgai\ u(/faimoi diakekomme/nai, oi( de\ mw/lwpes, Hsch. (also r(w/tigges Id.). r(w|dio/n: to\n e)rw|dio/n, Id., cf. Hippon.63.

r(w/qwn, wnos, o(,
nose, Heraclid.Tar. ap. Gal.12.692, Hippiatr.21: mostly in pl.,
nostrils, Nic.Th.213, Al.117, D.H.Comp.14,22, Str.7.4.8, Poll.2.72, Horap.2.68:—r(w/qunes: mukth=res, Hsch. (Aeol. ?).
r(w/komai: o)rgi/zomai, lupou=mai, *la/kwnes, Hsch.:—r(w/kwsa (r(wkw=sa cod.): pri/ousa tou\s o)do/ntas, Id. (Cf. r(w/xw.)
r(w=ma: r(w/mhn, i)sxu/n, o(/rmhma, w(s gnw=ma gnw/mhn, Hsch.

*(rwma^-i/+zw,
speak Latin, App.Hann.41, Philostr.VA5.36.
hold with Rome, be of the Roman party, App.Pun.68, Mac.7, al.

*(rwma^-i+ko/s, h/, o/n, Roman, Plb.30.18.3, al.; daktuli/dion BCH29.537 (Delos, ii B.C.): Sup. -kw/tatos AP9.502 (Pall.). Adv. -kw=s in Latin, ibid.;
in Roman fashion, Ptol.Euerg.7J., Plu.Aem.13: Comp., J.BJ2.20.7.

*(rwm-ai=os, a, on,
a Roman, Plb.10.36.3, etc.; ta\ *(rwmai=a
ludi Romani, D.C.37.8.

*(rwm-aio/ths, htos, h(,
Roman citizenship, Notiz. Arch.4.20 (Cyrene, i B.C.).
*(rwm-a^i/+s, i/+dos, h(, fem. of *(rwmai=os, paidei/a Dam. ap. Suid.s.v. *markelli=nos.

*(rwma^-i+sth/s, ou=, o(,
actor of Latin comedies, IG11(2).133.81 (Delos, ii B.C.).
*(rwma^-i+sti/, Adv. in Latin, App.Mith.2, Plu.2.318d, etc.

r(wma^l-eo/omai, Pass.,
to be endued with strength, Arist.Phgn.809a32.

r(wma^l-e/os, a, on, (r(w/mh)
strong of body, r(. tw=| sw/mati Pl.Ax.365a; h(liki/a| Aen.Tact.1.8 (Sup.); ka/mhloi PFlor.278 ii 6, al. (iii A.D.); kata\ xei=ra Plu.2.597e; r(. w)=moi Arist.Phgn.809b27; -w/tatos e)n tw=| le/gein Plu.CG4. of things,
strong, r(wmalew/terai pe/dai Hdt.3.22; r(i/zai Dsc.1.16 (Sup.); bi/otos
robust, virile, AP7.413 (Antip.). Adv. -e/ws Gal.6.139, Them.Or.21.249c.

r(w/mh, h(, (r(w/omai)
bodily strength, might, Xenoph.2.11, Hdt.1.31, 8.113; gui/wn r(. A.Pers.913 (anap.); mei=zon h)\ kat' e)ma\n r(w/man S.Tr. 1019(lyr.); e)p' a)sqenou=s r(w/mhs o)xou/meq' E.Or.69; a)kmazou/sh| th=| r(w/mh| tw=n xeirw=n xrw/menos Antipho 4.3.3, cf. Agatho 27; ei)/ tw| . . proli/poi h( r(. kai\ to\ sw=ma, i.e. his bodily
strength, Th.7.75; o( meta\ r(w/mhs gigno/menos qa/natos in the
full strength or
vigour of life, Id.2.43; u(gi/eian kai\ r(. Pl.Phdr.270b; th\n i)sxu\n deina\ kai\ th\n r(. Id.Smp.190b; r(. kai\ to/lmh| D.18.220; r(w/mhs a)kmh/ Eub.7.6: pl., pisteu/ontes tai=s au(tw=n r(. Lys.24.16; tai=s tw=n swma/twn r(. X.Cyr.3.3.19. of nations, armies, and the like , th\n parou=san nu=n r(. po/lews Th.4.18. of things,
strength, force, might, doro/s E.Supp.26; pni/gous Pl.Lg. 633c; pneu/mat' a)ne/mwn ou)k a)ei\ r(w/mhn e)/xei E.HF102; also r(. yuxh=s X.Cyr.4.2.14; h(donw=n Pl.Lg.841a; tou= le/gein ib.711e; lo/gou Id.Phdr.267a; h( tw=n lo/gwn r(. Cratin.Jun.7.3. ou) mia=| r(w/mh| not single-handed, S.OT123:
a force, i.e.
army, X.An.3.3.14, HG7.4.16.
confidence, toi=s *lakedaimoni/ois e)gege/nhto/ tis r(., dio/ti tou\s *)aqhnai/ous e)no/mizon diplou=n to\n po/lemon e)/xontas . . eu)kaqairetwte/rous e)/sesqai Th.7.18, cf. 42, 4.29.

*(rw/mh, h(,
Roma, Rome, first mentioned in Gr. literature by Arist. Fr.610; deified in Inscrr., qea\ *(rw/mh IG3.63, CIG2696 (Mylasa), SIG893 (Olympia, iii A.D.), etc.
r(w/msin (acc. sg.), v. r(w/y (B). r(w/nicis, v. r(w/y (B). r(w/nios: a)/cios, plou/sios, Hsch. (fort. vw/nios).

r(w/nnu_mi, Hp.Alim.2; r(wnnu/w, Ti.Locr.103e, Gal.6.581: fut. r(w/sw （e)pir-) Plu.2.9e: aor. e)/rrwsa Arat.335, Plu.Pomp.76, (e)p-) Hdt.8.14, Th.4.36:—Pass., r(w/nnu^mai Plu.Rom.25, Cor.24, etc.: fut. r(wsqh/somai Apollod.1.6.3, (e)pir-) Luc.Somn.18: aor. e)rrw/sqhn Th.4.72, Pl.Phdr.238c, (e)p-) S.OC661: pf. e)/rrwmai (v. infr.):—
strengthen, trofh\ r(w/nnusi Hp. l.c.; r(. ta\n yuxa\n pot' （= pro\s） a)lka/n Ti.Locr. 103b; o(rma/n ib.e; ta\s po/leis Plu.Per.19: but mostly in pf. Pass. (with pres. sense) e)/rrwmai, and plpf. e)rrw/mhn (as impf.):—
have strength or
might, ge/ronte/s e)smen kou)damw=s e)rrw/meqa E.Heracl.636; e)rrw=sqai th\n yuxh/n X.HG3.4.29; so e)rrw/sqh xrh/masin Plu.Publ. 23.
to be eager, enthusiastic, glossed by proqumei=sqai, Cratin. 411; e)/rrwnto e)s to\n po/lemon Th.2.8, cf. 8.78, 4.72: c. inf.,
to be eager to do, e)/rrwto pa=s cunepilamba/nein Id.2.8, cf. Lys.13.31, Pl.Smp. 176b.
to be in good health, Th.7.15: freq. in imper. e)/rrwso,
farewell, the usual way of ending a letter, as in X.Cyr.4.5.33, and at the close of Pl.Ep.1, 2, and 10; e)/rrwso polla/ Men.Georg.84; e)/rrwsqe Id.Pk.50; also fra/zein tini\ e)rrw=sqai Pl.Phd.61b, D.18.152, 19.248; ei) e)/rrwsai . . kalw=s a)\n e)/xoi, e)rrw/meqa de\ kai\ au)toi/ PPetr.2p.27 (iii B.C.); ei) e)/rrwsqe eu)= a)\n e)/xoi IG7.413 (Oropus, Senatus consultum, i B.C.), cf. SIG768 (Epist. Aug.). freq. in part. e)rrwme/nos (q.v.).

r(w/c (A), r(wgo/s, h(, （r(h/gnumi)
breach: in Od.22.143, a)na\ r(w=gas mega/roio, the sense is dub.; it seems to mean
narrow entrances or
passages leading to the hall.

r(w/c (B), r(wgo/s, h( （o( in LXXIs.65.8),= r(a/c 1, Archil.191; tou= a)mpelw=nos LXX Le.19.10, cf. Ph.2.390 (v.l.); e)lai/as LXX Is.17.6. = r(a/c 4, in pl., Ruf. ap. Orib.25.1.32. = r(a/c 3, Nic.Th.716.

r(w/omai, Ep. Verb, of which Hom. uses 3pl. impf. e)rrw/onto, Ep. r(w/onto, and 3pl. aor. e)rrw/santo (v. infr.); aor. subj. r(w/sontai or -wntai Call.Del.175: Nic. has also r(w/eto, Th.351; later in pres., Orph.L.707 (prob.), D.P.518 codd.:—
move with speed or
violence, rush on, esp. of warriors, Il.11.50, 16.166, cf. Hes.Sc.230; teu/xesin e)rr. purh\n pe/ri
ran round it, Od.24.69; *numfa/wn, ai(/ t' a)mf' *)axelw/i+on e)rrw/santo
dance, Il.24.616 (cf. e)pirrw/omai 1.2): c. acc. cogn., xoro\n e)rrw/santo
they ply the dance, h.Ven.261; u(po\ r(w/onto a)/nakti
they moved supporting their lord, Il.18.417; knh=mai r(w/onto, gou/nata e)rrw/santo, ib.411, Od.23.3; also of horses' manes, e)rrw/onto meta\ pnoih=|s a)ne/moio
waved streaming in the wind, Il.23.367.
r(w=|on, to/,= *trw/wn oi)=nos, Theognost. Can.148 (who derives it from r(w/w). r(w/paes, to/, sine expl., ib.131.
r(wp-a/kion, to/, Dim. of sq., Suid.
r(wp-a/s, a/dos, h(,= r(w/y (A), Opp.C. 4.393; so r(w=pac, a^kos, o(, Suid.
r(wp-ei=on, to/, v. r(wph/i+on.

r(wp-eu/w,
cut down underwood, AP6.226 (Leon., but r(wpei=on is prob.). (r(w=pos) = r(wpopwle/w, Hsch.

r(wp-h/eis, essa, en,
grown with underwood, a)/gkos Q.S.7.715.

r(wp-h/i+on, to/, Ep. word (Att. form r(wpei=on dub., v. r(wpeu/w 1), only used in pl.,
bushes, brushwood, underwood, r(wph/i+a pukna/ Il.13.199, 23.122, etc.; kata/ te r(wph/i+a du/w 21.559.

r(wp-i/zw, (r(w=pos) perh.
deal in petty wares, but variously glossed, Ion Trag.31.

r(wp-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for petty wares, trumpery, Plu.Lyc. 9; dw=ron AP6.355 (Leon.); of persons, Plb.23.5.5; r(wpika\ gra/yasqai paint
poorly, coarsely, APl.c.; [h( fu/sis] ou)de\n e)/xousa r(. Erasistr. ap.Plu.2.495c: to\ r(.
tawdry ornaments in writing,
claptrap, Longin. 3.4.

r(wpi/on, to/, (r(w/y A) = r(wpei=on,
bush, twig, bough, D.C.63.28.

r(wpo-gra^fi/a, h(, '
artificial prettiness' of scenery, Cic.Att.15.16b.

r(wpo-gra/fos [gra^], on, （r(w=pos)
one that paints petty subjects (r(w=pes, glossed as u(/lh kai\ u(lw/dh futa/), such as
still life, like the Dutch masters, EM705.55, perh. to be read in Donat.ad Ter.Eun. 253; cf. r(uparogra/fos.

r(wpo-perperh/qra, h(, (pe/rperos)
empty braggart talk, Com.Adesp.294 (restored fr. Plu.Dem.9).

r(wpo-pwle/w,
deal in small wares or
frippery, Hsch. s.v. r(wpeu/ein.

r(wpo-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
dealer in petty wares, huckster, LXX Ne.3.31 (written r(obo-, v.l. r(opo-), Gal.12.252, al., prob. in Jahresh.23 Beibl.172 (Thrace); written r(opo-, Maiuri
Nuova Silloge 634 (Cos).

entryFree.sense:
rimentarium (fort.
pimentarium, cf. r(w=pos 2 and pimenta/rios), Gloss.

div0.entryFree:
r(w=pos, o(,
petty wares, o(/stis r(w=pon e)ca/gei xqono/s A.Fr.263; o( r(. o(
 su\ perife/reis Diph.55; a)/praton ei)=nai to
 r(. D.34.9; e)/laion kai\ a)/llon nautiko
 r(. Arist.Mir.844a19; u(ala= skeu/h kai\ a)/llos r(. toiou=tos Str.4.5.3, cf. 8.6.16. = mei=gma xrw/matos, Sch.Porph.Abst.4.3.

r(wro/s, a/, o/n, (r(w/nnumi)
strong, mighty, Hsch.; cf. r)a/ros.

r(w=sis, ews, h(, (r(w/nnumi)
strengthening, trength, r(. kai\ qre/yis swma/twn S.E.M.11.97; r(w=sin eu)/casqai/ tini OGI206 (Nubia, ii or iii A.D.); koinh\n a(/pasi pori/zetai r(w=sin Chor.in Lib.4p.524R.
encouragement, tou= *(/ektoros Sch.Il.Oxy.1087 i 13.
violence, tou= pa/qous Porph.Abst.1.38;
preponderance, tou= xei/ronos h)/qous Plot.3.4.3.

r(wskome/nws, Adv. pres. part., as if from a Verb r(w/skomai = r(w/nnumai,
strongly, Hp.Cord.1.

r(w=stac, a^kos, o(,
stand for putting anything on, Tz.H.11.612.
r(wsth/r: sfu=ra, Hsch. (cf. r(aisth/r).
r(ws-th/rion, to/,= parormhth/rion, Phot.

r(ws-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
strengthening, Dsc.5.6.10, Gal.6.604 (interpol.), Philagr. ap. Orib.5.17.6.
strong, Gal.17(1).43.

r(w=stron: e)/mbolon, Hsch. (i.e. Lat.
rostrum). r(wta^ki/zw,
make overmuch or
wrong use of the letter r(, Suid. r(w/tigges, v. r(w/digges.

r(wx-mh/, h(,= sq. (A), in pl.,
fissures, Marc.Sid.79.

r(wx-mo/s (A), o(, (r(w/c A)
cleft, r(. e)/hn gai/hs
a runnel or
gutter scooped out by heavy rains, Il.23.420, cf. A.R.4.1545, Bion Fr.1, Opp.C.3.323; th=s pe/tras Plu. Crass.4; oi( a)po\ tw=n seismw=n r(. Str.8.5.7.

r(wx-mo/s (B), o(,
wkeezing, Aret.SD1.11 (written r(wgmo/s), Aët.6.3 (written r(oxmo/s); gloss on r(e/gxos, Erot.; written r(ogmo/s in Cael.Aur.CP2.27; r(ogxo/s, ib. 10.

r(w/x-w,
wheeze, Sor.1.123; but r(w/xein,= bru/xein toi=s o)dou=si, Hsch.

r(w/y (A), h(, gen. r(wpo/s,
shrub, bush, sg.only in Hsch., who has r(w/y: bota/nh a(palh/: elsewh. only in pl.,
underwood, brushwood, Od.10.166, 14.49, 16.47; r(w=pes ei)s ske/phn Lib.Or.11.254; i(mantw/dh futa/, acc. to Eust.1750.2.

r(w/y (B), ploi=on papu/rinon, o(\ kalei=tai *ai)guptisti\ r(w/y UPZ 81 ii 7 (ii B.C.); e)a\n de\ mh\ e)/xhte ploi=on, sunembh/shte a(/ma h(mi=n ei)s r(w/msin PPar. in Glotta 2.150; corrupted to r(w/nicis: potami/as new\s ei)=dos, in Hsch. [r(w/y from *r(wms; Egyptian
rms.]
r(w/w, v. r(w=|on.
